column3: High CPU load/App not responding when sending/receiving messages
column4: With the latest TextSecure my friend and I experience the following problem:  When sending a message or when receiving a message the app is responding slowly/lagging.  Example: - Type a message - Send message - Right after sending the message type a new message   => Keys are not processed, the app reacts slowly/lags  Example: - Type a message - App receives a message   => Keys are not processed, the app reacts slowly/lags  After a few seconds everything is working smoothly again

column3: Automatic backup
column4: With regards to #1705 I would propose automatic daily backups.  There things to consider: If a person has not set up a passphrase, would an automatic backup be of security concerns? That would introduce the need for another UI-element, which is not an option when sticking to the development ideology. And only having automatic backups after setting up a passhprase is opaque.  So I guess the best solution would be to bring in Flock: Let's enable automatic backups only if Flock is present and in a way that only Flock can access the (maybe unsecured) backup-data.

column3: Add "%s selected" subtitle to Conversation List batch mode.
column4: While looking how to implement the action bar in the coversation itself, I had a look at how it was done in the conversation list and noticed that the xml there was containing code to show how many items currently are selected - but this code was never used.  Also, this can be done simply by mode.setTitle and mode.setSubtitle, no need for a whole xml. So I removed the xml and implemented the code.  Now, when more than 1 item is selected, the subtitle shows "%s selected" (new string to be translated).

column3: message-viewed receipts
column4: While it's nice to have receipts that a message has been received (i.e. by the receiving TextSecure app), in some cases it would be even better to have to know if a message has been _viewed_.  By default, this might be too much information to provide, but it would be nice if a user could specify that s/he wants to make this information available to a set of other users.

column3: Enable sender to delete own messages from all parties in the conversation
column4: While I think this is an important feature, some people were opposed to self-destructing messages. I would take it even further and do similar to [Gliph](https://gli.ph/), where anyone in a conversation can delete messages. A risk with Gliph is their effectively central control*, which the TextSecure team seems to have solved very elegantly.  _* Gliph is quite [transparent](https://gli.ph/privacy.html), and have what they call [Lockdown™ Privacy Protection](https://blog.gli.ph/2012/05/31/introducing-gliph-app-version-1-2-powerful-privacy-for-iphone/). Unfortunately, the fact remains they are in control of the infrastructure and could theoretically capture the passphrase next time you login. Meaning we have to trust them._  > Messages I send other people should disappear on my terms. The sender should have control over her messages, as she's the one providing the content after all.  Without much insight into the project, I'd like to share my ideas. Let's hope they are of value. # Scenarios to relate with  Imagine two journalists discussing some political issue over TextSecure, and one of them loses track of their phone. Say this journalist didn't care immensely and neglected security in a way that his messages are now available to read for anyone in possession of his phone. If the journalist's friend could trigger the phone to delete sensitive messages—provided the phone can reach the Internet—they could rest more peacefully.  **In case you are not a top secret agent**, something easier to relate to may be sending a message to the wrong person. If you realize you've sexted your family like around 10% in a [poll by Recombu](http://recombu.com/mobile/news/half-of-uk-adults-have-sent-a-sext-one-in-10-to-the-wrong-person_M17564.html) have you may want to have an undo button. (how do people accidentally do this?) # Friends and collegues  I care quite a bit about privacy and security, and although I've managed to make my friends care more than expected, there is a limit to what they'll endure. This suggestion would ease the pressure on them to control their habits. They won't use a very secure password if they have to enter it every time to read messages. # Implementation complicatedness  Putting this idea together into the product can get complicated. Should the recipient have the ability to disallow deletion? As he could already be in possession of the information, one could argue it may already be captured and that my idea gives a false sense of security to the sender. I think it's an issue with little impact to an otherwise very valuable feature. Anyway, if we let the recipient prevent such deletion, I would like the sender to be aware of that fact before submitting her message.  If the recipient doesn't agree with letting the sender delete their messages or having them expire, he could disable it for future messages. The recipient may have the ability to disallow deletion/expiry for (specific or all) senders, but the sender must always be aware of which before sending.  **All this causes complexity and new UI considerations. It appears we do not want more of that. Everyone should easily understand their message's fate.** # Solution - Let the sender delete it's own contribution to the conversation. - Allow manual locking of messages as suggested in #283.  That's a simple and in my opinion reasonable compromise resulting in an easy to understand model avoiding added complexity. ## Model  Messages are owned by the sender, who can always delete them, but is also aware that removal from other devices (or human memories) cannot be guaranteed. ## User interface  We have the following alternatives for deletion.  Delete message or conversation... - ...from current device only. - ...from current device and send deletion notice for own messages to other parties. - ...from current device and send deletion notice to other parties, regardless of sender. - ...from other parties only, by sending a deletion notice. ## Potential problems  How can messages be kept track of, and could this kind of ownership break the plausible deniability we currently enjoy? Would the ability to delete any message in a conversation solve that problem? ## Future considerations ### Let any party delete any message  People should manage to handle this as a social issue, where if someone disrespects the wishes of message retention, they're reprimanded appropriately. TextSecure has no role in this. ### Expiring messages (requires UI modification)  Perhaps auto-deletion after recipient specified time period suits better for TextSecure. # Related issues #175, #176, #226, #283.  I love that Signal was just released for iPhone!

column3: Wrong thumbnail in originating conversation when sending image
column4: While confirming issue #1476 and doing some tests, I deleted the conversation thread between two phones in both phones (Moto G and Nexus 4). Then, from the Nexus 4, I attempted to attach an image to send it to the Moto G. The image is sent and received correctly, but the preview thumbnail in the originating Nexus 4 phone (and only there!) is from a different image that I had received or sent previously in the deleted thread. From the Moto G I don't see the same problem.

column3: MMS Download Failure (non-AT&T)
column4: Whenever I receive a multimedia message, attempting to download results in displaying "Connecting to MMS server..." for a few seconds, then reverting back to the "Download" button. In other words, I can't download multimedia. When connected to Wi-Fi, the "Connecting to MMS server..." message stays on-screen for over a minute; with Wi-Fi off it only lasts ~10s. I've tried restarting the phone, enabling manual MMS, even uninstalling and reinstalling the app--no dice.  Device info: Motorola Droid Mini, stock Android 4.4.4, TextSecure 2.3.3  App state: Push registered, MMS preferences automatic (or manual: MMSC URL http://mms.vtext.com/servlets/mms), incoming and outgoing SMS fully enabled  Debug log: https://gist.github.com/aaf18938b646e5326500  I realize that there have been a couple threads about this in the past, but none of them match my issue exactly, and none of the proposed solutions have helped. Would really appreciate it if someone could take a look!

column3: Sent timestamp on received SMS messages wrong by 1 hour.
column4: Whenever I receive a message through SMS the "Sent" timestamp is wrong. PUSH messages do not have this issue.  E.g. Transport: SMS Sent: Tue Apr 22, 2014 at 06:45:22 PM EDT Received: Tue Apr 22, 2014 at 07:45:45:23 PM EDT  The Sent timestamp should be for 07:45:22, not 06:45:22. This is not an issue of displaying sent time versus received time as in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/968.

column3: HTTP access to send/view messages
column4: When working at the computer it can be annoying to switch back and forth between your phone, especially when there are active group messages. I would very much like a HTTP interface on the device (perhaps wifi only, only on whitelisted networks) that allows viewing of all messages and ability to send new ones, protected by the decryption password.  Something like MightyText but not on a central server.

column3: Own membership in group conversations displayed as phone number
column4: When viewing the members of a group conversation, the own membership is displayed as the phone number. To avoid confusion, I think it would be better to use a static identifier (for example "Me"), like this:  Group Members: John Doe, John Wayne, Me

column3: Feature request: Add to contacts menu option
column4: When viewing an SMS thread, the menu options I see are "Add attachment", "Add contact info" and "Delete thread".  Please if possible add a new menu option to add the sender's number to Contacts.  It would be super-smart if this option were only visible if the sender's number is not already in Contacts.  Apart from that: thank you, this is an outstanding app.

column3: Set default communication channel per TextSecure contact
column4: When using TextSecure as SMS replacement app, there occurs an issue if one contact tries out TextSecure but then decides to go back to some other IM. Then TextSecure always pre-selects sending a secure push message - which will never arrive because the contact no longer uses TextSecure.  So either one should be able to set the default communication channel for TextSecure contacts back to unsecure SMS, or at least TextSecure should remember the last communication channel per contact and default to that for the next message.

column3: Unsubscribe users from push on uninstall
column4: When users uninstall textsecure with an active subscription to push service,  this subscription is left over. There is no way to tell this from the senders point of view. They just won't answer anymore. You have to talk back to them to get to know that they have uninstalled textsecure.   My suggestion is to unsubscribe from push automatically on uninstall and/or add receive notification for sent messages.

column3: Cannot communicate with X-TextSecure user

Installing 2.2.0 over 2.3.0 refused (is this a bug somewhere or done deliberately?) so I had to deinstall 2.3.0, install 2.2.0 and restore my Titanium backup.  2.3.2 did work, but complained that push mesages didn't work anymore because my Google Play Services were too old. I upgraded these to the last version, but it would have been nice if the message gave more information, like the mimimum version required.

E/AndroidRuntime( 6770): FATAL EXCEPTION: SendReceveService-WorkerThread E/AndroidRuntime( 6770): Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms.wstest, PID: 6770 E/AndroidRuntime( 6770): java.lang.NullPointerException E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.whispersystems.textsecure.storage.SessionState.setRemoteIdentityKey(SessionState.java:63) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.whispersystems.textsecure.crypto.ratchet.RatchetingSession.initializeSessionAsAlice(RatchetingSession.java:45) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.whispersystems.textsecure.crypto.ratchet.RatchetingSession.initializeSession(RatchetingSession.java:30) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.crypto.KeyExchangeProcessorV2.processKeyExchangeMessage(KeyExchangeProcessorV2.java:144) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.transport.PushTransport.getEncryptedMessage(PushTransport.java:341) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.transport.PushTransport.getEncryptedMessages(PushTransport.java:311) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.transport.PushTransport.deliver(PushTransport.java:148) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.transport.PushTransport.deliver(PushTransport.java:92) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.transport.UniversalTransport.deliver(UniversalTransport.java:88) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.service.SmsSender.handleSendMessage(SmsSender.java:88) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.service.SmsSender.process(SmsSender.java:62) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.service.SendReceiveService$SendReceiveWorkItem.run(SendReceiveService.java:273) E/AndroidRuntime( 6770):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.util.WorkerThread.run(WorkerThread.java:46) ```

column3: set conversation actionbar statelessly

column3: Stored pictures have wrong file extension
column4: When storing received images, these are saved in the usual "Pictures" folder but now have the file extension ".attach". Pictures can be still be viewed on a computer after manually changing the extension but they do not appear in the Android gallery because they are not detected as image files. The change must be introduced in a recent update, the feature worked well for a long time (my last successfully saved picture is from 11 October 2014). As I only receive pictures I could not yet test whether audio and video files are affected as well.

column3: [UX] [security] Notification if plaintext message is received in encrypted conversation
column4: When somebody receives an unencrypted SMS from a contact with whom s/he previously communicated securely, this can have several reasons: - The contact currently doesn't have internet connectivity/access to their phone for whatever reason - The contact stopped using TextSecure permanently for whatever reason - An attacker is trying to coerce an unencrypted response (requires user interaction), provoke metadata leakage, explain the error message of a following MITM attack, pretend the contact is still alive/free or similar.  In the first and second cases the recipient probably doesn't notice that the received message was unencrypted (which hints at the "no connectivity" of "no TS" scenarios) and will probably reply with an encrypted push message. This leads to the sender wondering why s/he doesn't get a response and the recipient thinking s/he already did respond. Which s/he did, but accidentally via the wrong channel.  In the third case the user should be warned about the general possibility of faked messages.  While explaining everything in extreme detail would be way too much, a short explanation should suffice.  What do you think about:   > You received a plaintext SMS in an encrypted conversation. This could mean that $contact currently doesn't have access to their smartphone, has stopped using TextSecure or is beeing impersonated.  > Do you want to answer via plaintext SMS? > [  ] Don't show again for this contact _ **[YES]** **[NO]** _

column3: Sharing link from external app
column4: When sharing a link from an external application, the Compose window is opened. The + sign in top search bar is used to add contacts but after selecting a contact, it does not show up in the search bar. Typing the contact name works fine.   This is the case on 2.0.6 and the earlier version.

column3: Emoticon mangled when attaching image
column4: When sending an image, if you write an accompanying message that ends in an emoticon, the emoticon is not received correctly in the other end. Either one or two interrogations are displayed instead.  Tested between a Moto G and a Nexus 4 both ways, running the latest TextSecure version from the Play Store.

column3: Include group titles in search
column4: When searching for messages only simple threads matching the contact names are returned as search results. With this commit also group converstations where the group title matches the search term are displayed in the result. This makes search results more consistent with the conversation list as now all conversation titles (i.e. contact names and group titles) are searched through.  Fixes #1954

column3: Make re-registration of same phone number more userfriendly
column4: When reinstalling TextSecure or switching the SIM card to another phone, PUSH service registration often fails because the number is already registered. This forces the user to go to https://whispersystems.org/textsecure/unregister/ and unregister manually.  Average users don't know that they have to unregister first. They even don't know the above mentioned page. And that GCM eventually notifies the server about unregistration seems unreliable due to the fact that many users really have trouble with this issue and are unable to proceed using TextSecure. (just wondering if similar steps are necessary when web sockets come in...)  I propose to let the registration process check if the number is already registered and automatically perform the necessary steps to unregister and re-register the number. When I understand the unregister web page correctly, this is authenticated by receiving an SMS (or call). I think this is possible when using the same SIM card / phone number.  This would greatly enhance the usability.

column3: Sender displayed as Anonymous when Sender's Number is Alphanumeric Instead of a Normal Digit Phone Number
column4: When receiving SMS where the sender's number is alphanumeric instead of a normal digit phone number, TextSecure displays the sender as Anonymous instead of displaying the alphanumeric.

column3: SMS appearing in Plain Text in Notification Bar
column4: When receiving SMS the message scrolls in plain text across the notification bar instead of showing encrypted message. Also when I pull down the notification bar to view notifications, an unread message appears in plain text. Note the app is already locked when this happens  There are times the message does appear as encrypted but that is rare.

Having not received an MMS in a while, and after reinstalling TS on my phone following a key corruption issue, I have received two MMS messages that I would like to save outside of TS, however the download option is missing.

column3: Photo of contact shown in the notification could be bigger

(Phone is a Nexus 5)   ![screenshot_2014-04-16-12-11-03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4053928/2728163/5c8a6d98-c5ea-11e3-84e9-84823e2fa6c7.png)

column3: Fix receiving utf-8 characters in media push messages
column4: When receiving a media message via push, that contains unicode characters (e.g. emoji) in the body, the unicode characters are shown as ??. This is because the received body is converted to a ISO_8859_1 byte array. I changed it to convert it to a utf-8 byte array and set the encoding appropriately. Then the unicode characters are received correctly.  Message with wrong encoding: ![screenshot_2014-04-21-11-49-26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2340865/2753724/7919787c-c93d-11e3-98c6-9eaec561bed1.png)  Message with my patch applied: ![screenshot_2014-04-21-11-50-11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2340865/2753723/74c62a04-c93d-11e3-86cd-e59a1108d467.png)

column3: Use "sms_body" extra from "smsto:" Intent
column4: When processing a SENDTO intent, the stock SMS app also populates the text of the draft from the `sms_body` extra (if present), while TextSecure does not.  The fix is trivial and should pose no risks, and it brings TextSecure's behaviour more in line with the stock app.  `Intent.getStringExtra` is documented to return `null` in case there's no extra of the requested name, so no error checking is necessary.

column3: Fix activity leak causing degraded usability and memory consumption.
column4: When opening messages from notifications, multiple activities are opened causing some issues with drafts, flooding history (back button) and general slow downs. This change fixes conversationActivity to be only with one instance.

column3: Image Rotation

Could there be an option tu rotate pictures inside textsecure and watch them in fullscreen in the encryptet format? So with out the needing to save them outside textsecure.  In the the little what i know of programming I¨d imagine its an easy fix to make rotating option?

column3: Does not always notify for MMS
column4: When an MMS is received, it is not always automatically downloaded. Furthermore, sometimes the phone gives no notification the MMS was received.

column3: sms delivery report: show received time in message details
column4: when a sms delivery report is received, the time the other user received the message (afaik the `done date`) should be saved and it should be possible to view it in message details. This way one could see **when** the other user received the message (not only that is was received).  edit: if someone can give me a hint where to look/start in the code to implement this, I'd try to make a pull request (but I just glanced through the code and cannot find a starting point ... maybe it's simply too late already ;-))

column3: Messages show in plain text on Pebble watch
column4: When a incoming message is delivered to the phone it is displayed and logged on the Pebble watches notification logs even while locked;however this is not the case with end to end encryption. Man in the middle

column3: Allow turning off sound notifications
column4: When `Notifications` are switched `on`, a user can select a `LED blink pattern` of `None` and/or can set `Vibrate` to `off`. But they can't switch off `Sound`. The only way to switch off sound is to have a sound file that contains no sound at all.  Rename the current Sound widget to `Sound file`.  Add a `Sound` checkbox above and use it to gray/ungray the `Sound file` widget.  Aka:  ``` Sound        [ x ] Sound File ```

column3: Send button should stick to last method (Signal, insecure SMS) on a per-user basis
column4: What it says on the tin; taken from discussion at the bottom of #845. As @samlanning mentioned and other users indicated, the send method must currently be selected with every message with a chat partner. "Stickiness" would be helpful, as long as the Send button reflected it visually (including for color-impaired users).  Implementing this would also be a workaround to #845 itself.

column3: Tapping "secure session ended" should offer ability to restart a secure session, or at least an explanation.
column4: What it says on the tin. This was always one of the biggest pain points with OTR. "Secure session ended," or in OTR's case, something like "your contact has disabled encryption. you should disable encryption on your side."  _You're a computer._ How about **you** do it and provide me with a big warning box?  In Textsecure's case, tapping "secure session ended" does nothing. Okay, now what? It should either offer to restart the session or, if doing so is for some reason inadvisable, explain that, and explain to the user what to do next.

column3: I can't send sms while my data connection is on
column4: What if I have a data connection but my (TextSecure user) friend haven't? How I reach him? Because I can't send encrypted sms while I have data connection. I think I should be able to send encrypted smses while my data connection is online. Is this so hard to do?

column3: "Error sending message" not descriptive enough.
column4: What error?  Why?  What can I do about it?  99% of users are not going to think "go to the github and paste logs."

column3: MMS doesn't work unless you enter override settings

column3: Message to Groupchat with Roaming mode renders phone useless
column4: We were on the road when I wrote a message to a groupchat. When I was ready for sending the message, my phone has gone to roaming mode and disabled data channel. TS did try to fall back to SMS which failes for group chats. Then a notification is shown like "SMS could not be sent, will be resent later". There seems to be an aggressive loop for this, as this notification didn't go away from my screen until my phone went out of roaming mode again. It did stay there whichever app I was starting...

column3: Textsecure crashes after opening message
column4: We use 2 phones with textsecure and both crashes immediatly when you try to open a sms or textsecure message. It is no longer possible to use the application. We used it now for about a year without problems... Android 2.3.6, Motorola Pro+  Even reboot, stop and new start, deleting all data, etc has no effect.  Thx Maik

column3: Energy drain?
column4: We here have the impression that Textsecure drains quite a bit of energy. Is that right/can I do something to provide metrics?  Sadly Textsecure is not listed in the energy consumption graph by android so it's more of a subjective impression of several people.

column3: Not all contacts of a group chat receive same messages
column4: We found this while trying to recreate some other issues this morning. In a group chat of three contacts A, B, C: - A sends a group message - B does not see the group message - C sees the message and replies - A does not see group reply - B does see the group reply  After that more test messages were exchanged and this time all participants got the message. This is probably hard to reproduce but it looks like the message delivery in TextSecure (at least with groups) is not reliable at this point.

column3: Problem on recive share events by some apps
column4: We found a problem in another app that could be caused by textsecure:  https://github.com/sylvek/sharemyposition/issues/4

column3: Groups are unusable
column4: We are using a group chat with 9 members (A, B, C ... H, I). I'm running TextSecure 2.3.3. The following happens when I try to send a message inside our group: - I do see the small tick underneath the message (no blue or green background) - I receive a warning that there was an error while sending the message (green background, red triangle), the tick disappears - I receive a message telling me that there are changed, but unknown identity information. I can tap on the message, the message is replaced with a key.  Nevertheless, everyone in the group receives my message. The same problem exists for at least two more users (B and C), but interesteringly not for everyone. Another problem is that I don't receive any messages from user D, but everyone else does (including B and C). There are also some users who don't have any problems at all.  There are no problems if I send a direct message to any of our group members. The messages are encrypted and sent (blue background), everything seems to be fine.  You can find a complete log over here: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/9d4097ed0db6e0339d53

column3: Contact name is a random 4 digit number from the same contact
column4: We are sending texts through a email to SMS gateway provided by t-mobile (@tmomail.net) and on one phone android version 4.3 with textsecure version 2.2.0 and each time a text is recieved the messages are not clustered under the same user.  Instead they are shown as coming from a unique 3 difit number that seems to start with a 9 each time.  We have attempted to add the from email address ass a contact.  We do know that this does not happen with all android textsecure installations.  Any help moving us closer to getting all of the messages clustered under the same contact would be helpful.

column3: Unable to send SMS over WiFi -- Republic Wireless
column4: Version 2.3.3 Motorola Moto X2, android 4.4.4 on Republic Wireless. If you're not familiar, RW uses a baked-in VOIP app to allow normally cell-based functions like calls and SMS to go over wifi. While on wifi only, Textsecure will receive SMS normally. It will not send SMS, secure or plain. It does however send secure Push Messages to other Textsecure users with no issue. Stock Messenger app will send both SMS and MMS over wifi no problem.

column3: stop using undocumented broken sqlite function
column4: Verified by running sqlite3 in adb shell that PHONE_NUMBERS_EQUAL was acting incorrectly in saying phone numbers with different country numbers were equivalent (probably among other issues). Going back to the safer option of always explicitly comparing E164 numbers.  Updated libphonenumber to 6.0, the one we were using was about a year old and I saw in the changelog that there were some localization fixes for some countries that we probably want to pull in.  It should be noted that the first call to canonicalize a number will result in a disk read, meaning it could take a couple hundred milliseconds (saw 350ms on occasion for first call). We can mitigate this by cheating and prime PhoneNumberUtil on a separate thread during the app start, create an E164 cache database, or bitch at Google until they add an option to preload locale data (unlikely).  Untested with me moving about to different countries, but should fix #791.

column3: displayed timestamp is offset by an hour
column4: Ver 2.0.8 on Android 4.4.2.  Believe relatively new problem.  Displayed TXTs show a timestamp of +1 hour in the message list.  When I look at message details, received TXTs have a sent time around an hour in the future.  The received time looks correct.  Does not seem to correlate/change with senders timezone.    Re-searched after posting and see some other that imply 'Sent time' is merely displaying what the carrier presents.  Is my carrier merely using a +1 timezone from my local, so this expected?  Is there a reason the received time isn't displayed in the message list?  Definitely arguable, but displaying received seems like a reasonable default.

column3: Gradle 'TextSecure' project refresh failed
column4: Using Android Studio 0.5.2 on 64bit Ubuntu 13.10 and following the instructions in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/BUILDING.md I have noticed that there seems to be an error with both Gradle 1.12 and 1.11  Specifically, when using Gradle 1.12 Android Studio throws the following error:  Gradle 'TextSecure' project refresh failed:          Cause: org.gradle.plugins.ide.internal.IdeDependenciesExtractor.extractRepoFileDependencies(Lorg/gradle/api/artifacts/ConfigurationContainer;Ljava/util/Collection;Ljava/util/Collection;ZZ)Ljava/util/List;  This error was referenced here http://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2014/05/intellij-idea-13-1-3-update-is-available/  so I tried pointing to Gradle 1.11 and that didn't work either. With 1.11 it throws an assertion error:  null: null java.lang.AssertionError: null     at com.intellij.openapi.diagnostic.DefaultLogger.error(DefaultLogger.java:56)     at com.intellij.openapi.diagnostic.Logger.error(Logger.java:132)     at com.intellij.util.ui.UIUtil.invokeAndWaitIfNeeded(UIUtil.java:2041)     at com.intellij.openapi.externalSystem.util.ExternalSystemApiUtil.executeOnEdt(ExternalSystemApiUtil.java:377) etc........  Anyone else seen this recently? What versions of AS and Gradle are people using successfully to build TextSecure?  Thanks

column3: Cannot send SMS to phone numbers containing + sign
column4: Using Android 4.4.4, Textsecure 2.3.3, on Motorola XT1032. Textsecure was installed from Google Play Store. When I configure Textsecure as standard SMS app and deactivate the internet connections, Textsecure should send messages as SMS also to Textsecure contacts. This does not work for one phone number of my address book (it says error sending message, both for encrypted and unencrypted SMS). The phone number contained a plus sign (+49). When I replaced it by 0049, it worked, so I think the cause for the error message is the + sign. The phone number is also valid with the plus sign, so Textsecure should be able to cope with it.

column3: Add comment to WhisperTextProtocol proto
column4: Useless change I made locally and am tired of re-writing when I sync. Also, github auto-added a newline at end, which should be there anyway.

column3: smil
column4: Use SMIL for all MMS attachments.  Also, increase MMS maximum size to a bit under 300kb (chose 280 for some padding), as well as allow images to be their recommended max dimension of 1280.  As is pretty obvious by the files changed, most of the changes are copying in the W3C standard SMIL DOM implementation with some modifications for simplicity. Since TextSecure doesn't attach multiple images in one MMS, I was able to simplify the logic found in other messengers much more drastically which is nice. The actual code that assembles the SMIL document can be found in SmilUtil.

column3: TS canot lock a message
column4: TS is awesome, but one feature missing fromthe stock messenger app is the ability to lock a message withing a thread.  As you know, in the stock messenger (well on CM11) I can lock messages from  friends with pics, dates to remmeber, etc.  and if I try to delete the entire thread.  Those messages are not deleted and remain after everything else in the thread is.  TS should support this to be a total messager replacement.

column3: Group message name fix
column4: Tried to better conform to code style guidelines, and now set it to use strings.xml so that translations will work for this. Also now merely adds it to the array of group members rather than physically changing the recipient object which in hindsight was a terrible idea.  Please let me know if I need to do anything more to make the code prettier/good enough quality to be merged. I toyed with the idea of extrapolating inserting "me" in a separate private method, but I couldn't think of a way to do that that wouldn't incur an O(n) time iterating through the entire list of members, whereas this method puts in the 'Me' fix while it's generating the list the first time, so I figured this would be better.

column3: Adaptively block recurring password entries
column4: Together with https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/1387 it would be useful to block online attacks against weak passwords by waiting maybe 10 seconds after three failed attempts. After that doubling the wait time would strongly increase protection against online attacks.

column3: Retry sending pics as push and NOT MMS
column4: Today I sent a photo to a friend of mine. For some reason (=no reason), TextSecure said it couldn't send it. Fine. So I clicked on "resend" aaaaand.... it sent the photo as an MMS instead of a push message. What's funny is that in the settings I allowed outgoing SMSs ONLY to non-textsecure users, so that's another reason why this shouldn't have happened. In Europe, we do pay for an MMS and they're usually pretty expensive. After all the "MMS fixes" I wonder how come no one ever fixed this.. ?

Can you reproduce?

column3: [Registration] workflow improvement when registering using temporarily a second device: allow to use first verification code sent in first SMS
column4: tl;dr I propose to add a clean "registering a number by SMS to a different device" step.  User Story:  As a new user, when I want to register my telephone number B (SIM card for number B temporary inserted into my mobile phone B) on my tablet A (a device without phone or SMS capabilities) with the TextSecure PUSH server, I have to  - enter the mobile number B into the TextSecure registration form on tablet A - start the registration progress (my device B immediately receives (a first) 6-digit verification code SMS) [X] - wait for the 2 minute time-out on tablet A (because A cannot receive the registration SMS) - press the button on A for registration via an automated telephone voice call - which now triggers the registration process by voice call to device B (user must be capable to understand a female voice, English language. This is a second and different verification code.  Problem: - Not everyone is able to understand the quite quickly spoken verification code on the phone. - Not everyone understands the English message - Users cannot enter the _first_ verification code: because there is no possibility (no input form) in the current registration workflow - Users have to know to wait for the timeout in order to trigger the "sent me code by voice call" process  Observation: - I regard the **second SMS by voice as superfluous (in the standard case)**, because I already obtained a verification code on my device B at step [X], when I would only be able to enter this code on device A.  @moxie0 I think the verification workflow should be _deliberately modified_ which solves many issues: before starting the verification process at the device A, after having entered the telephone number,   two new second buttons are proposed - automatic registration (this is the present workflow with the silent SMS to the device where you press the button, but you have to enter the telephone (BTW: Can't this be fetched from the Android automatically?) - **new button: "manual registration"** (a  verification code is sent via SMS to the device with the entered number) - **new button: "registration by voice call"** (you receive an automated telephone call on the device with the entered number, and a six-digit verification code in English will be presented)  Advantages of my proposal: - lower workload on TS registration server (the second SMS is not necessary, this step after the 2-minute-timeout is obsolete in the case that the user can receive the verification code on their second device) - time saving: the user does not have wait for the 2-minute timeout - easier: no need to understand the English voice message - verification code text message (SMS) could be i10n/i18n

column3: Added l10n for message details

Removed `toUpperCase()` to leave this up to the translators.  I tended to move SMS, MMS and PUSH at top of `strings.xml` as these are some main strings, but ConversationFragment is the only place they are used standing alone.

column3: rotate images regarding exif information
column4: This should fix #973 and #331.  I used the Exif class from `com.android.gallery3d.data` from [Android 4.2.2r1](http://grepcode.com/file/repository.grepcode.com/java/ext/com.google.android/android-apps/4.2.2_r1/com/android/gallery3d/data/Exif.java?av=f). The newer Android versions are using a more complex class to get the exif parameters, but we just need the orientation, so I chose the one from 4.2...  I don't know if its okay to put the google code just like that in the source directory?

column3: Only notify 'in-thread' when notifications are actually enabled
column4: This should fix #1371 by only notifying when actually enabled.

column3: Support unread count badge in Nova Launcher + Widgetlocker (using TeslaUnread API)
column4: This pull request adds support for updating the "unread badge" in Tesla apps (Nova Launcher Prime and WidgetLocker) using the [TeslaUnreadAPI](http://novalauncher.com/teslaunread-api/).  I really like seeing the number of unread messages next to my icons. I'm just a user, I have no affiliation with TeslaCoil Software.  Here's what it looks like (Nova Launcher Prime): ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/783973/4426361/8744182a-45b2-11e4-92e8-c20d38d02eaf.png)  I've added an option to enable/disable this feature for the paranoid people (and it's off by default), but I don't mind if that doesn't get merged (to avoid adding "yet another option"); all the option-related code is isolated in the 2nd commit.  Judging by what it says on the  [TeslaUnreadAPI](http://novalauncher.com/teslaunread-api/) page about the security of the unread notification count update, it sounds like this API is more secure than broadcast-based alternatives, so maybe it's acceptable to just issue the notification in case the [TeslaUnread app](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.teslacoilsw.notifier&hl=en_GB) is there.  I've been using (testing) this for a few weeks now and haven't hit any issues. Technically that's with just the first commit, but the 2nd one just adds the checkbox and an if statement around the main logic, so I think the code is sane! :)

column3: Disable notification "TextSecure is unlocked"

I prefer a notification saying that it is NOT unlocked yet, the opposite.  Possible to remove it? Or have it configurable with a setting? Or make it go away after few minutes?

column3: SMS database corrupted somehow
column4: This might not be a very useful issue, since I'm recalling what happened from memory, but it was bad enough to be reported I think. I lost around 3 months of text messages.  Yesterday I was trying to send a push text to another TS user. After hitting the send button a dialog appeared below the message bubble saying something like "click here for insecure fallback mode". I had never seen this before and was reluctant to send an insecure message so I ignored it and tried again, same dialog.  I don't recall what I did next to try to remedy the situation, I might have force closed textsecure, I'm not sure. But when I returned to the list of messages, all the contact names where "anonymous", but the icon for each thread looked correct. I then tried to create a new text message to myself, this brought up a text thread for a completely different person.  I realized something was very wrong, so I decided to export my text messages and reinstall textsecure.  I did this, and was not able to import the encrypted database. Once it just said "bad password", once it allowed me to, but all of the texts read "bad encrypted message".  I should also add that I have not been able to "register" with textsecure again through sms. I click register and the text never comes. However the calling method works.  I hope this is helpful.

column3: failed to send message
column4: This might be an existing issue, please close as dupe if that's the case.  My phone: Nexus 4 up to date with latest TS. Son's phone: Wiko Ozzy running 4.2.2 with latest TS.  The problem: - my son's phone can see that my phone & number are registered with TS's servers, yet when he tries to send me a message, I never receive it. - when I try to send a message to my son, TS doesn't see him as being registered: he's not listed under "Textsecure Users". So he does get my message but that message is sent as an SMS.  Everything works fine with WhatsApp.  We tried to "refresh push directory" on both phones, but that didn't help. Thoughts?

column3: make summary of passphrase timeout translatable

column3: Continued crashing for every unencrypted message
column4: This last weekend I had an issue where every received unencrypted message would crash the textsecure app.  It would say I had received an "encrypted message" when in fact it was not.  I found this out by trying to open the message from the notification area.  When I did, the textsecure password screen came up and when I entered the password, it would pause for several seconds (10-15) and then crash (I did file the reports, but one of those even crashed).  Once I restarted the app, I could enter the password and read the text.  At which point all was clear until I received another unencrypted text and the scenario would repeat itself.  Only when I restarted the phone would the behavior stop and I haven't had it happen since.  Sorry I don't have better initial steps to reproduce.  If this is too hard to track down at all I totally understand but I did want to write this up to go with the crash reports you hopefully did receive.  Would have been on Saturday afternoon USA Mountain time.

column3: Display sent time instead of received time (again)
column4: This issue already has been resolved once (https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/597)  but now TextSecure version 2.1.8 again displays the received time instead of the sent time for SMS.

column3: media constraints model
column4: This is to solve the problem of how we will support transport fallbacks once we increase the size of media supported in push messaging.  Our new basic media part flow: 1. Copy media to encrypted internal storage without any resizing 2. Send job knows its media constraints and will attempt to resize before failing if media is too large, otherwise send as is 3. Replace original media with sent, resized version to save space

column3: group context handling fixes and localization
column4: This is the non-UI work. - Localized many group update strings - Allow for group context messages to unset avatar

column3: [Feature request] Permanently display typed characters indicator
column4: This is something that I miss very much in this app. I know this isn't needed for a push message, but for an SMS it is. Current implementation of displaying number only if 15 chars are left (first image) is not very convenient, because I don't know if I'm on a first set of 120 chars or did I write more than 120 chars. Images 2 and 3 are just a sketch: what if there would be option to display this indicator permanently.  https://mediacru.sh/d71d311f7466  Or something combined: number of characters left will be displayed when 15 chars are left to second message, and if you cross to second/third/... message a permanent message number indicator would be displayed. (Just a thought.)

column3: Phone Number at Top Keeps Bad Data String Forever
column4: This is so bizarre I didn't know how to explain it properly in the title.  Right now I have this text in the phone number field at the top of a thread in textsecure:  "+1510xxxxxxx - Sms and and generally use the"  (The xxxxxxx are actually 7 digits I just omitted them to preserve his privacy)  This text should NOT be in a field meant for a telephone number!  How did this happen? Well, I got a text from someone that went through my google voice number and was telling me they had a new number so I tried to copy just the number google puts there at the beginning of the text but It copied the whole text. I went into their address book entry and cleared their old number field to replace with the new data. When I pasted I noticed there was a bunch of text after the number so I cleared it all except the number then saved. I'm not sure if i saved the text by accident then edited it again or... maybe i saved the number that it was relayed to first then finally the proper number (not the google voice relay number)... it is a blur in my mind.  When I went back into TextSecure instead of their number under their name I saw part of the text message in there. So bizarre.  The google voice is ANOTHER google account pointing to my number, not the one that holds the address book on my phone. This number was copied from the text that is placed their automatically by google voice, he didnt add his number to the text himself. I don't know if that matters.  I have deleted any thread from him in textsecure and started new ones. I have restarted my phone. I have deleted and created a new contact for this friend in my google address book, both on my phone and in a web browser which then syncs with my phone. I have deleted the whole thread from the other google voice account. I also tried renaming the contact in my address book... nope. Every time I get a new text from him or start a new thread to him this same bad string is in the phone number field under his name. No matter what I do it won't go away. It doesn't matter if I am connected to wifi or not (I have no data plan)... This makes me assume this data is stuck in a textsecure database somewhere.  Why is the data in the contact phone number field not just retrieved from the address book on the phone at some regular intervals or at startup? Why is textsecure holding it forever in some table? The table must be associating a number to a number string... but why? Why not just use the actual number??  I notice that some contact number strings have a +1 in front of the number (USA international code) and some do not even though NO CONTACTS in my address book have this +1... so textsecure has a strange way of handling this data. How does it decide what to make this string? There are errors in this function.  My suggestion is to retrieve this data from the phone address book and store it or maybe refresh it every time the password is entered or every week or something. I don't know the programming aspect...  Thank you!

column3: Import/export of public keys with sharing interface
column4: This is similar to but not quite the same as #802, which seems to be aimed at importing/exporting key files. And it may be violating rule 3, so apologies in advance if this is deemed too power-usery.  Importing/exporting public keys via the sharing interface would be useful for allowing people to easily construct alternative out-of-band verifications.  For example, for people who have verified PGP keys in the past, but are not now close enough to verify TextSecure keys:  1) Share public key -> Sign/Encrypt with APG -> Share via Email/whatever 2) Receive -> Verify/decrypt with APG -> Share to TextSecure, importing the key  Right now, you can export your fingerprint QR code, sign, send and have them verify and scan it, but it's not quite smooth, and the QR seems like a complicating step.  Another possibility is making a URI protocol that TextSecure is assigned to, like `tsfpr::`. This would resolve the import problem altogether, and could resolve something like #1016 in passing.

column3: Migrate from ActionBarSherlock to AppCompat
column4: This is necessary for moving forward with Android's common UI components. Also, it simplifies our multiple PasswordRequiredSherlockActivities as all ActionBarActivity objects support the compat fragment manager.  This also uses the support-v4-preferencefragment library to also include support PreferenceFragment objects, since AppCompat fails to include it.  Most of the changes are namespace replacements.

column3: Unified key verification
column4: This is just an idea for your plans to merge RedPhone and TextSecure into Signal.  The way SAS and key continuity are used to verify identities in ZRTP are much more user friendly than identity verification in TextSecure (QR codes, etc).  By folding both apps together, as it seems to be your plan, maybe you could reuse identity verification from "RedPhone" for "TextSecure"?

column3: clear pending slides when attachment reselected
column4: This is just a quick fix for #2012, ignoring that AttachmentManager and SlideDeck need replacement

column3: Clicking on received images crashes TS
column4: This is after the last Android update to 2.31. how can i provide a log? Or is this bug already known?

column3: [UX] Open Keyboard When NewConversationActivity opened
column4: This is a very small PR which fixes a minor UX issue that was annoying me.  In short it opens the on-screen keyboard automatically when you hit the "New Message" button at the top of the screen.  I feel that this is advantageous, as it removes some friction with the UX for those who are wanting to send a message to someone not already near the top of their conversation list. You no longer have to press the text field at the top of the screen to activate the keyboard (but can still hide it).  Thoughts?

column3: primarily performance and correctness lint fixes
column4: This is a long one, but it takes care of a decent amount of annoyingness and makes our code more obvious and explicit. Also cleaned up unused resources that have been sitting around for quite a while.  Performance improvements are largely around flattening layouts and minimizing memory leaks, correctness about hardcoded strings and explicit annotations for using APIs only available on certain platforms.  Went from 349 errors and 565 warnings to 2 errors and 62 warnings (the two errors will be corrected once translations are imported).

column3: FR: Full Photo Icon in Inbox/Message Lists Option
column4: This is a feature request to add an option to display square/rectangular photos instead of the circular "Google+" style contact pictures currently used.

column3: Per-Recipient notification silencing
column4: This implements a first step towards per-recipient notifications as discussed on the mailing list and wished for in many tickets. So far, I only implemented the possibilities to silence certain people and groups permanently or temporarily, since this seemed to be the minimal consensus achieved on the mailing list.  **WARNING**: This upgrades your database. Although a downgrade should be comparatively easy (delete a table and downgrade the global database version), make sure to have a backup if you test this.

column3: Cutting off long SMS/MMS with "null"
column4: This has happened a number of times.. but long messages get cut off with no rhyme or reason, and the word "null" is at the end of the now-cut-off message. Seems to be sms or mms. Has happened multiple times in a single conversation, or waited 3 months to happen again.   Device info: Nexus 5, rooted stock ROM 4.4.4, Textsecure 2.3.3 debug log: https://gist.github.com/aacfab6b864770cbc53b Note that this log was generated a couple hours after the latest instance.

column3: Push Messages don't work after restoring from Backup
column4: This happened to me on both my phone and my wifes phone: After flashing a new ROM and restoring Textsecure messages from an encrypted backup, there is a problem with push messages (can't be received or sent, I don't remember which).  This can be fixed by re-registering for push-messages, but since there is no indication that messages don't get through this can be a real problem for people when they change they phones and want to take their messages with them.

column3: Disable preview windows to avoid showing the wrong theme
column4: This fixes the flash of the light theme when you change the theme or language settings, as @McLoo described in #1322.

column3: Sort contacts case-insentively
column4: This fixes the case sensitive ordering of contacts in the view for creating new conversations.  Fix #1502  After applying the patch: ![screenshot from 2014-05-18 00 21 29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9906/3006269/07df61e8-de1a-11e3-9013-388bbaa92f07.png)

column3: Fix retry-later MMS toast message
column4: This fixes Issue #2030. #### Changes - Fix the message displayed in the Toast when an MMS fails to send.

column3: add PushDownloaderJob
column4: This fixes #1264   If a pending attachment download is interrupted, it will be resumed as soon as the network connection is established again. The job is persistent, so the download will be resumed after an app restart as well.  Until now `JobManager.setEncryptionKeys()` was never called, so encrypted jobs were never loaded to the JobQueue from the database. I put the call to `setEncryptionKeys()` in `RoutingActivity.onNewMasterSecret()`, I'm not sure if this is the best place for it?

column3: Fix Share Intent behaviour
column4: This commit fixes odd textsecure behavior with share intents: - when share intents with mime type "*/*" were handled (containing multiple types, for example a text and an image), the contents were completely ignored and the user saw an empty text field. - share intents with typ "image/*" (or other media types) would attach the image to the draft correctly, but ignored any text that was possibly included.   This commit changes the behaviour in the following ways: - the EXTRA_TEXT string from the intent is always included - the mime-type of the Uri passed in EXTRA_STREAM is deduced via ContentResolver or File extension, depending on the Uri type which makes handling of "*/*"-type intents possible (and possibly makes textsecure more robust against wrong intent types)  This behaviour is the same as in most other apps (tested Hangouts, several mail apps, G+ and others)

column3: added "not connected to a google account" to registration problems list
column4: This commit adds a third point to the list of possible problems in registration step 4 (*) => if the registration with the push server (here: Google) fails this can have the reason that you have no Google account attached to your device.   I had this problem on all my devices (which were not connected to Google), such a hint would have saved me 10 hours of search & rescue. Perhaps other users have encountered the same problem.... my commit is a help to spot this problem.  See Support question and answer: http://support.whispersystems.org/customer/portal/questions/6290806-verifying-number-hangs-in-step-4-registering-with-server-  (*) text on the screen is:  ```  1. Connecting (ok) 2. Waiting for SMS verification (ok) 3. Generating keys (ok) 4. Registering with server... (fails: It hangs, spinning wheel turning) ```

column3: move FLAG_SECURE to PassphraseRequiredMixin
column4: This change applies the presumption that Activities which require a passphrase should also be protected with FLAG_SECURE if the user has that option enabled.  Also takes better advantage of java generics to save an argument. Tested on Android 2.3 and 4.4.

column3: Shared image with another registered textsecure user and one week later an unrecognized number sent it back
column4: This all started because TextSecure had shown an incoming picture message of a picture I had sent a friend a few days earlier from a number I did not recognize. After doing some digging I got the idea to double check my phone records to see if TextSecure had received this message via push or SMS. What I found was extremely odd because my carrier usage showed that I had sent the picture message to this random number. The reason I speculate this image has come from TextSecure local database is because I had deleted the picture, from my SD card, after I had initially sent it. There does also appear to be an issue with my TextSecure local database because I tried to send the same friend a picture of my usage summary and after the send button was pressed the picture swapped to a picture he had previously sent me in our conversation. Although it showed the incorrect picture on my end he reported the correct picture did however make it to him. I have attached my original screenshots that show the incoming picture message, an outgoing message from me, and my usage report showing that both messages were in fact outgoing.   ![screenshot_2014-04-21-22-23-57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7367717/2761802/2280ca88-c9e2-11e3-86e2-772d9e147ba9.png) ![usage](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7367717/2761803/2287bb86-c9e2-11e3-972f-d4508b71c6bc.png)

column3: Add notification extensions for android wear
column4: This adds two things to notifications on Android wear devices (currently only for single thread notifications): 1. An additional page lists all unread messages with sender and without truncation. This only applies if more than one message is unread. 2. A reply action to input a message by voice or choose from some predefined answers. For the predefined answers I chose the first couple of things that came to mind, so discussion is welcome.  I more or less copy-pasted the message sending part from the ConversationActivity, maybe this functionality should be refactored into a separate class.

column3: add custom phone number type
column4: This adds the custom phone number label to the new conversation activity. Until now there was just "custom" displayed instead of the actual custom string.  This fixes #389  Second PR, because I screwed up the first one (#1489)...

column3: add custom phone number type, fixes #389
column4: This adds the custom phone number label to the new conversation activity. Until now there was just "custom" displayed instead of the actual custom string.  This fixes #389

column3: Adding TimeDeltaPreference
column4: This adds a TimeDeltaPreference as suggested by @mcginty in #1623, and makes it the preference for the passphrase timeout. That gets rid of one preference. ;)   It uses the "betterpickers" library he suggested over there. Basically. the preference will (optionally) first launch a dialog to ask whether to enable to disable the timeout, and then (if "enable" was chosen) launch the time picker. "Disable" is then encoded as 0.  This looks like a huge change, but it isn't. I had to move everything from the PreferenceActivity to a (Support)PreferenceFragment, for this string of reasons: Problem: The pickers library needs a SupportFragmentManager, but the PreferencesActivity does not supply this. Solution: Move everything to a PreferencesFragment and attach it to a very simple FragmentActivity (that gives us a SupportFragmentManager). Problem: PreferencesFragment is only available in API level 11+, and not part of the support library. Solution: Use an external maven artifact supplying us with a SupportPreferencesFragment.  I hope that this can later also be used for the renotification interval preference in #1623. ;)

column3: add notification for key change event, fixes #1460
column4: This adds a notification when a message is received but the key has changed. Until now, you didn't got a notification and had to open TextSecure to notice the message.  This fixes #1460

column3: Sending TextSecure messages between users works only in one direction under certain circumstances
column4: There is contact X and contact Y using TextSecure. X and Y used to send each other TextSecure messages but recently, things changed. X can still send TextSecure messages to Y. Y can receive them but is not given the possibility to send back TextSecure messages to X (the interface is offering secure SMS).  The following is the story about how I fixed it and probably also contains the cause of the error:  After searching for a while I noticed the following on Y's phone: When pressing "+" to start a new conversation, X was presented as TextSecure User with his phone number +49170854----. After clicking on the contact item of X, the conversation view opened and now on the top of the screen the was X name and below his phone number +490170854----   (note the additional 0 after the country code).  Now I searched the phones local phone book for that number. It was quite a mess with the +49170-number being part of at least two contacts. And then I found the +490170-number, which was part of a Skype-contact and could not be edited.  I asked X to delete the additional 0 from his Skype-account. Then I deleted the local Skype-contact entry in Y's phone book.  After I cleared data and cache of TextSecure on X's device and on Y's device and re-registered both to the TextSecure push-service, everything worked again.  Debug logs (a bit messy): X's phone: http://hastebin.com/iwipawemob Y's phone: http://hastebin.com/xakubapiro

In Germany one text can contain 160 characters. With text secure its not possible to have control over text message costs. Thank you m0xie and team for this wonderful software. Thank you for contributing your free time for our privacy.  device info: motorola A953, CM Android 4.4.4, Text secure 2.1.5, I am push registred.

column3: Make password input field swipe friendly
column4: There aren't too many simple ways to create a secure and easy-to-remember password. One of the better strategies are Diceword passphrases ([you can learn more about them here](http://arstechnica.com/information-technology/2014/03/diceware-passwords-now-need-six-random-words-to-thwart-hackers/)) Diceware makes it easy to create memorable passphrases with over 80 bits of entophy, but with Androids textPassword field every letter has to be entered manually.  If it were possible to swipe (with the AOSP keyboard), many words could be entered within seconds, improving the usablility of complex passwords.  I don't use any non-FOSS keyboards (like the Swype, SwiftKey, the google keyboard and so on) so I wasn't able to test their behaviour. If you use a third-party keyboard, please test the behaviour of the keyboard on the textsecure unlock screen and let us know if swiping is possible.  Maybe there is no way around it, but I'd still like to discuss possible workarounds, as this is a seemingly minor change which may still improve the average password strength a fair bit.

column3: Section on export controls in README.md is wrong
column4: The section on export controls in README.md is wrong. For one thing, ENC and TSU are two different Export Exceptions. The way it works for "publicly available encryption source code" is there is a section in the TSU exception that allows export providing that notification of the location of the source is sent to NSA and BIS using email.

column3: Add support for other QR-code scanner
column4: The QR-code scanner which needs to be installed requires a lot of rights (like reading my contacts or bookmarks), this does IMO not match to the security standards of TextSecure.

column3: PreKeyEntity member initialization
column4: The private member 'registrationId' in the constructor of class PreKeyEntity (src\org\whispersystems\textsecure\push\PreKeyEntity.java) is assigned with itself. I assume this is not intended.

column3: Feature Request: Voice Messages
column4: The possibility to send (small) voice messages would be nice, like e.g. surespot does it.

column3: Plain text export silently creates invalid XML if any message contains Unicode Emojis
column4: The plain text export suffers from a bug in Android's `org.kxml2.io.KXmlSerializer.writeEscaped` where [UTF-16 surrogate pairs](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-16#Code_points_U.2B10000_to_U.2B10FFFF) are erroneously rejected as invalid characters.  This is particularly problematic with a message export since it is likely that messages will contain those characters, and a single occurrence in any message will render the whole file useless without manual correction.  See the [corresponding android issue](https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=64108) for more details, including a fix written for another android application.

column3: remove pointless Bitmap allocation for ImageSlides
column4: The MMS send job sets the data as necessary, so this is unused and causing unnecessary memory contention.

column3: remove double rotation of group avatars
column4: The group avatars are currently rotated twice regarding the exif orientation. `createScaledBitmap(context, masterSecret, uri, destSize, destSize);` is already rotating them, so I removed the second rotation.

column3: Improve drafts
column4: The first commit is a small fix to delete a draft when the conversation is deleted. Until now the draft wasn't deleted and could reappear in a new thread. The bug can easily be reproduced by creating a new group, creating a draft, delete the thread and create a new group. The new group now contains the draft from the old group.  The second commit adds the possibility to save drafts for recipients you haven't written to before, i.e. no thread exists. This also fixes the behavior described by @landry314 in #103. It is implemented by creating a new thread (if necessary) when a draft is saved. When the draft is deleted and no other messages exist in the thread, the thread is deleted in ThreadDatabase.update().

column3: opportunistically use Android's E164 cached numbers
column4: The first call (and any calls if libphonenumber decides to clear out its memory cache) to canonicalizeNumber takes 700-950ms on my Nexus 5 due to the amount of metadata being read from disk. This leads to a pretty noticeable delay when opening a conversation sometimes.  This is a proposal that benefits devices on Jelly Bean or higher. Since API 16, Android provides E164 normalized numbers for any contact that has a number specified, and we can take advantage of that.

column3: Date and time not readable in Dark Theme
column4: The date and timestamp is not easily readable in the darktheme, because the text is too dark. It' grey on dark grey, green on dark green or blue on dark blue. Esp. on displays with high resolution (full hd), it is to small to read with this little contrast.

column3: show current version number in preferences
column4: The current version number is read from the Manifest and added as text to a section "Version" in Preferences  Screenshots:

column3: Delete leading zero from fragment timestamp
column4: The current timestamp in the ConversationFragment dateFormatter is in AM/PM format. It would most likely be expected therefore that there would not be a zero padding on the hour for this time.  This change removes the zero padding from the hour in the dateFormatter so that instead of "09:12:45 pm", the representation would now be "9:12:44 pm".  Format documented here: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html#number

column3: Finish activity before restarting it
column4: The current activity needs to be finished before calling startActivity.  Otherwise, activities with launchMode singleTask (ConversationListActivity)  will receive a new Intent instead of getting restarted. And in response to the new Intent, they will run onResume once again and trigger a second restart.  Fixes #1292

column3: Suggestion: copying contact information from texts
column4: The app has the ability to copy contact info to send, but not to make/modify a contact from a received text.

column3: Crash on unlock Nexus 4
column4: The app crashes when I enter my password. The problem occurs since the last update of TextSecure at the first start of the app. Rebooting the phone didn't help. Privacy Guard is disabled for TextSecure.  Device info: Nexus 4, Cyanogenmod 10.2, TextSecure 2.1.2 [debug log](http://hastebin/com/igipakibur)

column3: Implement "Yo" functionality in the ConversationListFragment
column4: The "yo" app has shown that there is value in easily, quickly attracting the attention of another person via SMS. It seems to me that it would be (relatively) easy to implement this functionality in TextSecure.  It would work like this: 1. From the ConversationListFragment, a person selects one or more people 2. In the action bar during batch selection, there will be a menu item "YO" 3. When "YO" is pressed, TextSecure sends out the two-character text message "Yo" to all of the selected contacts via SMS

column3: remove ReviewIdentitiesActivity
column4: The "Contact keys" page doesn't serve any purpose any more and is causing more turmoil than good.

column3: cannot send sms to textsecure users even unencrypted
column4: That pretty much sums it up. Cannot send sms to textsecure users even unencrypted. Had to revert to system messaging to send texts to my friends that don't have data.:-(

column3: Added l10n for ZXing intent message box
column4: that is shown if Barcode Scanner is not installed.  Original strings are  ``` JAVA public static final String DEFAULT_TITLE   = "Install Barcode Scanner?"; public static final String DEFAULT_MESSAGE = "This application requires Barcode Scanner. Would you like to install it?"; public static final String DEFAULT_YES     = "Yes"; public static final String DEFAULT_NO      = "No"; ```

column3: Spell checking language is always English
column4: TextSecure uses spell checking for entered text.  Unfortunately, it offers only English word corrections even if the keyboard language and the text is in German language.  The setting for language is also German. Interface language appears correctly in German.  I assume this is a bug in TextSecure.  I have HTC One and Android 4.4.2 with HTC Sense 6.0 TextSecure 2.1.4

column3: Duplicate spell checking
column4: TextSecure uses own spell checking in parallel to HTC Sense keyboard spell checking.  The entered text is checked twice: Once via keyboard and once inline with the TextSecure entry field.  I assume this is a bug in TextSecure.  I have HTC One and Android 4.4.2 with HTC Sense 6.0 TextSecure 2.1.4

column3: Bad encrypted messages
column4: Textsecure stopped working with one of my friends. Messages has been sent succesfully but have never been received on his side (Received icon did not appear).  Here are the logs http://hastebin.com/ecaxibaziy

column3: Error when receiving delivery receipt
column4: TextSecure seems to throw up when it receives a certain delivery receipt:  http://hastebin.com/ebeyonakuw  This is within a group chat, but I actually don't think this should make a difference. I'll try to provoke this in a one-on-one chat later. If that could be related: One of the buddies I'm chatting with (and whom I suspect to generate that error with his receipts) recently changed his key.  Saving relevant parts:  ``` W/PushReceiver( 2928): Received receipt: (XXXXX, 1415711380000) W/MmsDatabase( 2928): org.whispersystems.textsecure.util.InvalidNumberException: No valid characters found. column3: extremely high battery/power usage
column4: TextSecure seems to have extremely high battery/power usage on my Nexus 5, the greatest of any other app on my phone.  ![Gsam power usage](http://i.imgur.com/rM9yMgW.png)

column3: view images from exported backup
column4: TextSecure kept crashing when I would open text message threads. So I'm trying backup all my data to my laptop and delete all threads from my phone to start fresh. But I'm not sure how to view the images or messages in the "plaintext backup" on my phone. How do you do this? It is a mixture of mms, sms, and push messages.

column3: Dual sim card support on android
column4: Textsecure is sure a great app-in fact almost replaced the default. However, I find it annoying that everytime I need to send sms to different people on my dual sim card phone, I have to go to the settings to change the sim card that Should change. Is there anyone who has successfully compiled theirs for a dual sim?

column3: textsecure not an option when "sharing" an address book contact
column4: TextSecure is not an option when attempting to share a contact from the address book, in Android 4.4.2 when i select "messaging" it tells me "messaging" is not the default sms app. This would be a nice feature to have added to the app.

column3: MMS logout
column4: Textsecure in Android 4.4.4, liteflow  SMS works as expected, I won't be logged out unless the time limit that I establish has been met. However any time I receive a NEW MMS notification and I'm in another app, or not viewing THAT MMS conversation, I'll have to enter my password to view it.   Thanks

column3: No Hungarian language support - missing res/values-hu/strings.xml
column4: TextSecure does not support Hungarian language, not even partially. The only Hungarian word in TextSecure is "Magyar" at the settings options. Hungarian translation at Transifex is completed waiting to be emerged.

column3: Crash when sending any message
column4: TextSecure crashes whenever I try to send a message. Once I start it after a crash, I have to reenter my password, and messages I tried to send are slightly greyed out.  Android is rooted, I made sure all permissions are enabled via App Ops.  http://hastebin.com/tunohisuta  EDIT: BTW, TextSecure is set as standard SMS app.
