column3: [feature] lock messages to save from automatic delete
column4: Textsecure allows you to set a message limit for conversations, similar to stock messaging apps.  However, stock apps let you "lock" a message to prevent its automatic deletion when the conversation hits the defined limit.  I would like to see this in textsecure, so then I can lock messages instead of saving the entire conversation.

column3: [Bug] Still cannot export unecrypted backup
column4: Testsecure still crashes when trying to export an unencrypted backup.  I am worried because I have no way to back up my text messages.  I uploaded a debug log to http://hastebin.com/riwonataho immediately upon reopening after the crash.  I am on an Xperia Z1s from tmobile.  If you need additional info, I am happy to provide it.

column3: New User - Bad encrypted message...
column4: Testing secure sessions with myself as the sender and receiver, unsecure messages work fine but during a secure session I receive "Bad encrypted message..." as well as the red error triangle.  Also, when ending the secure session, I receive "Message encrypted for non-existing session..."  http://hastebin.com/dakemaluze

column3: Timestamps and delivery "checkmarks" barely visible
column4: Tested on both a Nexus 4 on CM11 and Nexus 5 on 4.4.2..  Since the latest update, the color/luminance of the timestamp legend and the "delivered" indicator are so close to the background color of the bubble that they are nigh invisible.  Cannot tell EXACTLY what update caused this, but between TS 2.2.0 and the current version - the display changed to become significantly less legible.

column3: Nexus 5 MMS not receiving or sending ever since Android 5 upgrade
column4: Switched to TextSecure for my Nexus 5 after 6 months frustration with Android's Hangouts. Very versatile app which worked perfectly for first two weeks.  Then I got upgraded to Android 5.0.  Ever since, I can't send or receive MMS.

column3: sanely handle duplicate contacts in db
column4: Surfaced in #1442

column3: Constantly detecting contact data changed, forcing refresh
column4: Strange little issue with the latest release, on Android 4.4.4  Looking at inbox it goes through a phase of constant refreshing for a minute or two - removing and re-adding contact info on received texts.  This happens fast enough that if I didn't know the contact names I'd probably not have time to read them. Then it'll be fine for a while, but come back in a few hours later to send a text and it will frequently start again.  Log is full of many W/ConversationListActivity(13072): detected android contact data changed, refreshing cache  No changes to my apps, aside from auto-updates, no changes to contacts in weeks.  http://hastebin.com/sojeqatatu

column3: use apply for preferences instead of commit
column4: Stops UI thread from blocking when the app decides to change a preference.

column3: don't try to load recipients for each filter text
column4: Stops all the entries coming up in the canonical address id and saves CPU time.

column3: "bad encrypted message" 2.0.6
column4: still get the "bad encrypted message" on the new 2.0.6 release

column3: Menu in English although UI set to another language
column4: Steps to reproduce: 1. set language to non-english (tested in Slovenian and Deutsch) 2. go to menu/my identity key/scan to compare 3. go back to messages 4. click menu - the menu is in English (temporarily)

column3: Force close after reopen unsaved image draft
column4: Steps to Reproduce - open conversation - add image attachment, but no text - go back to contact list - reopen conversation  --> Error, Force Close

column3: Added Bountysource bounty badge to README
column4: Split contributing code into BitHub and Bountysource subsections, since there's a $305 bounty on Bountysource. You can also enable GitHub Issues integration from https://www.bountysource.com/tools if you'd like.

column3: Empty notification when receiving an image without text
column4: Sorry if this was already reported somewhere, didn't find anything using the search.  I just noticed that when you receive an image without any text in a message, the belonging notification just displays the sender but nothing else. WhatsApp solves this by displaying "John Doe - Picture", so that you know what's going on.  This probably concerns the other attachment types as well (didn't test it though). My suggest would be to follow the example of WhatsApp and just display the type of the received media.

column3: Video attachment size too small
column4: Somewehre in the issues Video size limit is stated to be 1MB. I had to decrease the size of my Video to be bellow 300KB. It was sent to a push contact and a push groupchat,  no MMS was involved.  That's so small, that it's almost useless to even start with Video editing to get it down to this size.

column3: Messagebox is empty when using Emoticons (sometimes)
column4: Sometimes when using smileys/emoticons and question marks in a message, parts of the written content or the whole content is deleted. It seems to happen sporadicly. Sometimes it is just deleted on submission and the sent message is displayed with an empty message box (altough the recipent can read the message) TextSecure Version: 2.0.6 Android Version: 4.2.2

column3: "End Secure Session" doesn't always end secure session
column4: Sometimes the app continues to send encrypted messages after attempting to end the secure session.

column3: Add wildcard on both sides of verification SMS regex #1944
column4: Sometimes providers add additional notes to the SMS.

column3: Sometimes Images would not be loaded.
column4: Sometimes a received images will never be loaded. There is only the place-holder with the animated "load" image icon.  Maybe the image was deleted on sever after some time?!?

column3: Play Store: No changelog for 2.0.6
column4: Somehow my tickets' toopics seem to become less grave with every release. But I guess that's a good thing. BTW: If you somehow sneak the changelogs into transifex you'd get nice localized changelogs every time too ;-)

column3: WhishperPush Integration
column4: Some iota of intelligence or integration in Textsecure with systems running whisper-push (CyanogenMod) would be amazing.   My interpretation of this stance here is by lack of integration and support directly from whispersystems is that whispersystems would prefer its users use textsecure app and NOT whisperpush... However this isn't explicitly stated, but seems to be implied

I haven't confirmed to make sure that he's using the app, but I don't think he is.  Sending him a few messages (encrypted) failed. column3: Publish specification for TextSecure's group chat protocol
column4: So far, only the two-party version of the TextSecure protocol has been published ([here](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/wiki/ProtocolV2)).  This is a request for the developers to publish the full specification of the group chat protocol, as outlined in the relevant blog post (https://whispersystems.org/blog/private-groups/).

column3: Receive long texts as one message.
column4: SMS supports sending longer messages in multiple chunks (I am actually not sure how this works on the protocol level). TextSecure should be able to assemble them.  Right now the show up as separate messages sometimes even in the wrong order. At least I have been observing this for texts send from iOS to my Android device.

column3: crash when opening smiley palette

column3: Add Travis CI config
column4: Since there was no reaction in #475 for a while, I went ahead and had a look at that.  Travis has added explicit support for Android, so the build script is quite simple. Listing the components in `.travis.yml` is not strictly needed (they are [installed by default](http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/languages/android/#Overview)), but I thought it might save some time in the future when the defaults are changed. I also updated the build tools to the latest version and added a travis build status image (will look like [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/fwalch/TextSecure.svg?branch=travis)](https://travis-ci.org/fwalch/TextSecure)) to the readme.  You can have a look at a successful build at https://travis-ci.org/fwalch/TextSecure/builds/24788883.

column3: Exception in GcmRefreshJob chrashs TextSecure on start
column4: Since the update to version 2.30 of TextSecure I'm no longer able to start it. I'm using a Xperia Arc S with Android Version 4.04 (API-Level 15). Here the StackTrace:  java.lang.RuntimeException: Can't create handler inside thread that has not called Looper.prepare()   at android.os.Handler.(Handler.java: 121)   at android.widget.Toast$TN. (Toast:317)   at android.widget.Toast.(Toast.java:91)   at android.widget.Toast.makeText(Toast.java:233)   at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.GcmRefreshJob.onRun(GcmRefreshJob.java:41)   at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:72)   at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46)  I typed in the StackTrace by hand, therefore there may be typos. But I think the problem gets clear. I tried to trace back the exception in the source code, and it seemed that the JobConsumer should call Looper.prepare, but didn't do so. On the otherhandside I also wasn't able to find a call to makeText in the GcmRefreshJob and I doesn't look like everybody got this problem.  I hope this can be fixed soon.  Edit: As I just found out GcmRefreshJob changed in commit bf19307916568f0d44c28f2c6fb27d88ac48641a from 13 hours ago. Maybe this already fixes the problem.

column3: User is only able to send bad encrypted messages
column4: Since the new version (2.11?) a specific user can only send me bad encrypted messages. I have been communicating with that user for a few month now without problems. Here the debug logs:  receiver of the "bad encrypted messages": http://hastebin.com/emirogotiw sender: http://hastebin.com/soqoxeceha

column3: Reading "Encrypted" Messages without Password
column4: Since the last update of TextSecure (2.1.1) I noticed something "extrage" but I thought was an optical illusion at first but I confirmed this.  In the notification bar, you can see the message whithout encryption, in older versions the message was "Encrypted Message" now it showed the message in plain text.  ![screenshot_2014-07-20-10-36-05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5331187/3637969/aee95298-102c-11e4-9924-3db2d86a97be.png)  I erased the content of the message but as you see is a long message, is not encrypted and was shown in plain text in the notification bar but when I clicked the message...  ![screenshot_2014-07-20-10-36-31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5331187/3637963/0a3cffa6-102c-11e4-9f92-56dcd5fb5139.png)  It's suppose to be blocked by password... Hope you could fix this issue...

column3: File extension of attachment (e.g., .jpg) is not written when attachment is saved
column4: Since the last TS update I can't properly save any received pictures to my internal memory. Checking the according storage location with a file manager I can see that the respective file is written, however the proper file extension (.jpg) is missing, making the file inaccessible by any photo gallery app. Manually adding the file extension works.   The issue can be reproduced on other devices running stock Android (Motorola G 2013, LG G3)  Device info: Samsung Galaxy SII (GT-I9100), Cyanogenmod 11 M11 (Android 4.4.4),  TextSecure 2.1.10

column3: Automatically resend undelivered messages
column4: Since the delivery confirmation functionality has been implemented, I sent 48 messages. For 3 of these, I did not get a confirmation that they have been delivered.  It would be nice if messages are automatically resent if no delivery confirmation is received. Especially, if later messages to the same recipient do get a delivery confirmation, indicating that the recipient is reachable again.

column3: Decryption of some messages doesn't work
column4: Since some days I'm receiving messages which couldn't be decrypted. Instead of the message Textsecure informs me the that the decryption is running (Entschlüsselung läuft, bitte warten...). The sender is using a Nexus 4 with stock android and me I'm using a Galaxy S2 with CM 10.2 stable.

column3: Some push messages are not being delivered
column4: Since Nov 25 (so shorty after the 2.3 release) some push notifications are not delivered. The messages were send without error on both cellular and wifi but they never made it to the reciver. 2/3 of the messages send did however get to the reciever without delay or other issues. This might be related to issue #2198...  I'm currently using  TS 2.3.3 on a Moto G with Android 4.4.4 and the issue has been arround since 2.3  Thanks a lot for TS! I hope this can be fixed soon...

column3: SMS never delivers to some contacts, only MMS does
column4: Since installing TextSecure on my Verizon Galaxy S5, I cannot send SMS texts to two specific recipients: my parents. I can send them to my sister and to everyone else in my contacts I've tried.  When I want to text to my parents, I have to send a group SMS or attach a photo to my SMS to make it an MMS to them. I receive all texts from them fine. They both have iPhones.

column3: Cannot send PUSH messages to a single contact
column4: Since a few days, I am no longer able to send PUSH messages to a friend of mine. However, encrypted SMS are sent correctly. On the other hand, she can send messages over the data channel to me without any problem.  We both re-registered for PUSH by unchecking and rechecking the option in the settings. I am also able to communicate with my other contacts over PUSH.  Here is a log file of me sending her a test message: http://hastebin.com/funosuhoha.vhdl I am uncertain whether this is a client problem because the messages are shown to me as being correctly sent.

column3: user offline: no automatic fallback to sms
column4: Since 2.0.6 it seems there is no fallback from push to sms if the receiver is offline:  Mobile 1 is online and tries to send a message to mobile 2. Both mobiles are registered for push. Message is sent via push, but mobile 2 doesn't receive the message because it's offline. Next time it get online it receives the message.  Is this a bug or a expected behavior?  Vice versa (mobile 2, offline --> mobile 1, online) messages are delivered immediately via sms.

column3: SIP support
column4: Similar but I believe not technically identical to #1533. 1. Have two numbers: SIP and SIM. 2. Bind Textsecure to the SIP number. 3. Send a encrypted SMS via Textsecure. This will use the SIM number. 4. _Receiver can not decrypt the SMS (as expected)._  I guess this is not a relevant issue for the short term. Nonetheless SIP is becoming more and more popular eg. with CyanogenMod having it integrated by default.

column3: don't call replace() on null formattedNumber
column4: Should be a simple fix to #1397's NPE

column3: [bug] Forwarding media messages only forwards text
column4: Sharing pictures from the gallery or anywhere else works great in 2.0.7., but whenever I want to forward a message with an image, only the text gets transferred into the new message.  Observed behaviour: Forwarding messages with pictures only forwards the text. Expected behaviour: Forwarding messages with pictures forwards the whole message.  @McLoo identified the problem in ConversationFragment.java (https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/316#issuecomment-40311690):  ``` java   private void handleForwardMessage(MessageRecord message) {     Intent composeIntent = new Intent(getActivity(), ShareActivity.class);     composeIntent.putExtra(ConversationActivity.DRAFT_TEXT_EXTRA, message.getDisplayBody().toString());     composeIntent.putExtra(ShareActivity.MASTER_SECRET_EXTRA, masterSecret);     startActivity(composeIntent);   } ```

column3: New activity for sharing, destruction of RecipientsPanel
column4: ShareActivity is essentially a simplified version of ConversationListActivity that is supposed to be a more succinct list of open conversations sorted by recency. The "+" in the ActionBar will let the user create a new conversation to share to instead.  I tried making it a dialog since I preferred that look, but with the way we're currently processing through RoutingActivity, it appeared not-so-possible after excessive and fruitless tinkering with android's style/theming.

column3: Lock Button in Notification DropDown
column4: Several updates ago we lost the ability to quickly lock TextSecure by pressing the little lock button in the dropdown notification that says "TextSecure is Unlocked". Getting that little feature back would be awesome!!!

column3: Notify local user when remote user's Axolotl message keys are expected to have be deleted based on timeout
column4: Several times now, I've sent a friend a message only to have them tell me out-of-band that they received it, but couldn't read it.  All of these occasions happened when we didn't communicate for several days. I'm _guessing_ that the undecryptable behaviour is intentional, due to Axolotl deleting unused message keys after a timeout, to prevent an attack where the adversary withholds ciphertext in the hope of recovering the recipient device later.  If my diagnosis is correct, please add some sort of UI indication _on the sending side_ that this may be taking place. Currently, the absence of "delivery failed" suggests to me they received it _and decrypted it_, when only the former is true and the latter is false.

column3: Custom label value not showing up at top of conversation
column4: Setup: 1. Have a contact  with two Custom labels for their two phone numbers.  Steps to reproduce: 1. open any conversation with a user like above.  Note: at the top of the conversation, it doesn't show that custom label next to the phone #.  This affects me because I have contacts that have two cell #'s to which I can text.  It also might be good to consider showing the custom label in the list of conversations.

column3: Custom label value not showing up in list of TextSecure users
column4: Setup: 1. Create a contact that has two mobile numbers (Mr. & Mrs. A for instance) 2. For each mobile number choose "Custom" and set the labels as Mr. for one and the other as Mrs. 3. Make sure at least one is a TextSecure user (both would apply here though too) Steps to reproduce: 1. Create new conversation by tapping the "+" in the top right corner of TextSecure. 2. The TextSecure users are listed first and it doesn't show the Custom label value of Mr or Mrs.  Regular users work properly and show the custom label value.

column4: Setting up a Relay/DNS/SMS gatewary server in Ghana. I would like to bring this issue to the forefront and install a Gateway server in Ghana. Is this still possible?? I am referencing issue #221 in WhisperSystems/RedPhone   thanks,   Blax

column3: Google Play Service Update Crash AGAIN!!!
column4: Seriously, just like my previous ticket: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/1866 Suddenly, without any notice, TS 2.3.0 requires a newer "Google Play Services" to be installed.  Unlike other apps, who warn you of this problem, TS just crashes on start if you have the wrong version.  Why is it so hard to: 1. Write it in the changelog 2. Check for the version on app-startup and display some sort of dialog (like google maps, e.g.) 3. Provide support for older versions

column3: add hugo annotation debugging
column4: See https://github.com/JakeWharton/hugo for library description. Basically, you can annotate any method with `@DebugLog` and get input/output/timing information for free in the logcat of debug builds (does not affect release builds).  includes some annotations on large methods that need asynchro-nizing/refactoring. Ideally we don't have anything running on the main thread that lasts longer than ~15ms (60fps + padding).

column3: Screenshot protection should be opt-in and for TextSecure users only
column4: Screenshot look down should be only provided if both clients are using WhisperPush/TextSecure and even then it should be something a third-party has requested. Not being able to screenshot an ordinary conversation is more hindrance than anything else.

column3: Unable to connect to MMS provider
column4: Samsung Galaxy Note II SGH-T889, Rooted Android v 4.1.2  Kernel 3.0.31-935627 Build JZ054K.T889UVBMD1 TextSecure ver 2.1.1 TMobile Debug : http://hastebin.com/kijowaneje  About 12 hours ago all Multimedia messages arriving present " Error connecting to MMS provider " after pressing the download button. Text only messages send/rcv without a problem.   Actions taken : Program restart, phone restart, reviewed last 10 days of posts here to issues, still reading.

column3: Smiley/Emoticons and Enter in one button
column4: Right now you have to choose, whether you want an enter button or the smileys-button on your keyboard. I've read some comments in the German Google play store, that people would like both possibilities (me included). I think an elegant solution to this would be, if both buttons are still in the keyboard, so we don't use space in the writing section like whatsapp. The functionality could work like this: ![smileyenter](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4518980/3700995/ce945438-13e9-11e4-8495-3eb5205bb25d.png)  With this feature there would also be no need for the section "input settings".  I don't know, if this was discussed earlier, I'm sorry if that is the case, but I couldn't find any issues concerning that feature.

column3: Add the ability to create new contact from SMS exchange
column4: Right now you can add the SMS of a person to an existing contact, but there's no way to create a new contact. This would be a pretty useful feature.  (Thanks for TextSecure! And for working on privacy-protecting software in general! :sparkles:)

column3: use PartAuthority when fetching part streams
column4: resolves the self-send case  Fixes #2259

column3: Show unread message count on application logo for TouchWiz and other ROMs
column4: Requested in/Related to #1526 #1136 #321 Uses library: https://github.com/leolin310148/ShortcutBadger

column3: disable passphrase creation on registration

Reminder about setting as default SMS will show up both on app start, and whenever TextSecure goes from being default to no longer default.  Reminder about import will only show up if TS is default and the user hasn't dismissed or imported yet.  ![screenshot1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/373823/3670582/a3fb1edc-1245-11e4-86f5-2d1acfeefbe2.png) ![screenshot2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/373823/3670585/a62fae52-1245-11e4-832a-4f74e5215e79.png)

column3: visualization of X-custom fields of vcf
column4: Related to #553: when having contacts with a vcf which includes fields like: TEL;CELL;PREF:+4850123456789 or TEL;X-Old:+4850123456789 There's no visual indication of human memorizable content, like in the default messaging or phone application.

column3: Work with servers using the free telephony accounts.
column4: Recognize verification code messages that have ads included, such as "Sent from your Twilio trial account" and "[Nexmo Demo]".  // FREEBIE

column3: Feature Request: Option to strip unicode characters
column4: Recently I stopped using the stock CyanogenMod SMS app in favor of TextSecure. One thing that bothered me and continues to do so is that there is no option to strip all unicode characters. It would be really usefull to have this option for alphabets that use non-standard characters ( e.g Cyrillic, Greek ). This basically means swapping any non-standard character for its closest counterpart in the default GSM alphabet ( e.g. 'á' => 'a' ) allowing the use of 160 characters per SMS instead of 70. I consider it an essential feature especially if you are not online, as the same text in unicode might charge you more than double than it would on the default GSM alphabet.  I hope you implement this feature. Thanks and keep up the great work! :)

column3: Group message issues after device change
column4: Recently as I got a new phone, I experienced some issues with group messaging. As I cannot say, how far they are related, I'll just describe, what happened. - First of all did a backup of the messages on the old phone. - Tried to unregister push on the old phone. This didn't work with some rather generic error message (something like "unable to perform task" or so, don't remember exactly). - Installed Textsecure on the new phone, registered for push. - Imported backup from the old phone.  So far, so good. The hassle began, when the first group message arrived. - The message is shown in a conversation named "Unknown group". There's no way for me to change the group name or even leave the group to be readded. - After someone else has added me to the group a second time (although I was already part of the group according to his phone), I can see the group name and receive messages – but only from the one who readded me. Messages from other members are not shown. - However, now I can leave the group. After being readded again, I can now receive all messages from any group member again.

column3: remove double permissions from AndroidManifest
column4: RECEIVE_SMS and WAKE_LOCK were twice in the permission list...   // FREEBIE

column3: streaming media (internally)
column4: Rebased and slightly modified version of moxie's media-branch version. This one keeps the PartProvider around to supply encrypted previews for audio/video, and we can remove it once we support previewing all media in-app.  Except in the case of building the MMS body, we no longer hold entire media parts in memory with this change. This is the first step toward supporting large attachments.

column3: Build failed: "failed to find Build Tools revision 19.1.0"
column4: RE: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/ea0fa58265755ce6f1752880572425db96aa1c3d  ``` ./gradlew clean;./gradlew build ...  :preBuild FAILED  FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.  * What went wrong: Execution failed for task ':preBuild'. > failed to find Build Tools revision 19.1.0  ```

column3: Removed the word "at" in message details timestamp
column4: Rationale for this PR:  > 1. We currently do _not_ have a safe method which allows to translate and adapt the timestamp format and "at" string (which separates timestamps in the message details à la "SENT:  at "). A wrongly "translated" timestamp currently breaks and crashes TextSecure as discussed in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/pull/1309 , so that it cannot be allowed at the moment. > 2. The word "at" was not localized, which makes localized (non-English) timestamps looking strange  Therefore I propose _for the moment_ - until we sanitize translation inputs for the timestamp string -  to simply drop the "at" word.  Dropping "at" simply avoids the need of translation.

column3: Implement Pushbullet API for quick-reply.
column4: Pushbullet is an Android app for (among others) mirroring notifications to the PC. It offers an API which enhances this capability by offering the possibility to reply to notifications (i.e. messages) directly from the PC. Here are the docs: http://docs.pushbullet.com/extensions/messaging/

column3: use PartDatabase to look up thumbnails async
column4: Prevent excessive resource contention from generating two thumbnails for the same piece of media when sending/receiving into an open conversation.

column3: Add preview of encryption channel in input field hint.
column4: Pretty straight forward implementation of @generalmanager's suggestion in #766.  Changes the hint text the same time the icon is changed to indicate the channel that will be used to send the text.  There is some new text to be translated: - Send an encrypted push message - Send an encrypted SMS - Send an unencrypted SMS

column3: Last conversation visible upon back when logged out
column4: Platform: Moto G w/ 4.4.3  What happened: While logged out of textsecure I opened textsecure and then quickly hit the back button as it brought up the password prompt, the screen immediately flashed with the last conversation I'd viewed and then closed. Upon re-testing this trick basically allowed me to see the last couple screens that I had previously viewed in textsecure until finally starting to drop me back to the desktop directly.  If you're not already aware of this I'm betting you'd want to be.

column3: Show the time on messages always.

column3: Fix more leaked service connections
column4: PassphraseRequiredMixin might check for a bound service at a time where the bind has been requested but the service connection has not been established yet, and therefore fail to call unbindService, leading to a leaked service connection. This fixes #1518.

column3: Groups: Adding member makes delivery reports go wacky
column4: Over the weekend I added a member to a Textsecure group I've been using successfully for months.  The delivery receipts had been working great until I added this new member.  Now when I send a message to the group, I see the background go from dark blue to medium blue, then the delivery receipt checkbox shows up and then disappears!  Certainly not a show-stopper but I was loving this functionality. Notes: I had the two contacts under the same contact using sub-numbers initially when this started happening.  Since then I split them out into two separate contacts but the problem is not resolved.  SGS4, Verizon, stock 4.4.2

column3: use Loader when conversation is updated instead of requery
column4: Our adapter for conversations and conversation lists was still doing requeries on content changes which happen on the UI thread. This change takes advantage of the Loader paradigm and its built-in content observation/updating to take that into an AsyncTaskLoader.  Unfortunately you only get the cursor content observation benefits in the CursorLoader class if you're querying from a Content Provider. Since we don't do that for conversations, I needed to write our own AsyncTaskLoader helper class for how we fetch cursors.  While I haven't reproduced the major lag others have experienced with large conversations, I suspect this has a decent amount to do with it. Should help #1941.

column3: adding a new contact is unintuitive
column4: one needs to touch the "phone" icon to get to the screen where one can add a new contact for a sender phone number (e.g. after one got a msg from that sender).  this is bad because of 2 reasons:  a) there is no connection between "i want to add this contact" and a "phone" icon (which usually means "call the person")  b) one might not want to call the other person and therefore would not even touch the icon because you do not know if that immediately triggers an outgoing voice call (and thus you never find out that adding the contact is on the next screen)

column3: Disable ADB backups for security reasons
column4: On many Android devices ADB debugging is enabled, allowing anyone with physical access to the device to make a full backup of apps and their files/settings.  This can be disabled by setting android:allowBackup to false in the AndroidManifest.xml. It may not add much security for cases in which the user used a strong password to encrypt the TextSecure files.  But consider the following scenario: - unrooted smartphone - Attacker has physical access for a short period of time - no/weak/circumvented lockscreen password - unknown but weak TextSecure encryption password.  Even with physical access the user isn't allowed to read the /data/data folder and can only do online attacks against the TextSecure password. But if he/she is able to copy the whole TextSecure folder, the attacker can do offline attacks, more or less instantly breaking all simple passwords.  There is also a nice talk, demonstrating this exact problem with password container apps like LastPass (interesting part minute ~13): http://blog.deepsec.net/?p=1740

column3: Indicator for transport of incoming messages.
column4: Often I have received messages from other TextSecure users who have switched to SMS (as they are on the move) (or similarly they have lost phone network signal, and can ONLY use push). Currently, the only way in which to see the type of the incoming message is via viewing a single message's detail. If the transport changes often, this in impractical, but can be vital in understanding the chances of your own messages getting through.  I have implemented (partly to familiarize myself with the TextSecure code base) a solution which allows a user to decide how they would like this information to be displayed (if at all).  There is a new preference with 3 options:  ![2014-06-27 19 23 31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3319932/3416920/28879f04-fe32-11e3-89c0-e6da006c20dd.png)  The default option, "None", is to leave it as it currently is, with no indication.  These are what the other two options look like:  ![2014-06-27 19 23 41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3319932/3416921/2888a7aa-fe32-11e3-8023-3229f3115096.png) ![2014-06-27 19 23 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3319932/3416922/288f2bfc-fe32-11e3-81da-8755a9d0839e.png) ![2014-06-27 19 24 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3319932/3416923/2891aaa8-fe32-11e3-811a-adec3b2fed88.png)  I'm not sure on the language used in the preferences? This could probably be improved.

column3: notification sound
column4: Notification sound also plays when phone is muted.   Notification sound makes the music volume go down.   Possibility to mute certain group conversations, not just the whole messages.

column3: all incoming sms being duplicated twice
column4: Not sure what else to add.  never used to happen now happens for all recipients.  MOTO Razr MAXX CM11

column3: Message selection is unreliable for non-plaitext messages
column4: Not sure if this is a regression of the latest release, but I just noticed this behaviour on my Samsung SIII (GT-I9300) and wife's GT-I9305, both with stock Android 4.3 - both with latest TextSecure.  When looking at a contact's thread, long pressing on messages that include: - a photo or - a number that has been auto-recognized by Android (therefore underlined)   ...  does not work as expected: - Such messages cannot be selected (they will not be highlighted), even though the "info", "delete", "copy" and "forward" buttons will show up. - Performing any action on them (like copy or forward) makes it obvious (when pasting or sending the forwarded message) that a different message has actually been copied to the clipboard! Example: I long-press on msg number 10 in a thread, click the "copy" icon, then paste in the text input area and a different message (usually 11 or 14 ) is pasted! The same effect is seen with copy/paste, forward and message deletion.  To test whether you're affected by this bug: 1. Find a TextSecure message that meets the above criteria (has underlined numbers or a photo) 2. Long-press to select it 3. Tap the "copy" icon 4. Long-press in the message composition area 5. Tap "paste"  If a different message (or nothing) is pasted, you're bitten by the bug.

column3: Improved the warning icon: Higher resolution, better size.
column4: Not much to say here. The icon looked really unsharp on my new HTC m8, so I added a higher resolution version. Also added a little border, just like all other icons in android have. Changed the name as well because "sms" didn't really fit any more.  Old icon: ![old](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1475672/3263811/b1fa050a-f276-11e3-9f13-608a0deb24f7.png)  New icon: ![new](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1475672/3263810/b1f779a2-f276-11e3-9683-113cae70763b.png)

column3: Not compatible!
column4: Not compatible version for Samsung galaxy tab 4 10.1 please make it works thanks!

column3: Capitalisation according to Android guidelines
column4: Not all updated capitalisations were correct.

column3: new emoji drawer
column4: No longer using a library, this one uses the Android "Noto" emoji pack and seems to typically have better performance.

column3: Laggy keyboard on Lollipop
column4: Nexus 5, Android 5.0 (LRX21O), TextSecure 2.3.0, default keyboard settings  Performance is fine when the device first boots but degrades quickly and input becomes noticeably delayed. RAM usage climbs as well, currently it's at 272MB with 16.5 hours of uptime. This only affects the keyboard in landscape mode.  I only have a few dozen threads with no more than a handful of messages in each. This problem is also experienced by a friend who has a Nexus 5.

column3: photos occasionally not downloaded over push
column4: nexus 5 android 4.4.4 push TS 2.1.8  sometimes when i receive photos as attachments they don't download, they thumbnail stays in download mode forever, force quitting and starting again doesn't help. i'm suspecting it can be caused by a handover from data-wifi or vice versa, where the internet connection drops for a bit. i frequently (dis-)connect to wifi networks.  my contacts complain about the same problem, i have to re-send photos that show the completed status on my side. so the sender has no indication that the delivery failed.  log might be too new :( http://hastebin.com/loduruqiga

column3: Remove native components from build instructions
column4: Native components were split out into the libaxolotl-android repository in 1833e57, so these instructions are no longer relevant.

column3: Image Received As Base64 text!
column4: My wife attached a couple of photos using TextSecure, she sent it to me, my TextSecure received is a text - see screenshot.  ![screenshot_2014-04-17-13-57-28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/837136/2731652/3f33af0c-c630-11e3-9387-694d1e976893.png)  Made the app very laggy, took ages to open the message. Was finally able to delete it though.  I'm using a Galaxy Note 3, she has a Galaxy Nexus.  Both on the latest version of TextSecure.

column3: Can't download MMS on WiFi.
column4: My service provider is Verizon. I am running CyanogenMod 11 on an HTC One m7. I can download MMSs fine on Verizon's wireless network, but I often have trouble downloading them while connected to my WiFi network. I have only observed this problem with MMSs from non-TextSecure users. Not sure if the problem is carrier dependent.  I know MMS is messed up but if there is anything I can do to mitigate the problem that would me great. My dad, who has AT&T, just got his first Android phone and I would like to set him up with settings that will avoid these problems.

column3: Add option to add prefix to SMS when requesting a delivery report
column4: My service provider (O2 UK) only support SMS delivery reports by adding a *0# prefix to the message text.  Therefore currently when I enable the SMS delivery report option I don't get a delivery report unless I manually type the *0#.  Please add an option to allow a user specified prefix to be added to outgoing SMSes if SMS delivery reports are enabled.   The prefix should be added as the message is transmitted but not displayed/stored in the message log.

column3: Can't end secure session.
column4: My Phone: verizon moto x, latest Textsecure from play store Friend's phone: 1gen Moto G -> iphone 4.  My friend broke her phone and put the sim card in another phone that doesn't have textsecure.  Now I can receive her messages fine, but I can't end my secure session  I have to manually send insecure SMS by longpressing send.  http://hastebin.com/eyobatamil

column3: Missed group conversation messages
column4: My phone was off while several messages were posted to a group conversation of textsecure users. (I know because one of my other devices using a different textsecure account is a participant in the group as well.) When I turned my phone back on, the messages were not pushed to it. Effectively, my phone missed out on part of the conversation because it was turned off.   Is that by design, or is that a bug?

column3: Time is off
column4: My phone number is a number from the Eastern Time Zone.  I currently live in Kansas City where its Central Time Zone.  Not sure if that's causing the issue but either way my phone tells me I am getting messages from the future.  Thank you  Love the app

column3: Please kill GAPPS dependancy
column4: My phone is gapps free and for good reason as we all know by now. Google is useful for some things except on my phone. How come redphone has no dependancy on gapps, yet textsecure does?

column3: App fails to recognise correct password after phone dies until quit and reopened
column4: My phone died earlier today, and once I had my phone connected to power and back on I found that TextSecure would not accept my password. I tried entering it more than a dozen times, and even tried copy+pasting the password from a text editor. Eventually, I did a bit of googling, and the comment https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/190#issuecomment-35806146 made me think to quit and reopen the app. I removed the app from my app switcher, opened a task manager to ensure it had quit, and then reopened the app. It then accepted my password on my first try. Perhaps the commenters in that thread were having the same issue, but failed to identify it properly?  (Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini GT-I8190N running latest firmware from Vodafone, Android 4.1.2)

column3: Messages received after several days
column4: My contacts and I are experiencing serious issues lately. We are all receiving messages from some days ago -- a friend of mine just got a message I sent him on Nov 30. What's funny is that the messages are marked as delivered on the sender's phone. Of course we all connect to the internet every day and this behaviour is bugging us greatly.

column3: Cannot verify number on iOS 7.1.2-even on 3G
column4: My cell gets stuck with the spinning wheel after punching in the verification code received by SMS.  Having read the blogs, I tried switching off wifi, but doing it on 3G made no difference.  Any advice will be appreciated.

column3: Remove separating characters during scan to remove dupes in the contact list
column4: My adressbook is quite messed up and for a lot of contacs I have the same numer two or three times stored. TextSecure does a scan and shows each number only once as long as they are identical, in case they contain " " or "-" they will be displayed as dupes. I am recommending to ignore those characters in the scan.

column3: Reminder refactor and added push reminder
column4: Move to custom Views which is what it should have been in the first place.

column3: show symbol when communication partner had read message
column4: Most other text messengers have a small icon on each message which shows status (send, received, read). Espacally the update whether a user has read a message is very helpful. I miss this feature in TextSecure. Because of the traffic, this feature shouldn't be available for SMS.

column3: support mms basic auth
column4: MMS Monster's logs showed this made a difference for sending/receiving on some providers, so implementing here.

column3: mms not sending or receiving over WiFi
column4: Messages that contain multimedia or are group messages fail to send/receive when connected to Wi-Fi. No problems when connected to cellular network. Samsung galaxy s3 sgh-t999l android 4.1.2

column3: Fix notification display order.
column4: Messages in notifications were showing in reverse order, that is newest on top instead of newest at the bottom making multiple messages hard to read.

column3: It's not possible to select messages containing hyperlinks
column4: Messages can be selected, when you long press on the message bubble or on the space next to it, when the bubble doesn't fill the screen from left to right.  When a message contains a hyperlink, it can't be select by long pressing on the space next to it. Long pressing directly on the hyperlink opens the action window which asks, with which app you want to open the link and another window which asks, what do you want to do with the message.  If you try to copy and paste (or share) the link, another message of the current chat gets copied and not the hyperlink.

column3: Message delivery - delayed / bursts
column4: Messages are delivered delayed and often received in bursts. (single&group) Often I receive messages from group chats only after ~10minutes and then all messages from that timespan in one burst.

column3: Fixes "subtitle is not updated when select all is pressed"
column4: Mentioned in a54d20f.  //FREEBIE

column3: Messages only arriving one-way
column4: Me and a friend of mine got the client up to date. Myself on Android, she's on iOS.  When she sends messages to me, they arrive promptly, however, when I send messages to her, they either don't arrvie at all or 3-5 days after being sent.  Any ways to fix this? (did already browse some older issues, but none of them could solve the problem)

column3: Change "Push and SMS" settings title to "Sending and Receiving"
column4: Maybe Fixes #1610 ?  Changed the "Push and SMS" settings title to "Sending and Receiving" via the strings in the resource folders. Changed the string name and its value in the default folder along with a google translate generated version in each languages respective resource folder.

column3: Validation - Editable sent message
column4: Many times sent messages contain spelling errors. A validation method could solve this kind of problem - for example if a sent message could be revoked (deleted from the receiver phone/server) and it would be editable as a template and then it could be sent again within a 2 minutes time limit.

column3: no way to delete key of contact
column4: manage identity keys - touch contact.  it shows the contact key then, but no way to delete or update it.

column3: Malwarebytes crappy "virus scanning" app reporting TextSecure false positive
column4: Malware bytes is finding a trojan in the TextSecure app, even after deleting and downloading it again.

column3: Made sentence gramatically clearer
column4: Made line 8 into a sentence and made clear that it is TextSecure that is available on the Play store.

column3: Feature request - email to text
column4: Love textsecure, been using it for years. Got a little feature request. I'm a sysadmin, about to be in the company's on-call rotation. We get nagios alerts sent to our phones via emailing the carrier's email-to-text service. Is it possible to export my public key for textsecure so I can use it to run a script on our nagios servers which calls gpg, uses my public key to encrypt the message contents, and then sends the encrypted message via my carrier's email-to-text service, and have it automatically decrypted in textsecure, even though there's been no key exchange via textsecure's api? Is this already possible and I just don't know how? Thanks guys, really love this program, and really looking forward to the ios port (my gf's on an iphone, and we're loving Signal, can't wait for encrypted messaging, too).

column3: Long press send options
column4: Long pressing the send button should reveal more options. I'm particularly interested in manual send as SMS while connected. Otherwise it's going through hoops to disable data/WiFi and back to the app.   I mean sometimes people just don't have data plans and get my texts 7-8 hours later when at home on WiFi. Defeats the whole purpose of default SMS app option.   Thanks!

column3: App crashes when I try to send a message
column4: link to error report removed

column3: Suggestion: migrate from GitHub to GitLab
column4: Let me suggest to move this project from closed-source GitHub to gitlab.com (see https://gitlab.com/explore/projects), which at least have an MIT-licensed [community version](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce) of their code.

column3: Asking for passphrase when unlocked
column4: Lately, it seems that almost every time I open TextSecure, it asks me for my passphrase, even though the ongoing notification that it is unlocked is displaying, it is configured to never time out, and the phone has not been switched off nor the process manually killed.  Debug Log: http://hastebin.com/opatoyaruh  (Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini GT-I8190N running latest firmware from Vodafone, Android 4.1.2)

column3: push messages not being delivered reliably
column4: Lately a bunch of my push messages have not been delivered. Like 1/3 or 1/4 see not marked as delivered. Before 2.3.3 this hadn't been an issue. Samsung s4 on Verizon. Network connectivity seems fine otherwise with other apps. Also had an MMS fail to send.  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/a7e5487736c3131d96b1

column3: Error connecting to MMS provider - Galaxy S5
column4: Just installed the app today. I cannot receive MMS  ... continually getting the error "Error connecting to MMS provider"  http://hastebin.com/akiwazuyoc.coffee

column3: iOS app planned?
column4: Just curious before I make propaganda on Facebook and persuade my friends to download TextSecure: Is an iOS version ever planned?

column3: SystemStateListener: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Receiver not registered
column4: just compiled todays TS version fromGITHUB and uploaded the APK on 2 phones.  phone 1: works fine and sends push messages to phone 2 phone 2: receives push messages from phone 1 but cannot send them via push.  error messages created was : Receiver not registered: org.thoughtcrime.securesms.service.SystemStateListener$ConnectivityListener@4205fcb0  both phones have been successfully added to the push service. I also tried to unmark push and remark again in order reregister but w/o success.  any thoughts?

column3: Change actionbar icon
column4: Just a proposal, but I think TextSecure looks better with a colorful actionbar icon. Gmail, Hangouts, Whatsapp, K-9 and almost every other app I looked at, are using a colorfull icon as well.  **light theme before/after:** ![light](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/3410427/ca193662-fde6-11e3-8ed8-9770cdcea618.png)  **dark theme before/after:** ![dark](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/3410428/cb37cc2a-fde6-11e3-88cb-9940d424eccd.png)  // FREEBIE

column3: Option to set a default output Directory for Backups/Backup into subfolder instead of root
column4: Just a little Feature request. My Problem is, that i want to synchronize the Message Backups to my Home Computer. When I was using normal SMS and SMSBackup, all the output files were written into a subdirectory which was easy to synchronize but TextSecure writes the Backup File directly into the root of the sd card which I cant synchronize automatically because the sync software only supports folders and not single files. My question is: Is it possible to place the Backups per default in a subdirectory or to add an option where the backup directory can be set?

column3: It's possible to send encrypted SMS to contacs which uninstalled TextSecure
column4: It's possible to send encrypted SMS to contacs which uninstalled TextSecure; there should be a check like for push messages

column3: migrate nav panel items to actionbar
column4: It's confusing to have two menus that don't have a strong difference in the item categories, let's simplify the codebase and make it easier for users at the same time!  Resolves #1819

column3: [Feature request] Separate LED and status bar notifications
column4: It would be very nice to have less obvious way of notifying about incoming message. Now there's an information on status bar saying that there is a encrypted message with sender's name.  Less obvious would be to be able to disable status bar message at all but to keep LED blinking and/or sound. As an alternative -  changing status bar notification text to some simple icon would do the trick too. The icon would be more discreet than the whole notification text.

column3: Ignore groupinstance notifications for T time
column4: It would be really nice to have the option to ignore group notifications for specific groups. Not having this feature is really stopping me from using groups in TS because I don't want to get 100 notifications a minute I don't care about at that moment, but I also don't want to kill the notifications completely because somebody might want to contact me personally.

column3: Add support for multiple recipients (without groups)
column4: It would be nice to be able to send a message to multiple numbers without having to use the group function. If it is just for one message I should not need to create a new group.  edit: I just realized I cannot send messages through groups at all, if there is one person not using TextSecure. My provider/contract does not support MMS. So I am not able to use TextSecure for sending multiple messages without copy and pasting the content to every person -_-

column3: Adjustable font scaling
column4: It would be nice to be able to scale the font size of messages with respect to the system font size.  Sometimes it is convenient to see more conversation history on the screen at the expense of smaller sizes and reduced readability.

column3: Support for time base message deletion
column4: It would be nice if the sender can set a timebox that the message will be permanently deleted after that from tall receivers' devices. This can be the time after viewing the message or after the arrival of the message even if the message is not viewed. Something like spanchat and more

column3: Android Lollipop lock screen notification privacy
column4: It would be great if I was able to see the contents of the "TextSecure is unlocked" notification while on the lock screen but treat actual message notifications as private.  Furthermore, it would be good if TextSecure could provide an option to treat the sender vs content as private separately. For example, I would like to see the sender but not the message while on the lock screen.  I have no idea whether this is possible via the new Lollipop APIs but it seems like the message content could be easily omitted from the notification by TextSecure.

column3: Automatic SMS forwarding
column4: It would be awesome to be able to automatically forward all incoming SMS from a certain contact to another contact.

column3: TextSecure not catching all incoming SMS
column4: It works fine for some of my contacts but there seem to be some that never get picked up in TextSecure and instead show up in the default Android messages app. I have TextSecure configured to handle all messages but no luck.

column3: Won't open MMS
column4: It used to work then it didn't then it did again and now it doesn't after latest update. Tried restarting, switching from wi-fi to 4g. HTC One M8 on AT&T. http://hastebin.com/elubepavez

column3: no way to override old/wrong key by scanning
column4: it should be possible to override a stored key by scanning a new one. but it just says "warning, the scanned key does not match!".  if the user knows that the old key is outdated/gone, it should be possible to say "use the scanned key" at this place.

column3: TS adding new contact
column4: It seems when adding a new contact from the TS app, the info is lost going into the people app.  I am running TS on CM11m9, using the stock people (contact) app

column3: Can’t enable push messages
column4: ISSUE: On one of three phones of our family, Text Secure (TS) is not working: - First, after setting-up TS it connected to push-messages however, phone could only communicate with another phone with secure message in one direction (sending) but couldn’t receive from any of the other two. - Checked to use number with country code, enabled Gapps, rebooted; no luck. - Tried to disable push-messages and received error: “Error connecting to server!” - Deinstalled TS and reinstalled it again. Now, the phone cannot register with TS at all. Registration fails, because phone does not receive any sms with the required code from TS server, instead error message appears with something like "Network connectivity error ..." and TS recommends registration with call message. When doing it, registration code is noted and when enter, TS tells us "Network connectivity error ..." and registration fails. - Updated to latest TS 2.1.9 and still the same issue.  I’ve reported it on Support Centre here: http://support.whispersystems.org/customer/portal/questions/8356686-can-t-disable-push-messages-un-register-from-textsecure- And was asked to post it on issue tracker.  DEVICE INFO: First used TS 2.1.6, updated to TS 2.1.9, Nexus4, Android KitKat 4.4.4  CONNECTION:  Data (like the other two phones, which do work)  APP STATE:  Default settings  DEBUG LOG:  Issue on TS 2.1.9:  http://hastebin.com/qinudigafi Issue on TS 2.1.6:  http://hastebin.com/quzuvigugi

column3: Plaintext export does not export protocol push/sms
column4: Is this by design? Because I seem to remember that the export _did_ once carry that information, now the XMLBackupItem constructor is just fed a 0 for protocol.  I'd fix this, if I knew it wasn't removed by design. I couldn't readily find a commit that introduces/changes this.  If this is an attempt to abstract away from the whole protocol push/sms switcheroo, then I'd argue this is the wrong place to enforce it, since you're just throwing away data without any actual gain (it's saving the protocol='0' field anyway).

column3: Different Notification Tone for Group Chat
column4: Is it possible to add an option for selecting different Notification Tones for Group Chat and Single Messages? It would be much easier to distinguish between a Message send especially to me and some Friends chatting with each other in one of my Groups.

column3: All key fingerprints start with the same digits
column4: Is it a good thing that all keys I've seen so far, of all my contacts start with 05 ? Is it a bug, or done for a reason? Could we shorten the keys by 2 digits, as 05 is constant?

column3: Introduction of the new "About application" page (pull request pending)
column4: Introduction of a new "About application" page  This commit adds a new "About application" page with - version number from Manifest - urls: url text and link for license, ~~list of changes~~, support, bugreports - copyright text: (C) 2012-2014 Open Whisper Systems - easily extendable - based on concepts as found in https://github.com/schildbach/bitcoin-wallet - theme-aware "about" page

column3: MmsCommunication refactor
column4: Introduce MmsConnection class to handle incoming and outgoing network transactions, behaving as a simple abstraction layer over URLConnection objects.  Also another small change for general safety: in retry logic, check protocol before following links and prohibit https->http redirects.  Cuts down on redundant code and reduces a bit of confusion, keeping a majority of the static MMS-related methods to fewer classes.

column3: Cleanup of unused strings in strings.xml
column4: Inspired by the abandoned strings that were left when killing SMS/MMS sending failure toast (see #2030) Squished out ~3 KB for me - should be even more when the translations get cleaned

column3: Larger max text for PGP key transfer
column4: Increased the maximum text length so larger text can be transferred (like a PGP key.)

column3: sending sms possible when sms disabled in existing conversation
column4: In the version 2.3.2, When we choose the settings to allow outgoing SMS to check the options: Text Secure users or Non-Text Secure Users. I choose only the text secure users and sends message to other party without having the text secure application and the other party was able to receive the message. Device: Nexus 5 Android Version 5.0 lollipop

column3: "Duplicate message." in conversation after seeing the message in a notification
column4: In the TextSecure conversation, a message at 10:19am is listed as "Duplicate message." The message was visible as a system notification, but is not shown in the conversation window. Log located here: http://hastebin.com/kumediwame

column3: Remove magic number in GCM register
column4: In the RegistrationService the sender id of the TextSecure server was hard-coded, although present as a constant in the GcmRegistrationService.

column3: unable to initiate SMS session
column4: In the past I was able to start a secure session for sending SMS. This was the main use case for text secure. What happened to this feature?

column3: Update barcode library to fix QR-code scanning
column4: In the latest master I can't scan QR codes anymore. I'm getting this error:  ``` 11-07 18:40:28.814    2733-2733/org.thoughtcrime.securesms E/AndroidRuntime﹕ FATAL EXCEPTION: main     Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 2733 column3: Quota counting apps can't see TextSecure SMSes
column4: In the course of looking for an app to give consolodated totals of talk time, data usage, and sms usage, I've found none that can see SMSes sent through TextSecure. As an example of the class of app I mean is [Activity Monitor (Call sms data monitor counter)](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.msd.am.pub).   Is this a case of TextSecure not implementing an interface these apps are expecting? Or is it a case of these apps expecting the default messaging app to be used? If TextSecure is not the culprit here, I would love to be able to point the other app makers in the right direction so their software correctly queries TextSecure.  TextSecure 2.1.5 on Nexus 5 / CyanogenMod 11 / Android 4.4.4

column3: Trapped in push message activation activity on failure
column4: In the course of having difficulty getting push messages activated, I've uncovered some roughness with the error handling of the push message activation screen. When the "Verifying Number" screen displays the "Connectivity error" message, the back button does not work. The user must either click the edit button to try (and fail) again, or use the home button and open the App again to return to the main of TextSecure.  TextSecure 2.1.5 on Nexus 5 / CyanogenMod 11 / Android 4.4.4

column3: Replace button text to cancel TS registration
column4: in RegistrationActivity from "skip" to "cancel", when  coming from the reminder. Just like when opened from the new preferences...

column3: reading conversations during phone call not possibly
column4: In older version (can't say precisely up to which one) I could look into conversations during a phone call (with activated speaker).  Now I can open the overview of Textsecure, but when I click on a conversation, nothing happens.

column3: More aestethical emoticons
column4: In my opinion the emoticons are really ugly. Maybe there is a free emoticon pack out there, which is a bit nicer?

column3: Show if other person is typing
column4: In my opinion it would be a great enhancement to see if the other person is typing at the moment. If I write long texts for example and click on send but keep writing to send another message I often get interrupted because the other person doesn't know that some more messages will follow...  Would there be any chance to add something like "xy's typing" (WhatsApp) or some "..." (Hangouts)? Or do you think there's no need for it? Of course (if possible) you should be able to disable this feature if you think it invades your privacy!  What do you guys think?

column3: Feature Request: change contact names
column4: In my case just cell phone numbers are displayed so manual contact name resplacement would be fine.

column3: MIUI v5 - regular messages and Inbox
column4: In MIUI v5, all regular messages are coming to Inbox only. A tick in setting "Receive all SMS" does nothing. (Android version: 4.1.2, MIUI version MIUI-4.8.1

column3: TextSecure Android app cannot verify phone number in Korea.
column4: In Korea, most of carriers are providing anti-SMS phishing service by default. This service puts "[Web발신]\n" prefix to SMS body when they are sent through automated sending service. As a result, TextSecure app cannot recognize received verification code due to it only matches message begins with "Your TextSecure verification code: " (https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/service/SmsListener.java#L129). I think this matching filter should include wildcard in front of word "Your" or Throw away everything except last line and filter with them.  Here is screenshot of message which I received. ![sms](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1622360/4391848/e8d46fd2-4408-11e4-9424-6260404cb918.png)

column3: Use localized time format in message details
column4: In Germany we use without exception the 24h format. This is also configured in Android's localization settings. However, when opening the details of a message (long press -> message details) sent at, day 15:23, it comes up as "3:23 nachm." which makes absolutely no sense in German.

column3: Secure Push message seen with a green background
column4: In a secure thread, some messages randomly show up with a green background. Is this a known issue(something causes the message to go through the unsecure channel?) because the subsequent message goes just fine via the secure channel.  Here's the logs, http://hastebin.com/tinuwoceri.vhdl

column3: "Use 24-hour format"  system setting ignored
column4: in "Message details" view.

column3: SMS sending fails with spaces or hyphens in phone number
column4: Importing contacts sometimes creates hyphens or spaces in the stored number. Textsecure fails to send SMS to these invalid numbers; however the regular SMS application on Android fixes this issue automatically by ignoring these characters.

column3: Sent silent messages
column4: Imagine the following scenario: It's late at night, but you realized, that you forgot to write/say something to somebody. But it is really important, that the person gets the message by next morning. - You don't want to wake the other person, but you know his/her phone is aloud. - You cannot sent the message later   - because you're asleep then   - because you will probably forget   - because you're on the plain   - or whatever reason  My suggestion: Make it possible to send silent messages. These silent messages will not ring the phone on the other side. For this silent messages one can set up different notification settings (e.g. just show notification, but no sound). I think this is really a great feature and will, once established, prevent people to be woken up by messages they also could have read next morning.

column3: Fix empty contact filter not working properly
column4: If you want to start a new conversation with the "+" button, the "Select Contacts" window is shown. When you enter part of the name the filter is working as expected. But if you delete the filter again, just the TextSecure users are shown, not the rest of the contacts.  The filter needs to be checked for an empty string aswell, not just for null.

column3: Actionbar locale for single/multi contact selection not changing until restart
column4: If you switch the selected language the title in the action bar is not translate until restart. It keeps the language that was set on startup.  ![l10n_contact_selection](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5326916/2654621/773db060-bfd6-11e3-8949-63bd4b1fd0e9.png) _started in spanish, and switched to french_  Would have fixed that, but @mcginty is heavily working on that region so I issued this first.

column3: Contact List: Show all Numbers of one Android Contact
column4: If you have one Android contact with 2 mobile phones (= two Independent Text Secure Installations)  only  one of the cell phone numbers appears in the contact list under "Textsecure users".   If you would like to add the second " hidden" number to a group, you cannot do it, because the number is not visible in the list.  Android 5 / latest TS Version

column3: prevent another cursor leak
column4: if two queries happen because the first failed to find one with the apn discriminator, one cursor is leaked

column3: [bug] Duplicate message preview shows ciphertext
column4: If the last received message was a "duplicate message" the message preview in the pulldown notification shows the ciphertext.   What exactly is the reason of showing those messages at all? Do they occur when a message is transmitted by GCM over an unreliable connection? Why not silently drop them?  TS-Version: 2.3.3.  As this probably isn't device specific I won't add any further information. If those are needed, I'll gladly provide them tough.

column3: The Google Repository is needed to build TextSecure
column4: If the Google Repository is not installed, Gradle will complain that com.google.android.gms:play-services:6.1.71 is missing. Installing Google Play Services (counter intuitively) does not solve the issue. Solution found via: http://stackoverflow.com/a/25313527/1975217

column3: Receiving "~" from IOS 7 is displayed as "]"
column4: If someone sends an SMS with an iPhone to a TextSecure user, the tilde "~" character will show up as right square bracket "]"

column3: Wrong Toast messages on sending error
column4: If sending a push message failed due to a bad connnection the Toast message [`SmsReceiver_currently_unable_to_send_your_sms_message`](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/res/values/strings.xml#L418) is shown. Ignoring if it is either SMS, MMS or Push.  See [MMSSender](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/service/MmsSender.java#L112) [SMSSender](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/service/SmsSender.java#L151)  It's kind of confusing if TS tells you that the SMS could not be sent if it was a push message...

column3: Clarify RatchetingSession
column4: If isLowEnd is ever called, there is a very serious problem, and its just confusing code.

column3: Could GCM messages be lost when more than 100 pending messages are enqueued?
column4: If I understand the current status correctly, the Android version of TextSecure uses GCM exclusively.  According to the GCM documentation, only 100 messages will be stored if the receiving device is offline; if that limit is exceeded, **all queued messages will be deleted**: http://developer.android.com/google/gcm/adv.html#lifetime  Is this currently handled on the server side, or could messages potentially be lost? Could the iOS store-and-forward implementation be used to solve that problem?

column3: Re-enable encrypted database export
column4: If I understand correctly, the only current option allows for any other app which can access the SD card to read all exported messages in plain text.  Maybe there was a good reason for the removal of this feature but I couldn't find it so sorry if my issue is redundant.

column3: Can't send multi-recipient SMS (TextSecure changes to MMS instead)
column4: If I try to send an SMS to multiple people (using the group functionality, that is the only way I can find to do this) that are not using TextSecure, the program wants to send that as an MMS. My normal SMS program (stock one in PACMan ROM based on Android 4.2.2) allows sending this as SMS instead, by sending a separate SMS to each recipient.   Given that I have 5000 free SMS per month but MMS cost a small amount of money per message on my carrier this is not an option for me. For now I uninstalled TextSecure until this issue can be fixed, this is a feature I can not live without.

column3: Emticons with audio attachment are shown as question marks.
column4: If I send someone an audio attachment with emoticons as a text, the recipient receives the audio attachment correctly but the emoticons are only shown as question marks. On my phone the emoticons of the message I sent are shown correctly.  Textsecure version: 2.0.8 Android: 4.2.2 and also tested on Android: 2.3.7 Push registered.

column3: Back Stack Issues
column4: If I click back on a message, I often see the same message multiple times. A single message should only be in the back stack once. Also after clicking a notification, clicking back should return you to your previous app, now cycle you through all activity of TextSecure.

column3: Avoid multiple drafts when creating a draft from an intent
column4: If a draft is created through an intent any existing draft for the thread needs to be cleared. Otherwise the old drafts pops up after sending the new one, or when deleting the new one and leaving the thread 'draftless'

column3: Unable to Message Users That Uninstalled TextSecure
column4: I've seen this mentioned a few times about 8 months back, and I'm just wondering: what's the current solution to this problem?  Let's say the user is unwilling to re-install TS to de-register their account from the network. What's the plan at that point? I've had this happen with a few friends, even just when they've had to temporarily use loner phones, and it's fairly frustrating. I spend a bit of time each day reading on privacy and security. They're very important to me, and for someone like me/us, having to mess around with this stuff is no big deal. But for the average person? Believe me, bits of friction like this are more than enough to turn them off completely, making widespread adoption all but impossible.  If you need any additional information, don't hesitate to ask.

column3: Unable to send PUSH messages (with possible fix)
column4: I've installed TS, and until a few minutes ago I was unable to send any kind of PUSH message, it was defaulting to SMS, all the time. Admittedly there is only one contact in my list that I can use TS with. The app wasn't recognizing this contact as a TS user, it appeared in the list of TS users, but I could only send SMS (which failed right away because I disabled the SMS send function from the options).  From what I can tell the problem is that when I exchanged my identity with this contact (over SMS) I didn't have the international prefix included in his number (he's from another country). This created an entry within my SMS database with that number. After installing TS and being unable to send PUSH messages I noticed this and added the international prefix. Nothing changed and I was still unable to send messages. Upon sending more messages I noticed that at the top of the window, next to the contact name there was still the old number without the prefix. At first I thought this was a display issue, but then I cleared the app's data, redid the initial setup but SKIPPED the SMS import procedure. This fixed the problem. Without any previous SMS to take the number from, the app took it from the contact list (or at least that's what I assume has happened) and of course took the right one. I can now send PUSH without any problem and at this point importing the SMS db worked fine and kept the correct number.  I hope this help somebody and can be fixed.  Cheers

It opens as the picture from Contact A. Contact C sends me a picture. It comes through normally. Contact A sends another picture. It comes through as the picture from Contact C.   Also, I've noticed that if someone sends a picture to a group, 99% of the time I get no thumbnail (just an empty box), and a "Media not Found" error when I try to open it.

column3: Improve privacy of contact discovery
column4: I've been reading a lot of blog posts, reviews and user feedback about TS lately.  At least in Europe many people really aren't comfortable with the fact that it's currently not possible to opt out of uploading all phone numbers to the TS server, myself included.  This is also not something only the crypto nerds (I mean that in a very positive way!) complain about, but also many average users. Probably because it's one of the few things they really understand in the difficult landscape of privacy and security. And especially the uninformed are very anxious when they are asked to give all their contacts away. They wouldn't give their own number to any stranger on the streets and now they are supposed to give some strangers on the internet all of their friends numbers? The internet is the place where all the russian cybercriminals steal their money and evil smartphone apps are the way they get the TANs for the banking accounts, right?  This argument is typically used in conjunction with something along the lines of "they are using US(=NSA) servers, oh no!". The second complaint may not be of any factual difference for the safety of the messages in a good crypto system, but that doesn't matter. It's repeated over and over again in blogs and reviews. Allowing users to opt-out is one of the easier things we can do to make privacy-aware users happy (and kill the US-server argument once and for all).  I am aware of https://whispersystems.org/blog/contact-discovery/ and https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/692 and would like to discuss the possibilities we have to increase the privacy of the TS contact discovery process. It appears that we are currently waiting for the silver bullet to be discovered, which probably won't happen any time soon.  Below I listed the simplest solutions I could think of, which appear not to be overly complex to implement, but still give a good balance between effort and privacy. If you have other/better proposals, I'm all ears! 1. Allow the user to opt-out and download the whole bloom filter 2. Allow the user to opt-out and download a subset of the bloom filter    based on the country code of the contacts. Realistically most people    don't have contacts from more than 1-3 countries. It's a little less    private and people with contacts from India, China and the US won't be    much better off data volume wise, but most users will. 3. Allow the user to opt-out and manually upgrade to push from the    settings menu. This would be typically only used if the user knows the    contact to be registered. This doesn't leak any information about    unregistered users to the server and is basically what Threema does iirc.  If we end up using 1. or 2., updates could be provided with tiny daily/hourly builds. This way the client only needs to know the global/server time + age of his database and can grab only the updates he's missing.  If somebody needs to try push messages with the friend that just installed TS, because he told him about this great and secure app, we simply allow the user to do the manual upgrade from 3.  The privacy-minded users will sacrifice the 40MB+ volume or do it when they are on wifi. I know dozens of people who downloaded gigabytes of OSM maps for OsmAnd.  When other identifiers like emails will be allowed (https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/1085) we are obviously in for another ride. The easiest solution would probably be https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/1259 and allowing the user to enter the identifier manually if they aren't in the same location. Email addresses could be imported from the Android address book and upgraded via 3. tough.  The preferred "privacy friendly" setting should be preselected if https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/838 will be implemented.  Thanks for taking the time to read this, I'll appreciate all input!

column3: What does play-services dependency introduce?
