It specifically calls for `com.google.android.gms:play-services:5.0.89`.  As a **gapp**-less user, will this cause issues with installation?  Am I doing something wrong that I need these dependencies?  If they are now required, what potential issues does this raise?  Thanks

column3: Can't receive messages via WhisperPush (TextSecure)
column4: I'm trying to use TextSecure as a messenger, but so far I can't receive any messages from others via TextSecure.   I'm using the OnePlus One with CM11 and build R33 (although there is an update to R38). I activated the WhisperPush account with the phone number and got the activation code, but I was never asked to set up a passphrase or anything else.  When I wanted to chat with my contact, which has TextSecure as well, but on Android 4.4. The messages he sends aren't delivered and the messages I send seem to be send as normal texts/sms.  Could it be that I haven't got a Google Account and therefore aren't logged in?  Any ideas where the problem could be?  Thanks Fukurai

column3: Can't send SMS to numbers with MS Outlook phone number format
column4: I'm trying out TextSecure for the first time and wanted to send SMS to friends, who's contacts are stored in my exchange account. The numbers were entered in MS Outlook and are stored in this (year long default) format:  ``` +xx (xxx) xxxxxxx ```  The sending of the message fails without giving a reason. (I can text these people with the on-board messaging app and I can call them, so the number is correct.)  After playing around a bit, I noticed that the parentheses seem to be the culprit. Any other Android app silently discards them and dials the number. I added a new number manually (without parentheses) and things worked out just fine.  Then I changed the number of the aforementioned friend to not contain the parentheses anymore in my address book and tried to re-add him to TextSecure. Unfortunately TextSecure somehow caches the old/other number somewhere and I'm not able to enter his number in any way. Neither by selecting it from the (now updated) address book, nor by entering it manually without any special characters. I guess #791 is related here.  Both problems are real show stoppers for using TextSecure. (I'm not able to update all phone numbers in the corporate phone book ;-))  Device-Specs: Alcatel One Touch Idol X+ Dual SIM (but just using 1 SIM currently) Android: 4.2.2

I've TS configured to handle secure messages only (see http://abload.de/img/ts1eksfv.png and http://abload.de/img/ts2kxpzr.png)   Last night I've got an encrypted (transport SMS, message colored grey) message from an unknown number (not in phonebook, don't know it at all).  The session itself doesn't have the padlock and I only see the received message as "Message encrypted for non-existing session" with the padlock. When answering I've only unencrypted SMS (green arrow, padlock open) as choice so it seems that also the key exchange didn't happen. There is also no key for this number within "Manage Identity Keys". I've created a contact with this number before asking back (unencrypted sms) who is writing from this number.

After having set TextSecure as my default SMS app, I was no longer able to dismiss the notification.  I was able to work around this by temporarily setting the built-in app as the default, dismissing the message, and then setting TextSecure as the default again.  Not a huge deal, but a minor usability annoyance.  Really awesome app, thanks for making it!

column3: Make scroll to new message on send optional.

I really liked being able to answer questions one by one without having to scroll back up every time I replied to one.

column3: Feature request: Multi-device syncing without putting keys in the cloud
column4: I'd love the ability to use Signal/TextSecure as my primary messaging app, but the lack of multi-device syncing is holding me back.  At the same time, I know that most services that offer multi-device syncing (Hangouts, iMessage, etc) do so by storing your keys in the cloud, making your communications snoopable.  So, I think it would be cool if I could get multi-device syncing from WhisperSystems apps, through directly transferring my secret key from one device to another, for example through NFC or WiFi direct.  This might call for decoupling WhisperSystems IDs from PSTN phone numbers.

Please help me by trimming unneeded fat from the following list: ### Prerequisites - "Android SDK manager" - "Java Development Kit (JDK)" compiler for example openjdk-devel - JRE alone is not enough. At least version 7 of Java is required. - The following packages should be installed via the package manager: Android Support Repository, Android Support Library, Android SDK build-tools 19, Google Play Services, Android 4.4.2 (API 19) SDK Platform, Android 5.0 (API 21) SDK Platform, Android 4.4W.2 (API 20) SDK Platform, Google Repository.

column4: i wanted to send a text to a handful of folks instead of copy / pasting to them all. it seems like the only way to do this is by creating a group. i created the group, and then remembered one additional person that i wanted to add, but there seems no way to add someone after the group is created. i was forced to delete the group and start over.

column3: option to deliberately send sms to textsecure user
column4: I usually communicate with a friend of mine using textsecure, but she is out of country and has no internet connection at the moment. is it possible for me to write an (unencrypted) sms to her instead of a textsecure message, without changing my default settings in textsecure? i could not find such an option in the app. for the moment i just use another sms app for sending, but this seems not to be an optimal solution for this problem.  my suggestion would be a context menu option when sending a message, where one can chose to send an sms just this once (with an appropriate warning maybe). in my opinion, the combined push/sms usage of textsecure fails to work for traveling people right now

column3: GCM message not arriving accurate time
column4: i used GCM push notification in android application to web server to device notification but sometimes i make delay to receive notification. what can i do you?

column3: Push messages are not sent/received
column4: I use TS quite frequently with a lot of people. But sometimes some people do not get my messages. often I can re register for push-messages and it will work again. Still it will break some other conversations and soon I'll have the same issue again. I am using TS 2.1.8 on Android 4.2.2 I think there should be a feature to see if the other person received the message or it should be more reliable.  great app anyhow.  same bug here: http://support.whispersystems.org/customer/portal/questions/6354161-push-messages-are-not-sent-received

column3: Add dark design in import/expert view
column4: I use the dark design but in the import/export view there is only the light design.

column3: Auto init secure session dialog?
column4: I use TextSecure 1.0.6. When a people (who also use TextSecure) send me a message, this app pop up a dialog to request me establish a secure session. Why this happen? Maybe normal message padding for something special ... I cannot find answer in wiki protocol.  Thanks

column3: Encryption Completely Broken
column4: I updated the application just now and the application seems to have completely lost the capability to send encrypted messages. The lock icon on the top right of the thread that allowed you to start an encrypted session has been completely  removed. All of my conversations that were previously being encrypted have stopped being encrypted. Further, when the application is locked, the contents of the message is shown in plaintext in the notification area. I'm using a Galaxy S3 with Android 4.3

column3: Improve error messages
column4: I tried to send a push message today to someone that I've exchanged push messages with in the past.  Rather than showing a blue text bubble, the message I sent was displayed in a green bubble, with a warning below it, "Error sending message". There was also a big red warning triangle on the left hand side of the screen.  What was missing, though, was any useful information letting me know what exactly failed.  It turns out that my contact had decided to stop using textsecure. The only way I figured this out was by asking him.  Is there a way to improve this message? It is quite possible that people will try out textsecure and then stop using it. This failure message is not very helpful.

column3: How to configure Android Developer Tools (ADT) for TextSecure? (if this is possible)
column4: I tried to follow the instructions on https://github.com/WhisperSystems/RedPhone/wiki/Configuring-Eclipse to setup my ADT for building TextSecure, but failed to use the ADT for building TextSecure. (Before you ask, yes using `./gradlew build` does work.)  If it is possible, can anyone perhaps create a new and updated Wiki page for TextSecure, i.e. how to configure and using ADT for building and debugging TextSecure?

column3: add PushDownloaderJob
column4: I tried to add a job to download the push attachments to fix #1264. The job is added to the new JobManager in `SendReceiveService` and should start the `PushDownloader`.   Unfortunately it's not working as expected: If there is no network connection when the job is added, its delayed and the download starts as soon as the connection is established again (like it should). But if the download fails because the connection is lost during the download the `IOException` is thrown and the job seems to be deferred, but its not started again when the network connection comes back.  I thought perhaps @mcginty has an idea why the job is not started again? What did I forgot? _(edit: I thought the jobManager is from mcginty, but its from moxie...)_

column3: [bug] can't send unencrypted message to another user
column4: I tried sending an unencrypted message to a TS user and I didn't run into any success. When I long press on send icon and select "send unencrypted" it just sent the message over push as encrypted (blue message with lock). http://hastebin.com/iwujaxibem

column3: revert content-type generics
column4: I think we should focus our efforts on viewing the media in-app, and this change seems to do more damage than good. Reverting.

column3: Disable notification for certain groups
column4: I think one of the more important features would be to be able to stay subscribed to a group but do not get the invasive notifications that one wants to have for regular contacts.  I see that becoming a practical problem with growing groups around me as I spread TS.

column3: Feature: Add attachment from "Camera"
column4: I think it would be great if there was an option to add an attachment directly from the camera (picture or video) without having to have it saved to an unencrypted media first.

column3: Error updating contacts
column4: I texted a contact, then later edited their number to include the area code. Trying to text this contact still doesn't work because the number hasn't been updated even though in my contact book and regular messaging system it does have their newly added area code.

column3: Suddenly fails to send or receive SMS
column4: I suddenly can't send text messages anymore to non-TextSecure users.  http://hastebin.com/ixiwulezuf  Receiving texts does not work anymore either, which is pretty scary.

column3: taking SMS message as encrypted and replying back in clear text?
column4: I starting using this week. all of a sudden no SMS messages. Had to sign on the Textsecure to read message and reply. But reply was in Standard SMS [not secure] I went thru SET up and have changed it around so standard SMS message should remain in the clear and SecureText will remain in secure format. That is what I wanted in the first place..

column3: Sometimes problems sending textmessages
column4: I sometimes have problems sending text message (sms). Sometimes the reason appears to be that the message is to long. When I split it, it then works, But this does not always appears to be the reason. I have found the logic yet, but I get the feeling, it might have something to do with German Umlauts or "?". It is not really easy to recreate. Here my hastebin: http://hastebin.com/lazejozucu

column3: don't crash if we can't get an mccmnc
column4: I shouldn't be throwing an uncaught exception when we can't work out a phone's MCC/MNC, we should just be going up the normal logic chain of not being able to find a matching APN.  Fixes #1916

column3: Delivery receipts not working for MMS to non-TextSecure users
column4: I send MMS to some friends that do not use TextSecure.  They receive the picture fine but I never get a delivery receipt.

column3: Make the push registration call voice repeat the number at least once
column4: I searched but could not find an issue about this.  The 6 letter number you are told when using the "confirmation by call" for the push registration is only said once. Unless you know that beforehand and write it down quickly or if you have a good talent of quickly memorising the numbers you are in a bad situation and will probably need to toggle another call.  Please make the numbers be repeated at least once so slower people have a change of using that service successfully. Or announce them slower.

column3: Sending but not receiving
column4: I restored the app with titanium backup after an issue with my phone and since then, I can send TextSecure but not receiving them. Interestingly, the other side gets their messages blue with lock symbol, as if I received them. http://hastebin.com/wunomaguyu  Any idea?

column3: Replace telephone numbers in a new group chat with contact names
column4: I replaced the telephone numers in a new group chat with the corresponding contact names or in case of the own number with "Me". I also made some old strings translatable.  I copied the check for the own number from #1505 and put it in isOwnNumber(). Perhaps we could put this method in a place where it could be used from both PR's?  **before:** ![before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/3379294/30824ffa-fbef-11e3-9b6b-6c739c3cfbdc.png) **after:** ![after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/3379296/33605514-fbef-11e3-960f-cc4bcbbdba1e.png)

column3: Replace "push" with "data"
column4: I replaced the following strings:  push message -> data message push service -> data message service push directory -> TextSecure directory  This fixes issue #1139

column3: Remove tabs and change 4 space indent to 2 space
column4: I removed the tabs in several files and fixed the indent in RecipientsEditor (4 spaces)  I didn't fix the indent in AttachmentTypeSelectorAdapter because thats done in #1551.

column3: Regroup preferences
column4: I regrouped the preferences like discussed in the mailing list. I put notifications, old message deletion and passphrase into their own category pages. This is saving us ten items in the preference list. Its looking like this now:  ![settings_red](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/3365453/6671a82a-fb2e-11e3-9837-ecf3829fbbc2.png) ![notifications](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5296073/3365455/682daf7e-fb2e-11e3-90bf-fd5d964112e0.png)  But I dont know how to add the "back arrow" in the red square to the new PreferenceScreen's. Do you know how to put it there?  And I'm not sure about the new category for the PreferenceScreen's. I put them in "Miscellaneous" now, but perhaps you have a better idea?

column3: Can't send SMS on T-mobile WiFi Calling
column4: I recently upgraded to version 2.3.2 from 2.1.10. After doing so, I can no longer send SMS messages over T-mobile's WiFi Calling, although I can receive them just fine. I can send PUSH messages over WiFi Calling, and if I disable WiFi calling I can send SMS over the cellular network. If I used the built-in Messaging app, I can send SMS over WiFi Calling with no problem.  This seems similar to #2137 so I disabled XPrivacy, but that doesn't fix anything. I'm creating a new issue because I'm not having problems with PUSH messages or with receiving SMS.  Device: HTC One M7, T-mobile stock Android 4.4.3, TextSecure 2.3.2  App state: Push registered, incoming SMS enabled, outgoing SMS fully enabled  Debug logs: http://hastebin.com/unofirefar

column3: bad encrypted message (once again)?
column4: I recently reinstalled the Android on my Nexus 5, from stock to CM11. I have used TS many times successfully to exchange messages with my gf (previously CM11 on Galaxy S, now stock CM11 on One+One). Since I reinstalled TS on the new system, all of our messages appear as "bad encrypted message". I tried unregistering for PUSH and reregistering, but this didn't change anything. Any ideas what might go wrong?  One thing that might be relevant: On the new system, I disabled backup & restore of app settings from Google servers before installing anything. I guess this means I have new crypto keys, but shouldn't this simply trigger a warning on her side?

column3: Oppo Find 5 mini not send SMS
column4: I recently installed TextSecure on muy new Oppo R827, but have problems because I can not send SMS messages to any contact. Simply messages are not sent. Can you please help me?

column3: improve error messages when sending message fails
column4: I recently installed CyanogenMod but can't remember how I backed things up, in any case I reregistered my number. I think I was writing with that contact after I switched to CM, but one day, she couldn't write me anymore. My messages to her were delivered just fine and she could read them, but she couldn't reply via push (SMS was disabled). Trying to end a secure chat also didn't work, she got the termination message but the app couldn't reply.   I just reregistered my number again and now she can text me just fine. So I'm not sure what went wrong, but I'm reporting this because I think there should be more diagnostics or messages why something couln't be delivered instead of just failing to send anything without explanation.

column3: Can't send messages over data [SOLVED]
column4: I recently downloaded and installed TextSecure because of, what I've heard, it's ease of use and security. But now that I have it installed on my phone I realised everything doesn't seem to work as easy as I thought for a newbie user as myself.  My main problem is that for the moment, it seems like the TextSecure app can't recognise who among my contacts is a registered TS (push) user.  I know at least one of my (international)friends is but when I tap on her number and want to send a message through data the only option that shows up is nonencrypted sms. Also, when I untick the box for sms to non-TS users non of the contacts are displayed when I tap the + icon. Is there something I have to do before I can send messages through data except registering for push or is there something I'm missing? Is there supposed the be some kind of notice if you send over data or via sms at all before you actually send the message and green/blue bubble shows up?   I'm running the 2.1.1 version of the app on a G3, I went through the installation process without problems and have registered for push. I had to uninstall and then reinstall the app twice though because the app didn't recognise my password after I locked it. The timed lock feature seems to be broken too because after the set time no password is needed to unlock the app, not sure if that has anything to do with my problem but I thought I should mention it anyway. I'm pretty sure my friend is also running the 2.1.1 version.

column3: HTC One M8 - crashes when I try to send encrypted msgs.  (non-encrypted is fine)
column4: I recently changed from a Samsung GS4 to an HTC One M8, and I installed TextSecure as I loved it on the GS4.  I tried to send my daughter a msg. (it showed her as already being a text secure user even before I sent a msg.) and the app crashes every single time.  If I send unencrypted things to anyone (including her) it works fine.

column3: Desktop Client - Synchronize Chats
column4: I read that a Desktop version of TextSecure is planned (or maybe already is under development). It would be fantastic, if my chat history is synchronized via my PC and my phone, so I can start a chat on my Phone and continue it later on on my PC.

column3: Desktop Client for Linux
column4: I read that a Desktop version of TextSecure is planned (or maybe already is under development). I suggest also a Linux desktop client.

column3: Copy & paste of messages that were not delivered correctly
column4: I ran into the "bad encryption" problem with one contact (see issue 1451). After ending and restarting the session we were able to communicate again. However, my contact now tried to resend the messages that previously reached my end as "bad encryption" and they reached me as "bad encryption" again.  Even using copy and paste of the text, TextSecure seems to send the already (badly) encrypted message and not create a new message.

column3: Rate limit exceptions should be handled better
column4: I ran into a situation today where TS told me that "SMS is not available" constantly. Looking into the logs revealed that it was in fact a rate limit exception. - This should be communicated to the user. Some message like "you're sending messages too fast" would be nice. - TS should not try to resend those messages immediately, but rather wait - Ideally, the TS server should present the client with a captcha that clears the timeout

column3: Samsung Galaxy S3 problem
column4: I previously had a Droid Razr Maxx HD with Textsecure work flawlessly. The newest version of Textsecure doesn't seem to actually have an option to encrypt the conversations on the Samsung Galaxy S3. Anybody have this problem and/or know how to fix it?

column3: TextSecure keeps launching its unlock activity, interrupting other applications
column4: I posted this to the whispersystems mailing list, and was directed here.  TextSecure keeps arbitrarily (not related to receiving any sms) launching it's unlock activity.  This will completely interrupt a running application.  Also, sometimes when I unlock my phone, the TextSecure unlock activity is showing, despite not having been active when I locked it.  I captured a debug log immediately after this happened.   http://hastebin.com/qetemaveyi  Of note: I am running TextSecure 2.0.7 on Android 4.4.2 on a Samsung Galaxy Note3 on TMobile.  Hope this helps.  If there is anything I can do to help debug this issue further, please feel free to contact me.  Cheers, Darrik

column3: Not being able to send messages issue is back, this time not on sms, but push
column4: I opened #1038 before, which dealt with others not receiving my sms. This time, they don't receive my push messages.  http://hastebin.com/necaxogihi

column3: "Send SMS" in context menu still sends data message when an attachment is present
column4: I noticed the following behaviour:  When an image (or something else) is attached, the context menu options still show "send unencrypted SMS" "send encrypted SMS" but using either one still sends a TS data message including the attachment.  I think either those buttons should not be shown after an attachment was added or they should produce some kind of error message, telling the user that he should remove the attachment.  Attached is a quick implementation for the second version.  This error continues somewhere deeper, because the forceSms parameter from ConversationActivity:sendMessage:1073 was forwarded to ConversationActivity:sendMediaMessage:1097 and then to MessageSender:send:56 and then to MmsDatabase:insertMessageOutbox:575 and then to... actually I lost track there, but I don't have a good understanding of the transport mechanisms working there.  I think someone more experienced should have a look why the forceSms parameter ultimatively still doesn't prevent the message from being sent as a data message / mms, maybe @moxie0 ?  There still needs to be a user notification, so I think this pull request is fine anyways. Alternatively, fixing the bug somewhere else and just removing the buttons when an attachment is added would be fine for me as well.

column3: Moved several hard-coded UI strings to strings.xml
column4: I noticed some strings were not localised when my phone was set to French, and then realised that these strings were actually hard-coded. So I moved them all to strings.xml, which also required some minor code changes to get the context in scope, in order to fetch the string in some cases.

column3: Group issue: User in group list, but did not received group invitation and cannot access group
column4: I noticed a strange issue: I created a group recently with a couple of members, all except one received their invitation and are able to communicate within the group. Concerning one user, I got a notification (that I cannot remember) indicating a problem delivering the invitation.  The current situation is as follows:  - This user is listed among the group members, such that I cannot add him again. - The user never received an invitation and can therefore not see / join the group. - Obviously, the user can not leave the group, such that I cannot add him again.  I have a couple of suggestions here :)   It would be good if at least the creator of the group would be able to delete users from the group (also useful in case a wrong user was accidentally added).  It would also be great to be able to resent the invitation (this could be done automatically possibly?)  Thanks, Tobi

column3: Show Drafts in ConversationList
column4: I modified ThreadDatabase.update() to show an italic "Draft" in the ConversationList, when a draft exists. This way threads with drafts are shown on the top (sorted by date) and drafts for new recipients don't show the default "(No subject)" text. I'm not sure if I implemented this the correct way. I added a new constant MESSAGE_DRAFT_BIT in MmsSmsColumns.Types to indicate the conversation contains a draft.

column3: remove deferred jobs from persistent DB before they get added again
column4: I made a mistake in #2033. If a persistent job terminates with `JobResult.DEFERRED` it will be added to the JobManager again. But then it would be twice in the persistent database.   With this patch it gets deleted first from the DB before adding the Job to the JobManager again. That feels a bit weird, but I didn't found an easy way of re-adding the job to the queue without writing it to the persistent database. Some one has a better solution?  //FREEBIE

column3: Bring back the encrypted backup!
column4: I loved the fact that I could export an encrypted backup of my texts. Version 2.1.0 took this functionality away, please put it back ASAP or make a disclaimer on why it's gone.

column3: Images not saved to SD card
column4: I long press to select an incoming photo and then tap save. Image noted as saved, but nothing is shown in SD card. Currently 2.1.10; was working in previous version.

column3: Cannot send while connected to tmobile through wifi calling
column4: I live in an out of service area and so I use Tmobile's wifi calling feature a lot.  TextSecure has worked wonderfully for a long time (a couple years) but just very recently, I cannot send text messages while connected via the wifi calling.  I can receive text messages using wifi calling, but then I have to switch to the regular texting app that came with my phone to send anything.  If I'm connected to cell service directly, I can both send and receive without issue.  My phone is an HTC Amaze, not rooted, running android 4.0.3.    The debug log from textSecure's settings menu shows just this:  Device: HTC HTC_Amaze_4G (htc_ruby) Android: IML74K OS Host: abm022 App  :TextSecure 2.3.3  (the "app" line is formatted on my phone with two spaces before the colon and none after)

column3: Not possible to scan qr code for regular contact
column4: I know, the SMS feature is going to die, but nevertheless I found an issue. I got the number of a friend which uses secure SMS only and did neither have push enabled, nor mobile data on his phone. I wanted to send him a secure SMS but I was not able to, I was not even able to scan his qr-code. he had to enable his mobile data and enable push and then we have been able to exchange keys. Isn't the qr code feature exactly for a usw case like that?

column3: Desktop client
column4: I know this is a huge feature request and my intention is to begin the discussion.  I've just started using TextSecure as a secure replacement for Google Hangouts. I use Hangouts both on my Android phone and on the desktop, so that I can switch to a full size keyboard when I am at home or work. This is a great feature that I'd love to see implemented by a secure messaging system.  My suspicion is that multiple clients acting as the same identity (and hence all being able to read the same chat history and send messages) is either impossible or very difficult to achieve in a client-side encryption model. Is this true?  Do you have any intention to support such a feature in the short or long term?

column3: remove workaround for nested PreferenceScreen's
column4: I know it's some minutes too late, but you always realize another thing when the changes are in... ;)  This workaround was introduced here: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/commit/815613cfaabdc456b86eb6fdccfcb61273d523f6  It fixed some theming issues with nested PreferenceScreen's. But we're not using them anymore (since a long time...), so I guess this is unnecessary.

column3: lost/not received push messages (during reinstall)
column4: I know it's not a common case, but maybe this helps tracking down, why sometimes messages get lost. I had to uninstall my TS debug build because it deleted my keystore. - I backed up TS data directory - uninstalled TS - installed new build - started TS and closed when installation wizards showed up - restored data restarted TS --> sending and receiving works fine - but later I was told that I should have received a few messages which i did not  Is about 17 hours now and the messages did not show up yet. So I wonder if they are deleted, already fetched or still in queue? Logs are error-free. I can provide the sending and receiving numbers to moxie.debug@whispersystems.org.

column3: Problems with plaintext import
column4: I just moved to a new phone, and in doing the following steps found the errors mentioned and starred:  Make plaintext backup on old device (HTC Evo shift), to SD card Copy to new device SD card (Kyocera Rise) using Mac desktop Disconnect phone from Mac Start TextSecure for the first time Verify number Import SMS already in Kyocera Rise’s native SMS system Finish first-time setup Import plaintext backup from SD card *\* Got “Error importing backup!” *\* Yet it seems to have imported everything anyway *\* All timestamps in list view seem to be from moment of import, but in messages, they are from the original date of conversation. *\* Because I did not realize it had imported, I imported it twice, and now all messages are duplicated Tried to submit debug log *\* Got “Could not grab logs from your device. You can still use ADB to submit debug logs instead.”  *\* This was not enough information; I don’t know what ADB is. Because of all duplicates, deleted TextSecure and started over. *\* On importing this time, first import did not appear to import the plaintext file, but it also did not give me an error message.  Second import did import it.  Messages not duplicated this time.

column3: TS crashes (?)
column4: I just had TS ask for the password (nothing new so far). However, when I pulled down the Android menu I had the persistent notification saying that TS was unlocked. The problem is that it shouldn't ask for the password if the notification says that it's unlocked :| What's up? I'd open #2174, which was closed for no good reason and never re-opened.

column3: TS crashes (?)
column4: I just had TS ask for the password (nothing new so far). However, when I pulled down the Android menu I had the persistent notification saying that TS was unlocked. What's up?

column3: [bug?] unencrypted SMS in clear text in status bar
column4: I installed Version 2.1.0 of textsecure... and since then, Messages are shown in clear text in the Status bar, even if TS is locked...(also after a reboot of my phone)  add: it happens with unencrypted SMS, encrypted ones are shown the same way as before... I don't know about push messages, haven't got one since installing TS 2.1.0

column3: TS caching old phone number? (SMS)
column4: I installed TS while on holiday in the UK.  I started using it as the default SMS app and it picked up my friend's info and number number 07951 XXX XXX from the android address book (4.4, Nexus 5) and we could send messages etc. - So far so good. We are just using plain SMS as my friend does not have TS.  However, I have now returned to the country I live in (Japan) so I had to update my friend's number to include the international prefix +44 7951 XXX XXX in my Android address book .  However, whenever I try to send that person an SMS now using TS it fails to send. the old 07951 number is also displayed at the top of the thread under their name.  I am wondering if TS is still trying to send to the old number which will fail since it does not include the intl prefix? I have tried deleting the thread to no avail.  However incoming SMSes from that friend do turn up in the correct thread (TS seems to recognise that the new international prefix'd number is still my friend).   It also displays the correct intl number in the "select contacts" screen when I start a new thread with that friend.  Debug Log: http://hastebin.com/isefolaqid  Line 365 looks pretty suspicious; it looks like it might be assuming my friend is in Japan which implies it is not seeing the new intl prefix.  I have also seen a number of other issues here that look similar but they are usually to do with TS  TS communication rather than plain SMS.

column3: I keep receving coded texts , after uninstallation.
column4: I installed text secure based off a recommendation by a friend. I realized most of my contacts don't use this service so I uninstalled it. I now have two contacts that use text secure , and whenever they attempt to text me I get a unreadable message.  Like this  : HHJABBAOOIWHAHS3123191362ASAIHASBSD814612401246+KABQIWRB7579127.  It is not a HUGE deal but its quite a hassle , for them and for me, to constantly remind them that they cant use text secure when messaging me. I assume that since I used to use TextSecure , that somehow it is still thinking that I can receive secure messagaes ? Even after uninstallation?   ( Clarification : I can message Textsecure users , and they receive " Hey , how are you" ,  however when they respond all I receive is " KAKSHHAO+89HABIFUBIWOH+AISHBASFIUASF" , when in reality they said " I'm good how are you")  I have done alot of research and I was told that sometimes it takes the developers some time to \* unregister\* phone numbers ; however it has been over 2 months.  Any ideas or suggestions would be immensely helpful!

column3: Homescreen widget
column4: I implemented a widget just showing the number of unread messages. Please consider for integrating as I miss this feature.  -Eyck

column3: MMS slideshows: only 1 image displayed
column4: I imagine this is a feature request, but when receiving MMS messages with multiple images, only a single image is displayed and there is no (apparent) way to access the other images or any indication that the MMS contained multiple slides. Future support for MMS slideshows would be great.

column3: Mark people as "verified"
column4: I I meet a person in person - there should be a way to store the fact that he got scanned in person via qr code - for example through a green circle around the picture or something like this...

column3: [bug?] Push only in send direction after import of backup
column4: I hope that I don't mention an old Topic again.  Last week I set my phone to factory state, installed Textsecure and imported the backup. At first, it couldn't decrypt anything and crashed. After opening again, it works just fine.  But: I sent push messages to a friend and she received them, but I didn't get her answers.  Now, after deactivating and reactivating push Messages, it works again.

column3: Virgin Mobile (US) MMS failure
column4: I haven't been able to receive any MMS messages, even on the latest update while encrypted or not encrypted. I have the proper mms settings setup and still having issues. Suggestions?

column3: Bad encrypted message in 2.0.6 and before
column4: I have two TS clients, which were not able to communicate with 2.0.5. Every message was received as bad encrypted message (see https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/1213#issuecomment-38847704)   I installed 2.0.6 on both devices and re-registered for the push service. I updated the push contacts on both devices. Receiving from and sending to other TS clients is working fine on both devices. But the bad encrypted message problem between these two TS clients persists. The same problem is described in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/1296 but the solution "end/restart the encrypted session" could not be applied, because password was disabled on one device and blank on the other. To be able to restart the session I enabled and set nonempty passwords and restarted the session, but the problem is still there.  When one of the two devices sends, the other one logs:  04-05 17:38:40.918 1665 4539 W IncomingEncryptedPushMessage: Our MAC: e6 aa f7 a5 38 a4 d6 af 99 a3 04-05 17:38:40.918 1665 4539 W IncomingEncryptedPushMessage: Thr MAC: e6 aa f7 a5 38 a4 d6 af 99 a3 04-05 17:38:41.098 1665 1708 W SessionCipherV2: org.whispersystems.textsecure.crypto.InvalidMessageException: Bad Mac! 04-05 17:38:41.098 1665 1708 W SessionCipherV2: at org.whispersystems.textsecure.crypto.protocol.WhisperMessageV2.verifyMac(WhisperMessageV2.java:107) 04-05 17:38:41.098 1665 1708 W SessionCipherV2: at org.whispersystems.textsecure.crypto.SessionCipherV2.decrypt(SessionCipherV2.java:127) 04-05 17:38:41.098 1665 1708 W SessionCipherV2: at org.whispersystems.textsecure.crypto.SessionCipherV2.decrypt(SessionCipherV2.java:89) 04-05 17:38:41.098 1665 1708 W SessionCipherV2: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.crypto.DecryptingQueue$PushDecryptionWorkItem.run(DecryptingQueue.java:207) 04-05 17:38:41.098 1665 1708 W SessionCipherV2: at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1088) 04-05 17:38:41.098 1665 1708 W SessionCipherV2: at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:581) 04-05 17:38:41.098 1665 1708 W SessionCipherV2: at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1019) 04-05 17:38:41.108 1665 1708 W DecryptionQueue: org.whispersystems.textsecure.crypto.InvalidMessageException: No valid sessions. 04-05 17:38:41.108 1665 1708 W DecryptionQueue: at org.whispersystems.textsecure.crypto.SessionCipherV2.decrypt(SessionCipherV2.java:109) 04-05 17:38:41.108 1665 1708 W DecryptionQueue: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.crypto.DecryptingQueue$PushDecryptionWorkItem.run(DecryptingQueue.java:207) 04-05 17:38:41.108 1665 1708 W DecryptionQueue: at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1088) 04-05 17:38:41.108 1665 1708 W DecryptionQueue: at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:581) 04-05 17:38:41.108 1665 1708 W DecryptionQueue: at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1019)

column3: I can't send sms to a textsecure user
column4: I have shutdown wifi and 3g. Now i can't have a data connection. But when i send a message to a textsecure user my application tries send this message with push, not with sms. When i turn on data connection, message can be sent (but with push)  (I'm sorry for my english, i hope you can understand)

column3: Allow setting status message for yourself and group chats.
column4: I have searched through all issues and was wondering i couldn't find this issue neither open nor closed.  The idea is to have a status message with text and/or emojis for yourself and group chats. The problem for this ER is to display the message, because at the moment there's no space for it. If we look at e.g.: Whatsapp, you can see the status in the  chat overview and in a contacts view  Currently you can see the last message in the chat overview. I would rather like to see the status message of a user there instead. So I think it would be a smaller problem to achieve this.  To have a status message in the contacts view is a tougher job, because there is no contacts view yet. What we have now is the stock android contacts view you get, after clicking on the contacts avatar in the overview. So this would be an entirely new view. Maybe this should be a new issue also... An own contacts view would be a nice improvement, because we could add other little informations there.  I think this little nice improvement would make it more fun to use TS.

column3: unregistered push user shows up in new conversation list activity
column4: I have registered and unregistered a user with my local TS server.  TS now shows this user as a registered PUSH user although this user is definetly no in the PSQL database on my server. Deleting this user from my contacts and adding him again, TS shows this user as unregistered for the first time but then as registered in the second run. When trying to send a message to him the first PUSH mesage gets lots but then TS is trying to send a encr. SMS to him.  Any thoughts why this happens? http://hastebin.com/ofupufoxib

When exporting the plaintext chatlog it's 4MB in size and contains about 7500 messages for that contact.

column3: Media Not Exporting to XML
column4: I have noticed that when exporting a plaintext backup in the current Play Store version of the app, all media attached to messages (and perhaps even the text from messages containing media) is not included in the XML backup, even though 'SMSBackup And Restore' backs up the media with all messages properly when creating an XML backup, and can restore the same data.  Since I use both TextSecure and SMSBackup And Restore in my system to back up a record of my messaging activity, I need media to be included in my plaintext backup alongside text messages.

A certainly correct password was not accepted by textsecure this happened not only to me but also to an acquaintance of mine.  Both passwords ckntakned special charakters Like äüö¥π#.. column3: off-by-x in message deletion
column4: I have noticed (through several TextSecure versions running on Android 4.1.x and now 4.2.2) that if I select the second-last message in certain threads and delete it, it will reliably delete the last message instead. If I scroll up to the top and try to delete the first message, it'll delete some message below, but not the second. Same with trying to delete the second message.  It doesn't happen in all threads. I have one huge thread from "Anonymous" (various services that send messages from names like "LM-VODAFONE", for which the sender shows up in TextSecure as "Unknown" in "Message details"), and that's where I've noticed it most often.  I realise this is a rather vague report, but I'd be happy to try and help with debugging if anyone has ideas for things I should try.

column3: Phones without menu button do not display key exchange UI
column4: I have installed TextSecure for many of my friends recently, and have found on phones without a hard/soft menu button on the phone (which results in the vertical "..." on the top-right of most apps for replacement) do not have the unlocked padlock icon from which to initiate a key exchange.  Once I established a key exchange from my phone which has a soft menu button, however, the locked padlock icon appears to discontinue the secure session.  I have found this to be true on any android phone lacking the hard or soft menu buttons.  If a specific example is required, the most recent phone I found this to be an issue on was the HTC Desire.

column3: TextSecure not initiating key exchange properly
column4: I have had multiple issues with TextSecure not recognizing another TextSecure user and automatically initiating key exchange and encryption. It ends up working eventually after minutes or sometimes hours of trying, but in the meantime I'm getting charged for international SMS that I shouldn't be paying for. I am using TextSecure with a phone number in Suriname, and I have had issues trying to communicate with 2 users who have US phone numbers.

column3: MMS are sent despite denied permission
column4: I have experienced this issue several times in the last few days and was able to reproduce it. I have only experienced and verified this issue with messages containing pictures, text-only messages seem to work as expected (apart from not beeing resent automatically via push when internet connectivity comes back, but that's a different issue).  **System:** Android 4.1 rooted Samsung stock ROM TS 2.3.2  **TS settings:** Push messages:                  enabled Receive all SMS:                 enabled Receive all MMS:                enabled  **Allow outgoing SMS to:** TextSecure users:               enabled **Ask before sending SMS: enabled** Non-TextSecure users:       enabled  **Witnessed behaviour:** 1. When trying to send a picture on a spotty connection, TextSecure fails to send it via push and asks to tap the message to fall back to MMS. 2. I tap the message and click **no** when asked if it should fall back. 3. The message then shows the red triangle with the matching text that the message could not be sent. 4. I now select the message and go to details -> resend message. 5. TextSecure **does not** show the "please tap message to fall back" dialog again, instead the message stays in the failed state with the red triangle. 6. _When the internet connection comes back, the message is sent via MMS_  **Expected behaviour:** If the internet connection is still not available TextSecure should ask for permission to fall back to MMS once again, as it does with text messages.   **To reproduce:** - disable wifi+mobile data - follow the above procedure from step 2 to 5 - enable wifi+mobile data again - you might have to wait several minutes or select the message and choose resent instead  Log: https://hastebin.com/ipogomogov.vhdl  I have another log ready if needed, but I'd have to scrub this one first.  I consider this a serious bug because it can lead to rather significant unexpected costs as MMS are rather expensive (at least in Europe) and even more expensive if you are roaming.

column4: I have disables the push delivery because it does not allways deliver messages and is very slow compared to encrypted sms messages.  Currently it is not possible to permanently remove the big green "Enable TextSecure messages? ..." which takes up 25% of the screen.

I have checked my MMS settings several times; they have not changed since I first set them. I had been able to receive MMS messages before this problem, so I believe this is a problem with the application.  I receive an MMS message and it does not automatically download. I click on "Download" and it gives me the following two messages:  "Connecting to MMS server..."  Then after a certain amount of time:  "Error connecting to MMS provider..."  Please look into this, as it makes the app somewhat unusable. If you need any information from my phone, please let me know what you need and I will provide it.  Thank you.^^

column3: Consistent behavior of Group Chat with delivery notifications needed
column4: I have an issue that is similar to #2067 - I did not add someone to the group chat, but for one member, delivery notifications seem to error out (see #2086). As soon as this receipt is received, the message goes into "error state", i.e. displaying the error-triangle. This feels kinda wrong, because it looks like the message was not sent at all.  Then, as soon as another receipt is received (from someone else in the group), the message goes back to "everything OK" - now it's not visible anymore that there was any problem.

column3: Mms issue
column4: I have an issue sending and receiving mms. I know there are a lot of mms issues, but I couldn't verify if any of them were the same as this one.  This issue is not affected by wifi connectivity or manually overriding the apn settings.  Logcat (I added a few lines from the system log): http://hastebin.com/iqupawuyug.avrasm  What happens is this: 1) Enable mms radio 2) Try to connect without proxy times out, in the meantime the mms radio connectivity is shut down by a timeout 3) Try to connect with proxy fails because we're not connected with the mms radio  My operator is tele2 in sweden and they require mms proxy.

column3: Two separate threads for the same contact
column4: I have an incoming thread for a conversation (447XXXXXXXXX) and an outgoing (07XXXXXXXXX).  If I try and reply to the first one (447...) it fails, I'm assuming because it's not prefixed with a +. And so the work around is to reply to the same number but swapping 447 or 07. This is incredibly broken, is there any way to fix it?

column3: SMS number always taken from contacts
column4: I have a somehow special setup. As I use my mobile phone for business and private contacts I do not send my number when calling in general. So I have switched that off. For people that should see it's me calling them I have added the *31# GSM code in their phone number in the contacts so that my number is shown to them. (I do this because I have to take hotline calls from time to time and calling them back should not show my number). I now tried using TextSecure and found that when I type in a number that's in my contacts (and I type the number without the *31#) TextSecure automatically finds it and takes the number with the GSM code in front of it. Thus no SMS ever gets send because the taken number does not work on SMS.   Would be great to have the GSM code filtered away, thus I could use the Contacts (which is also not possible with the standard SMS app with my setup) fully or at least just take the number I've typed into without looking it up further (this is how the standard app behaves).  If there is any more information needed just let me know.  kr Tom

The application saves them, but doesn't display them anywhere. When I open TextSecure though, there they are. So TS can see those new contacts, but the "People" app (which created them) can't. After changing some (may I say random?) settings I managed to fix it. However my friends have the same problem. Please fix it, it's frustrating and I can't get regular people to use it if they encounter problems like this :/ Thank you.  p.s.: I'm sorry if it's a known bug, I tried to search for similar posts but couldn't find anything

column3: Timeout interval not working in 2.1.1
column4: I have a Galaxy Note 3 running Kit Kat and recently updated to TextSecure v2.1.1. I have the app set to timeout the passphrase at five minutes. Since the update, if I leave the app unlocked, it will not ask for the passphrase even after remaining unlocked for hours. Manual lock works fine, so it's something wrong in the timeout.

column3: [Feature Request] Auto Forward SMS
column4: I have a couple androids floating about and I travel a lot, I was looking to setup some automatic forwarding of SMS so that friends of mine (who are silly and don't use this great service) can contact my local number still and it will be forwarded out of the country to my other number via the text secure protocol.  Warning setting a cap on the number of messages per unit time or something similar may be wise, don't want people to abuse/flood/DDOS and bring down the service.

column3: If secure session ends due to SMS fallback on one side when other side can't receive SMS, no way exists to restart session.
column4: I have a contact with Textsecure who at one point fell back to SMS during a conversation. My "phone" is a wifi only device and currently receives SMS via Google Voice, so this didn't work.  I sent him a message saying I can't fall back to SMS and disabled it on my side, and then got one or two from him later saying that he couldn't restart a secure session. I also got a couple "secure session ended" messages and the "send" UI element turned to the green (should be red, IMO) unlocked one.  Now, with network connectivity good, every message I send results in "Error sending message!" with absolutely no additional useful information as to WHY there was an error, WHAT the error was, and WHAT I may do to correct it.  There is no UI element to restart a secure session.  It doesn't exist, or at least, I can't find it in 5 minutes of searching, which means for all practical purposes it doesn't exist.  Thinking to "reset" the state between my contact and myself, I selected "delete thread" and erased our prior messages. He then DISAPPEARED FROM MY CONTACT LIST (wtf?) and, despite having an identity key still in my contact keys, there's no way to re-add him.  Once I stumbled upon the send message dialog (still with the green unlocked UI element) somehow - no idea how.  Otherwise, it's impossible.  I can't add him using his number, or directly from contacts.  I rebooted the phone and still can't add him from contacts or by using his number in +1xxxxxxxxxx format.  I'll file separate UI bugs, but this is the whole story.

column3: Updating keys doesn't work
column4: I have a contact who switched over to a new phone without backing up its old key. So he generated a new key. When I first chatted with him I saw that TextSecure exchanged keys again but he doesn't get my messages now and when he tried to write to me i just saw "bad encrypted message". I tried to close the encrypted chat and things but nothing works. now we can't chat anymore.  The same problem happened to another friend some months ago. He got frustrated and deleted TextSecure, so the problem got fixed for him too, in a bad way... using WhatsApp ;)

I guess I am just too stupid to find the function, because with a contact that uses Push I can choose to send either encrypted Push, encrypted SMS or unencrypted SMS.

column3: Acknowledge of PUSH-sent messages
column4: I had several issues where recipients did NOT receive a message that was sent via PUSH. The reason being that they had data disabled or a privacy app was blocking features that TS needed or the sync with the TS servers did not work.  My suggestion is to send an acknowledge back to the sender via the PUSH data channel. If TS does not see an acknowledge within 2 minutes, TS would try to resend the message via SMS (if the fallback is enabled) or notify the user that the message did not go through.  Messaging should be reliable AND secure!

column3: Material design UI ?
column4: I feel like the UI is losing speed, especially compared to Messenger from Google. Do you have any plans on upgrading the UI to Material Design ?

column3: Receiving push message from user A is possible. Sending push to A is not.
column4: I experienced this twice now with my friend. - TextSecure is working fine. - She turns off her smartphone, replaces the battery and then restarts the phone - After a while I try to send her a push message but TextSecure wants me to use the SMS fallback - But I can receive the push messages sent by her  In the log I see some "UserNotFound" exceptions and "Receiver not registered".  The problem persist. The only fix we found so far: She has to disable push messages. And then enable it again.

column3: Received corrupted key exchange message!
column4: I experienced this Problem with two Contacts in my List. They are unable to send me messages. Instead i get: "Received corrupted key exchange message!" and so do they, when I try to send a message to them. Ending the Secure Session via the Lock Symbol didn't change the Situation. This behavior started some time after I switched from Cyanogenmod 10 to Cyanogenmod 11 with a Factory Reset. But all other TextSecure Contacts except the two mentioned, kept working fine. I also refreshed the Push Directory several Times after the Error started to appear but it didn't change anything.  Device Info: Nexus S, CyanogenMod 11-20140608-SNAPSHOT-M7-crespo

column3: [Bug ?] Key changed events do not generate a notification
column4: I encountered this with a friend of mine who reflashed his phone and subsequently reregistered.  I had an ongoing chat (using his old key) with him and noticed today that he had sent me a message yesterday and I had to accept the new key. But I didn't get notified about the new message in the notification bar  I would expect Textsecure to generate notifications for all events including the key changed event, since this may lead to unnoticed messages, depending on usage pattern of course.  If this behaviour is intentional, it would be great to know the rationale behind this.  Anyways I want to thank you for your amazing work!  Steps to reproduce: 1. User A and User B both register with Textsecure 2. Both Users exchange a couple of messages 3. User B reregisters with Textsecure changing his key 4. User B send User A a Message 5. No notification is shown on User A's device  Expected behaviour: User A should be notified of the incoming message with the new key

column3: Add user setting to hide Persistent Notification "TextSecure is unlocked"
column4: I don't lock TextSecure, so the notification remains in the notification area.  - I can't swipe to remove the notification - I can't tell TextSecure to not bother me with this information (personally I'm not worried)  Please can we have a setting so that I can choose not to have the notification?

column3: Focus Text box when switching to chat activity
column4: I don't know much about android apps, but when I switch to the activity, where I can send messages (chat activity) then sometimes the text box isn't focused. So when I type, nothing happens and I have to click on the text box. Maybe someone can fix this.

column3: New Thread Contact Search + Not Working Right
column4: I don't know if anyone else is having this issue but when I click on the + to start a new thread then start to type then certain letters do not work and other times results appear that do not contain the right characters.  For example... I am looking for a girl named "Mio". I type "m". i get "AJ", "Alex"... no "m"s in that... when I type the whole name it does not eliminate people... She is in the list but much lower. What is happening?  I am using a google address book on android 2.3.7 with no data plan and push turned off and TS set to receive all SMS.  Searching works fine directly from the Contacts app.

column3: New Thread Contact Search + Not Reducing Contacts Correctly
column4: I don't know if anyone else is having this issue but when I click on the + to start a new thread and start to type then certain letters do not work properly and results appear that do not contain these characters.  For example... I am looking for a girl named "Mio". I type "m". I get "AJ", "Alex"... no 'm's in that... when I type the whole name it does not eliminate anyone, like it hates the 'm' key... She is in the list but much lower below a bunch of people who should not be showing up.  I type "a" and "Britt" is in the list. I type "m" again and I am left with "Amy, Britt, Jodi" so only the first result is correct. I type "m" again... eliminates all contacts but when I type a "y" it successfully reduces to "Amy"... how does this make sense?  Why does it work for Amy but not Mio?  When I type "gwenyth" it reduces fine but "Emma" pops up after first character then disappears after second...  "Anna" comes up for "d" ???  I am using a google address book on a Motorola Cliq 2 running Android 2.3.7 with no data plan and push turned off and TS set to receive all SMS.  Searching works fine directly from the Contacts app.

column3: New Thread Contact Search + Not Reducing Contacts Correctly
column4: I don't know if anyone else is having this issue but when I click on the + to start a new thread and start to type then certain letters do not work and results appear that do not contain the right characters.  For example... I am looking for a girl named "Mio". I type "m". i get "AJ", "Alex"... no "m"s in that... when I type the whole name it does not eliminate people... She is in the list but much lower. What is happening?  When i type "adam" or "gwenyth" it works fine... ??  I am using a google address book on a motorola cliq 2 running android 2.3.7 with no data plan and push turned off and TS set to receive all SMS.  searching works fine directly from the contacts app.

column3: MMS messages do not display the Subject
column4: I don't believe this issue is provider specific. However some information about my device. Network: ATT Prepaid/Gophone Phone: Moto X GSM Unlocked (carrier)  Problem: send an email message, with a subject, to 555XXXYYYY@mms.att.net  Actual Results: textsecure displays the body of the email message, but does not display the subject  Expected Results: textsecure should display the subject and body of the message  The stock messaging app solves this problem by adding a subject line.  Example  Email:  ``` To: 555XXXYYYY@mms.att.net Subject: A Test Message Content Line 1 Content Line 2 Content Line 3 ```  The stock messaging app would display  ```  - Content Line 1 Content Line 2 Content Line 3 ```  TextSecure Displays  ``` Content Line 1 Content Line 2 Content Line 3 ```

column3: Improve transport channel prediction
column4: I didn't look at the code, but from the behaviour I suspect that we only check what channel the contact supports instead of actually checking for an internet connection. Can't we just ping google or the push server as soon as text is entered, (hopefully not DOSing it) to evaluate if we have a working internet connection? Apparently the Android framework [already offers a function for that](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1560788/how-to-check-internet-access-on-android-inetaddress-never-timeouts). Simply checking if wifi or mobile data are enabled is probably not good enough in case of captive portals and patchy reception.

column3: "error connecting to server" when unregistering, hangs TextSecure
column4: I did the following to arrive at this situation: - Insert SIM X - Install TS and register for this number - Remove SIM X and insert SIM Y - Try to send TS messages - TS did not send anything. In fact it did not even list the to-be-send messages in the thread – pressing the send arrow just cleared the text input field. - After a while a notification was shown, that delivery failed – tapping it took me to the thread for the correct user, but without showing any failed message. - Reinsert SIM X, remove SIM Y - Try to send the messages again, which worked now - Receipient says that the "encryption is unknown" (their words), but some playing around made them show up in plaintext anyway. - Reinsert SIM Y, remove SIM X - Try to end the secure session, but that message was never sent - Try to unregister from Push, but that fails (nothing happens, the WiFi icon shows some transmissions initially, but then nothing) and blocks the TextSecure application with the message "Unregistering for data based communication" – back button and tapping the screen does not allow me to exit this mode. - After waiting for a long time (maybe half an hour) and returning to my phone, I see the message "error connecting to server". - I can use the home button and reenter TextSecure in the thread pane. - Any messages I try to send now will not be delivered – they show up in the respective thread as "pending", without anything happening. This affects regular unencrypted SMS as well as TextSecure Push messages. - Messages can still be received, but the notification area will not be cleared when opening the thread, and neither will the thread be marked as seen in the thread pane. - Situation is the same for SIM X and SIM Y – both cannot unregister.

column3: [Feature] Nicknames
column4: I did a little search and I'm surprised no one mentioned it before... Will it ever be possible to use textsecure without giving away our phone numbers? I have some friends who won't install it unless they can register with a username. Is it in the plans? (before someone says it, yes, I've already had my friends read this: http://www.whispersystems.org/blog/contact-discovery)

column3: Incorrect delivery confirmation in groups
column4: I created a group. When I sent a message, the message delivery confirmed icon (tick in a box) appeared next to my sent message. But one of the group members did not receive the message. So I got an incorrect message delivery confirmation.

column3: Creation of group leaks name and included numbers to participants before any message is sent
column4: I created a group just to test how creating a group works. I added some random contacts that showed as TextSecure users. Then I decided, ok, creating groups works and went on with my day.  Later I received a message from one of the users, inside the group, asking about the purpose of this group.  At no point did TextSecure indicate or warn that the mere creation of a group was a "transferred" action. This lead me to leak the numbers of completely unrelated strangers to each others.  Please add a warning or dialog that a group is immediately communicated to all participants, even with no message(s) sent.

column3: Sending SMS (not allowed!)
column4: I configured TextSecure to not use the SMS feature. So no SMS messages should be sent. Since the last update TextSecure sents SMS messages which are not allowed!

column3: Missing dependencies in the Wki
column4: I compiled according to the Wiki. According to the wiki, the compile dependencies are:  ``` "Android SDK manager" "Android Support Repository" - this need to be installed via the Android SDK manager "Java Development Kit (JDK)" compiler for example openjdk-devel - JRE alone is not enough. At least version 7 of Java is required. ```  Despite having the dependencies, compiling didn't work, it complained about a missing `com.google.android.gms:play-services`. I had to install the following additional packages: "Google Play Services, Google Repository, Google Play services for Froyo". I don't know if all of these were needed, but I am sure Google Repository was needed.  This made the compiler go a lot further. (It still fails but it's probably be an unrelated issue)  After doing this, the compilation went a bit further, but now there's a new error:

column3: issues with txtsecure
column4: i cannot add contacts from the txt message window, i have to exit the app and make the contact card outside of it which is a massive pain in the ass  i also cant take pictures to send within the app, i have to exit it compleatly take a pic with my cam then open the app and select the picture  its these 2 simple features that make me not want to use txtsecure

column3: Cannot send (unencrypted) SMS anymore
column4: I can't send SMS with TS, everything else is working fine. TS is the default SMS application and receiving SMS works. When sending a SMS, TS marks it as unsent after a few seconds. Sending SMS has worked previously, problem appeared spontaneously  (maybe after the last TS update?).  Device: Samsung Galaxy II Plus (I9105P), original (Samsung) ROM, Android 4.2.2, TS 2.1.6 App state: push registered & working, receiving SMS working, outgoing SMS fully enabled.  Debug log after trying to send SMS: http://hastebin.com/vajovoxuyo

column3: Cannot send MMS messages - Brazil/carrier Oi
column4: I can receive MMS messages from other TextSecure users but I can't send MMS messages back to them. The messages I try to send get flagged with a red exclamation mark and the error message "Error sending message". This happens the moment I press the send button, as if the app didn't even try to establish a connection to send the message.  Carrier: Oi (Brazil) Push and SMS Settings: - Push messages: On - Incoming SMS: Disabled - Allow outgoing SMS to: Nobody - SMS delivery reports: Off  Debug log: http://hastebin.com/jupunopuqo  Let me know if there's any other useful information I can provide. Thank you

column4: I can get group MMS messages but I cannot reply to any it just bounces back undelivered. SMS messages I can send just fine but I cannot do mms group messages.

column3: Detailed receive receipts in group message details
column4: I believe that group messages are currently only marked with the receive receipt indicator if every participant's phone has sent one.  The usability could be much improved if the detailed message information which is shown after a long-click on the message followed by clicking the "i" icon contained the receive receipt status of all participants.  eg:  **Receive statuses:**  > Alice:   [✓] > Bob:    [✓] > Marry: [   ]  What do you think?

column3: Error sending Message
column4: I am using Textsecure with push for some weeks now. Today I was sending a picture to a friend and right after that 2 more text messages. The second one brought that error. Since then I couldn't send a single message without error.http://hastebin.com/ifosikatec Regards, Thomas

column3: make messages visible for other apps
column4: I am using TextSecure as my default app for text messages. However, there is a difference between TextSecure and other apps like my phones default or Hangouts:  Using Hangouts or the default app of my phone, I can still access my messages via bluetooth. Third party apps like droidstats or airdroid are able to see the Messages and count them.  Using TextSecure, droidstats does not "see" me sending messages and accessing my messages via Message Access Profile (Bluetooth) or Airdroid only yields messages of the time before I started using TextSecure.  So I believe that TextSecure stores messages differently, though I don't know what the difference is and if it might be a design-decision (e.g. for security reasons). I see that those third-party apps would probably only work with unencrypted messages, but that would be fine for me.  **tl;dr:** Is it possible to make messages sent and received by TextSecure available in the same way as "the default apps" do? I.e. that they are accessible via MAP or third-party apps, even though some of them might be encrypted.  _Disclaimer: I've not developed any app for android, so I have very little knowledge about how things work here and if there is a uniform way to store text messages._

column3: Please remove the "nag screen" asking me to use push instead of SMS
column4: I am using SMS on purpose because I have found it to be more reliable than push on my phone's network. I keep getting a text secure nag screen popup asking me to use push. Please remove this nag screen completely, or add a checkbox to permanently hide it. I appreciate all of the hard work put into text secure, but users shouldn't be nagged to use push.

column3: Textsecure Not Working on OnePlus One Phone
column4: I am unable to send either push or regular text message using a OnePlus One phone.  I have removed Whisper app from the phone and have never registered with it. Just the regular Textsecure app.

column3: Not getting any incoming messages from other TextSecure users
column4: I am running the latest version of TS on the latest version of SlimKAT on my Nexus 5. Since a recent update I'm not getting ANY messages from textsecure users anymore. I can send messages, but don't receive any. This is VERY urgent, because I missed like 20-30 messages without knowing in the last 2 weeks.  I don't have any other sms-app installed (not even the standard one). I receive messages on every other messaging app (whatsapp, telegram, threema, skype). Normal/encrypted SMS are received fine through TextSecure. Text Messages aren't received at all.

Currently I am using only TS, but if can roll back to the CM messenger and still have private conversation with TS users.  Well, that would be good to know.  Please help clarify.

column3: Use of unitialised value?
column4: I am not sure if I do not miss anything, however I decided to file an issue just in case.  While reading through [HKDF.java](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/libaxolotl/src/main/java/org/whispersystems/libaxolotl/kdf/HKDF.java) I could not really understand what happens at [line 40](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/libaxolotl/src/main/java/org/whispersystems/libaxolotl/kdf/HKDF.java#L40).  According to the [docs](https://developer.android.com/reference/javax/crypto/spec/SecretKeySpec.html#SecretKeySpec%28byte[],%20java.lang.String%29), the function `SecretKey` uses both parameters to generate a secret key (it is used in [line 52](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/libaxolotl/src/main/java/org/whispersystems/libaxolotl/kdf/HKDF.java#L52)) and it seems that the unitialised value of `salt` is used there.

column3: Wassenaar Agreement Does Not Apply to Public Domain Software
column4: I am not aware of individual countries' rules and regulations; however, on their control list page ( http://www.wassenaar.org/controllists/index.html ) there's this document:  http://www.wassenaar.org/controllists/2013/WA-LIST%20%2813%29%201/02%20-%20WA-LIST%20%2813%29%201%20-%20GTN%20and%20GSN.doc  ``` Controls do not apply to "technology" "in the public domain", to "basic scientific research" or to the minimum necessary information for patent applications. ```  The document further elaborates:  ``` The Lists do not control "software" which is any of the following: 1.  Generally available to the public by being:     a.  Sold from stock at retail selling points without restriction, by means of:         1.  Over-the-counter transactions;         2.  Mail order transactions;         3.  Electronic transactions; or         4.  Telephone call transactions; and      b.  Designed for installation by the user without further substantial support by the supplier; Note    Entry 1 of the General Software Note does not release "software" controlled by Category 5 ‑ Part 2 ("Information Security").  2.  "In the public domain"; or  3.  The minimum necessary "object code" for the installation, operation, maintenance (checking) or repair of those items whose export has been authorised. ```  IANAL, but that sounds to me like TextSecure (and any other public domain/open source software project) ought to be exempt from cryptography export controls.

column3: Inability to receive mTAN SMS
column4: I am completely unable to receive mTAN SMS by my bank. TextSecure shows no error message nor a notification. When I set the default messaging app to receive/send messages, then re-request my mTAN I receive it immediately.   I'm willing to deliver debugging/additional information as good as I can, so I will recreate the scenario later and attach the debug log in this ticket. My device - GalaxyS3; Android 4.4.4 Cyanogenmod11

column3: Please add unsafe SMS groups (because MMS are expensive)
column4: I am aware of the decision to fade out SMS/MMS support for security reasons. Unfortunately, I still need to (unsafely) communicate with people with "feature phones". (Think: older people that do not want to (or cannot) use a smart phone.)  Currently groups with such people are created as MMS groups. Would it be possible to create SMS groups instead? MMS are expensive for me, and I have an SMS flat rate.

column3: In the registration number and mobile phone number do not match, messaging and security SMS?
column4: I am a honest user and a developer based on your source code. There are some problems while I am using the TextSecure app recently.  We can send the push message and sms message if we change another simcard which is not the same as the register number. But there will be some problems if we send a secure sms message, cause the simcard number is not the same as the register number, besides that, it will leads to anther secret key exchange, if we exchange it again the new received message or secure sms message seems crupt and can not be decrypt in our app. Reproduce steps: 1) register with number 180..... 2) remove the simcard and insert another simcard 3) send a secure message to a friend in our contacts 4) send a sms messgae to the same number above 5) send a secure message to the same number above you can find some problems here...  I am waiting for your help, thanks!

column3: An alternative to the painful plaintext key comparison
column4: Humans are better at comparing images than comparing a long string. Currently, the latter is used in TextSecure, and it's very inconvenient.  My proposal is to be inspired by Telegram, here is how Telegram users compare their shared key:  ![key_image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5030488/2898441/b37f563c-d59d-11e3-95b5-5d923fd7c30b.jpg)  Important: If we take that path, there is one problem which Telegram didn't resolve and we should - Users often compare their key visualizations over an insecure channel. The most common way is for them to take a screenshot of the key visualization and then send it via Telegram itself. This defeats the purpose of key visualizations,  because Telegram should be considered an insecure channel until the keys are compared outside of it.  The solution is just a simple message like: "Please compare your key visualizations in real life / over a secure channel, never compare your key visualization via TextSecure itself"

column3: group mms forces re-entering password when clicking from notifications
column4: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d610a9f7079a345301ea  Android 4.4.4, Samsung Galaxy S3, ATT, wifi connected, nova launcher.   On a thread of 8 mixed devices (iOS, textsecure, various android) If I click the message from the notification dropdown, the message does not load and I need to re-enter my password to get in. Clicking the check mark to "mark as read" seems to work fine.   This started happening recently, but it's been probably at least a week since my most recent other group message. I have not tried doing anything with picture messages. Group messages with 3 other TS users are fine.   ![screenshot 2014-12-17 15 24 06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3374110/5481034/c8edff1e-8600-11e4-8819-c5051cd433e2.png)
