column3: Can we support the dual simcards phone both can send secure message?
column4: Dear TextSecure develop team,   ``` I am a honest user and a developer based on your source code. There are some problems while I am using the TextSecure app recently.  1.  We can send the push message and sms message if we change another simcard which is not the same as the register number. But there will be some problems if we send a secure sms message, cause the simcard number is not the same as the register number, besides that, it will leads to anther secret key exchange, if we exchange it again the new received message or secure sms message seems crupt and can not be decrypt in our app. Reproduce steps: 1) register with number 180..... 2) remove the simcard and insert anther simcard 3) send a secure message to a friend in our contacts 4) send a sms messgae to the same number above 5) send a secure message to the same number above you can find some problems here...  2. Can not choose which simcard to send the sms message with a dural sim cards support phone, so my question is can we support the dual simcards phone both can send secure message?  I am waiting for your help, thanks! ```

column3: Provide Integration for Cyanogenmod
column4: Dear developers,  following the build instructions on http://wiki.cyanogenmod.org/w/Build_for_mako I am building my own custom CM 11.  For some apps I like, I could integrate them according to "the right way" on  http://wiki.cyanogenmod.org/w/Doc:_adding_your_own_app  but unfortunately, I cannot manage that for TextSecure. Could you please at some time address this issue, so that one can compile TextSecure from search when building an own Android?  I like _cutting edge_ systems built from GitHub sources and this can help you also with more nightly / beta-testing.  Thanks a lot!

column3: Emoji-Button
column4: Dear developers,  first of all I would like to say thank you for your hard and great work!  I am using TextSecure for nearly one year now -  with my family, friends and in my circle of acquaintances.  During Christmas time a lot of those guys got new phones or updated to the newest available Android versions, running now mostly Android KitKat.  The problem such "normal" end-users nowadays face, is the missing Emoji-button within the version running on KitKat. Unfortunately not everyone knows how to install alternative keyboards or is willing to do so. And not every type of keyboard offers the functionality of "Emojis" (e.g. on Huawei Ascend P7). There are several reasons I somehow could understand those people.  It's a pity - if such users switch back to commercial messenger apps because of this "problem".  It would be great if you could add the Emoji-button once again in the KitKat-version, so we could spread TextSecure even wider.  Thank you for your time and consideration.  kaz4r

column3: TextSecure nuking encrypted SMS? WTF?!
column4: Dear @moxie0, the first thing I do before having breakfast is having a coffee and reading the current security news. Today, this [article on Heise Security](http://heise.de/-2269353) was the worst news of the day: Are you honestly thinking that SMS are going to be replaced by data connections in the future and are thus thinking that nuking the **offline** SMS encryption feature (as discussed in #1737) is necessesary? Are you **FUCKING** serious? Excuse my cursing, but I simply cannot believe you seriously decided that!  Up until this point I've been a huge fan of the Whisper Systems products - be it RedPhone, TextSecure or anything else. I've been recommending TextSecure to all of my friends, recommended them to full erase WhatsApp, explained how to connect through TextSecure, even fiddled with their phones until it worked - and now you are blatantly coming along saying that it's "too much work and confusion" connecting people through exchanging keys? I really hope that mentioned article is wrong and all this is not true.  **Please rethink your decision.** If TextSecure will nuke offline SMS encryption (which always was the reason why people like me and my friends used it), I'm going to fully eliminate TextSecure and replace it with a smarter choice. And I will not only do that for my own phone, but for every phone if brought TextSecure to. To be honest, even thinking about it hurts! But deep within myself I simply cannot support a Project who eliminates its upmost important feature! Have you ever thought of the fact that there are countries out there who lack data connections due to poverty or war (and probably will continue to do so for the next few decades)? What about the people living in supressed countries with supressing governments?  I very much loved TextSecure, and while writing this, I still do. In the name of all security-enthusiasts and people ou there wondering how to continue or which App to switch to, I am asking you to **NOT** just close this Issue, but rather have a grown-up discussion here, which hopefully leads you  to the conclusion that offline SMS encryption is really important to keep.  **THANK YOU** for listening to the community and not just what the "trends" are going to be.

column3: Request: Scheduled SMS backups
column4: Dear @moxie0, I always have been a proud user of [SMS Backup & Restore Pro](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.riteshsahu.SMSBackupRestorePro&hl=ro) - but since TextSecure encrypts all SMS by default, I cannot use it any longer. If TextSecure would offer scheduled (encrypted) backups of all my SMS, that would be awesome and I'd instantly ditch SMS Backup & Restore. Possible?

column3: Possible Denial of Service via Federated Server
column4: Cyanogmod WhisperPush is currently holding my account hostage.  It will not allow me to unregister and therefore I am not able to register with TextSecure.  I also am not able to use WhisperPush as the phone I registered with was wiped and sold. WhisperPush's registration seems to be broken server-side and they don't seem to be responsive.  While I agree that this is Cyanogemod's issue, I do see this as a design flaw of TextSecure as you could create a DOS for users.  There seem to be a fair amount of people having this issue.  See the following:  https://github.com/daveio/whisperpush-unregister/issues/11 https://jira.cyanogenmod.org/browse/CYAN-4512 http://support.whispersystems.org/customer/portal/questions/8112872-how-to-register-after-exhausting-all-options-for-unregistering-from-whisperpush  I apologize if this is a proper issue, I just wanted to start some discussion around it.

column3: Retry send-via-data before manual SMS fallback
column4: Currently, when send-via-data fails, e.g. because there is no internet connectivity, TextSecure will mark the message light green and offer to fallback to SMS ("tap to ..."). There is no way back to a light blue message / send-via-data, even if the internet connection comes back online.  TextSecure should immediately and automatically retry to send-via-data, as soon as the internet connection is back online. This should be made visually obvious, e.g. by keeping the light blue background instead of switching to light green, or by adding a spinning circle icon.

column3: Handling of new devices has security implications
column4: Currently, when a new device is set up this disables any old ones, presumably to increase security. However, due to how this is handled in details this IMHO has pretty serious security implications: 1) It makes it much easier to take over an account for prolonged periods. If someone gets access to the SIM for even just a second they can connect to that phone number. They then will receive messages directed to that number. The legitimate user will however not be warned of this in any way. He will get generic "sending failed" messages. Worse, if encrypted SMS fallback is enabled, he might not even notice anything is wrong. The recipient will get these messages, but they will not be decrypted, thus making it even easier for the attacker to appear legitimate. Even if the user figures out that someone took over his account, there is no obvious way to fix this. The only one I could figure out is clearing app data, however then he loses his private key and the people he communicates with have no reason to trust him over the attacker. 2) It makes it impossible to securely and with little effort switch to a new device. Normally this would be done by distributing a hash of the new private key via the old trusted channel. However before linking the new device its private key/hash is not known (I have not tried if skipping linking a phone number at first would be possible and help), whereas once the linking is done the old device can't be used to distribute the new hashes.

column3: Easy to fix: Export module should tell directory and filename
column4: Currently, the export only says "Successful". I have no clue where the database to which file the database has been exported. After 10 minutes of googling I found out. However, I am also someone able to use github etc. So the average user might not be able.  I suggest to change the message to  `Successfully exported to /sdcard/TextSecurePlaintextBackup.xml!` or `Successfully exported to /sdcard/TextSecureExport!`

column3: timestamp on messages from previous days
column4: Currently, once the clock turns to midnight, the messages from the previous day only show the day sent/received, and not the time. It would be useful to have an option to display the time even after the clock turns to midnight, as sometime the lack of a timestamp can cause awkward incidents in communications.

column3: Add Unknown Number To Contact List
column4: Currently there is no way to easily add an unknown number to the contact list. There should be an option in the long-press menu of a thread and in the extra options menu in the in-thread view to add a number to your contacts.   Currently you have to write the number down, then add it to your contacts manually.

column3: Should be able to message contact from their entry in contact keys list.
column4: Currently the contact keys list only functions (apparently) as a way to view key fingerprints for contacts. Proposed as a subset/workaround for #1583, there should be a way to initiate a conversation with a contact when viewing that contact's key.

column3: [UX] Confirmation / return receipt UI should show more useful state than it currently does
column4: Currently the confirmation / return receipt UI shows two states: - Receipt confirmed - Absence of receipt confirmation  This could be more useful. It isn't so great when the remote user is e.g. in a building with poor data coverage, has their phone off, etc. Currently I often have messages get through which are never confirmed, but definitely received ... eventually.  One implementation wrinkle I can think of might be a choice between "confirm all received messages, eventually" versus "give up on confirmation after a timeout." Either way, I believe presenting information on the state of message confirmation, rather than the presence or absence, is valuable to the TextSecure user sending messages.  **These proposals are mutually exclusive.** ## Proposal 1: Confirmed, Awaiting Confirmation, Gave Up - For messages which have been confirmed, TextSecure MUST (and does) show a "confirmed" UI element. - For messages which have been sent but not confirmed, TextSecure SHOULD show an "awaiting confirmation" UI element. My suggestion: perhaps a clock superimposed on an envelope. - For messages on which confirmation has been given up (perhaps after an hour), TextSecure SHOULD show a "gave up confirmation" UI element. My suggestion: A question mark superimposed on an envelope. ## Proposal 2: Confirmed, Awaiting Confirmation, Confirmation Is Taking a Really Long Time but If The Message Is Received It Will Eventually Be Confirmed - For messages which have been confirmed, TextSecure MUST (and does) show a "confirmed" UI element. - For messages which have been sent but not confirmed, TextSecure SHOULD show an "awaiting confirmation" UI element. My suggestion: perhaps a clock superimposed on an envelope. - For messages on which confirmation is taking a really long time (say, more than 1 hour), TextSecure SHOULD show a "waiting a long time for confirmation" UI element. My suggestion: either a clock + question mark / interrobang (‽), or just a question mark or interrobang superimposed on an envelope. If the recipient phone is turned on 3 weeks later and old messages still exist on the sender phone, they will be confirmed. - For unconfirmed messages which are deleted, TextSecure SHOULD discard incoming confirmation acknowledgements.  Proposal 2 should be subjected to threat analysis. (What if the recipient doesn't want their receipt of the messages confirmed after a while?) Proposal 1 seems easier to implement while still _actively_ giving the user more understanding of the status of their message - either we're still awaiting confirmation for a reasonable time or we gave up after a reasonable time but the contact may or may not have received the message.

column3: Some mobile carriers distort the verification SMS
column4: Currently TextSecure requires the verification SMS to be exactly `Your TextSecure verification code: NNN[N]-NNN[N]`. But some mobile carriers apparently append or prepend a certain text to the original SMS. The [relevant portion of the verification code](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/c632b32f/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/service/SmsListener.java#L129) should accept them as well.  In my particular case, Korean carriers have prepended `[Sent from Web]` to every SMS sent from non-mobile devices as a (poor) countermeasure to SMS spams, and TextSecure simply misses them. While this (dis)service is optional, it is opt-out and many Korean users are likely affected.

column3: Message delivery unreliable
column4: Currently message delivery is unreliable. It often happens that I send a message to someone, but do not get a message receipt (check-mark icon). Messages sent later get a receipt. When I talk to the person a few hours later, they tell me they did not receive the message.  This issue is not limited to me sending, but also happens the other way around. It also happens for other people, as I have been told. It also happens for the message receipts themselves – sometimes a message arrives on my phone, but the sender never receives the receipt. The CyanogenMod integrated WhisperPush service is not involved. The issue happens between stock Android users, as well as with CyanogenMod users.  From reading other issues I understand that GCM does not offer reliable delivery. I wonder if the equivalent of [XEP-0198 section 4 "Acks"](http://xmpp.org/extensions/xep-0198.html#acking) could be implemented on top of it in TextSecure.

column3: Use better names for saved images
column4: Currently images which are saved to sdcard/Pictures are named "textsecure-123456.jpg" where the number is random. There is no way to identify their original date anymore. With many images this gets real messy.   My suggestion is to either put the received datetime in the file name or set the file date to the right value.

column3: CM v OEM TextSecure Issues
column4: CONDITIONS: TextSecure installed on duplicate devices Galaxy S4. One is stock OEM (AOSP 4.4.2), the other Cyanogenmod (CM11-SnapshotM12 AOSP 4.4.4). CM unit has WhisperPush and TextSecure App. WhisperPush not in use. TextSecure has been successfully registered on both devices. Both units using cellular; wifi disabled.  When CM user sends text to OEM user, message is transmitted and received successfully. When OEM user replies (or initiates message), transmission is successful, but CM user doesn't receive unless reboot with WiFi enabled.

column3: Daily MMS notifications
column4: Because of a 401 error, TextSecure can't download MMS.  Because of this, when I get sent an MMS, I get notified daily. Each day, my phone's LED flashes and I have a notification in the notification bar.  In the conversation, it shows another "download" button. Is there a way to stop these daily notifications?

column3: Catch issues with bad MMSC URIs, add validation
column4: Bad arguments into HttpClient constructors are caught and wrapped in an IOException, preventing crashes. Also added validators to the manual MMS preferences to stop these kinds of issues from coming up in the future.

column3: Auto delete messages
column4: Auto delete messages  I'd like to request that feature again because many people already requested it in some issues, but there were some privacy concerns and it could be interesting to talk about them and maybe, after finding a good solution, to implement the feature! ;)  So the idea is that messages automatically get deleted from the phones somehow. The  suggestion that someone could delete the message from all phones remotely let some privacy concerns come up as you should have full control about which messages get deleted from your phone and which do not...  Another idea (what I do appreciate) is the option to disable history like it's possible on hangouts (messages get deleted after some time automatically). For example messages get automatically deleted 24 hours after you read them. This could be an option in the conversation itself and you get the message "history turned off". Every participant should have the option to turn it off/on and it applies for all the participants. Like that there's no confusion and all people in the conversation should be happy with this solution and can turn it on/off like they want to do. The messages should of course have another color if history is turned off ;)  I do like this feature, the only privacy concern could be that you can still capture screenshots of it, but maybe taking screenshots could generally be disabled in the app or you get a notification that someone took a screenshot (what should be possible somehow because it works on snapchat e.g., too, right?). Do you think this would be possible or do you have some other concerns? Is such a function too hard to implement or would you even like that feature? :)

column3: no audio alert when locked
column4: audio alerts on my textsecure for encrypted messages have stopped working when textsecure is locked (either manually or password timed out).  It has worked fine before. Now it will show a notification when locked, but only gives audio alerts as soon as I've entered the password. Makes me miss many messages. Settings/display notifications in status bar is on. Sound is set to a valid sound. Tested with two phones (ons is a moto g with KitKat 4.4.4).

column3: Reset query string when search is collapsed
column4: At the moment, when you search in the conversation list, and then tap "back" either on your phone's buttons or in the action bar, the filter stays active. Only way to reset the filter is to search again and input the empty string.

column3: Replace "Push and SMS" title in the settings with something more appropriate
column4: At the moment the first title in the TextSecure settings is named "Push and SMS" although it refers to push messages, SMS messages and MMS messages. Push messages will also be renamed to "TextSecure messages" so this title needs to be replaced with something more appropriate. "Sending and receiving" maybe?

column3: Queue data messages
column4: At the moment sending of data messages fails if there is no internet connection. You are able to choose SMS fallback. I think it would be good to start queueing the message and send it when the internet connection is established again. We could add a little notice to the dialog which pops up when you tap the message for fallback. Something like: "Your message will be sent when you have a internet connection again. If you don't want to wait, you can send a SMS now"  What do you think?  _edit: posted it in the mailing list now_

column3: Testing guidelines needed
column4: As there are often issues with new features or fixes, there should be a guideline (or better an automated GUI test) to ensure functionality.  For these tests it would be great to have a sample database to use ~~or at least~~ and in addition dummy recipients and groups provided by the TS server that can be stressed.

column3: Feature request for TextSecure: Statistics for SMS
column4: As someone whith a limited amount of free sms per month it would be great to have a statistic of how many sms I send in the last month, or something similar. Normally I would use an additional app for this, but since TextSecure has it's own storage for sms (which is great, because it's encrypted) those apps won't work.  I know that this isn't a high priority feature but it would still be great to have it.  Kind regards David.

column3: ActionBar Icons change to dark color in dark theme
column4: As reported in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/pull/1635#issuecomment-62222759 the back arrow and the triple dot menu button switch to dark on the dark theme, when returning from a new activity(?)  ![unbenannt](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5326916/4961044/2a3eaa1c-66ca-11e4-8e40-6a4f95cc5590.png) ![unbenannt](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5326916/4961092/a516b5ae-66ca-11e4-94d7-bbbb78662c70.png)  This seem to happen only when you come back from an unthemed activity  like  - Configure MMS settings (pops up, when you want to attach something on an non TS registered  device without MMS settings) - Change passphrase (enable local encryption in settings)  but not if you press "Skip" in the TS registration activity opened from the green reminder?!  To verify my assumption I added DynamicTheme to PassphraseChangeActivity which seemed to helped. (I am aware that this activity is not fully themed yet. In fact I'm working on applying dynamic themeing were it's missing...)  **EDIT** coming back from submit debug also recolors the icons and yes, latest HEAD :)

column3: Warning when the "last resort" prekey is used (and forward secrecy is compromised)
column4: As far as I understand the protocol, a "last resort" prekey (that doesn't provide forward secrecy) is used for offline session establishment if all regular prekeys on the server have been used.  Are users warned if that situation occurs?

column4: As discussed and agreed on in #393. Fixes #393. Fixes #1131.

column3: Log is leaking phone number
column4: As already mentioned by @tinloaf in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/1351#issuecomment-40304548 the phone number is leaked in PushServiceSocket.java makeBaseRequest.  The line  ``` JAVA  Log.w("PushServiceSocket", method +  "  --  " + body); ```  leaks the recipient number to the a log entry like:  ``` 3834-3856/org.thoughtcrime.securesms W/PushServiceSocket﹕ PUT  --  {"destination":"+4XXXXXXXXXXX","messages":[{"body":"IgohB ... ```  Isn't this affected by the wiki entry "Be careful what you log!"?  Maybe   ``` JAVA Log.w("DatabaseFactory", "Updated body: " + body + " and part_count: " + partCount); ```  in DatabaseFactory.java onApplicationLevelUpgrade() is also affected. Didn't test.

column3: Incompatible with Google Nexus 7 LTE (2013)
column4: Are there any plans on the horizon to make the TextSecure app compatible with Nexus 7?

column3: sane fallback for media selection on exception
column4: Apparently some KitKat users can't handle the OPEN_DOCUMENT intent, so we can fallback to the older GET_CONTENT one and finally fail much more nicely if neither work.

column3: use https maven central
column4: Apparently it's been available since August.  http://central.sonatype.org/articles/2014/Aug/03/https-support-launching-now/ http://central.sonatype.org/pages/consumers.html#gradle

column3: fix doublure declaration of android.permission.WAKE_LOCK
column4: android.permission.WAKE_LOCK was delared twice and resulted in a build warning

column3: "Sleep of death" bug
column4: Android version: 4.4.2 Kernel version: 3.4.67 android@HTSVR11 #1 Phone: Wiko Highway Signs Version 8  I am not sure whether this is a TextSecure bug, but the first time I could reproduce it was the following scenario:  When turning the screen off having TextSecure open, I am unable to turn it on again. Android stops responding and seems to soft reboot after some time. This also happened sometimes when I received a new message while not having TextSecure opened and then turning off the screen.  I have had the same effect on an old Galaxy S1 with 4.4.x (Cyanogenmod) with almost no apps installed (but TextSecure). I have also tried replacing the SD card to no effect.  This never happened to me with older versions of Android. Does anyone know whether this is related to TextSecure or something completely different? Any hints are appreciated.

column3: Only initialise EmojiGrid when not in edit mode (fixes NPE in edit mode)
column4: Android Studio keeps showing this message:  ![](http://i.imgur.com/pVM3iz2.png)  Suppress initialisation of the emoji_grid_layout.xml when the EmojiDrawer is being used in a layout where the editor is shown, to prevent an NPE when an editor is being used.  // FREEBIE

column3: Upgrade android plugin to stay compatible with latest Android Studio
column4: Android Studio 0.6.0 requires the Android gradle plugin v0.11+, SDK Tools 19.1.0, and Gradle 1.12.

column3: thumbnail generation and disk caching
column4: and, as an aside, move generating preview thumbnails for drafts off the main thread

column3: use URLConnection for MMS because it's better
column4: Among other things, the code is actually maintained and it can handle things like HTTP redirects. Also you don't need to set instance-wide proxy settings to pipe a single connection.  I also added in more verbose logging to follow the code path better for future debug logs.

column3: Add number of messages to the notification number attribute
column4: Although not used by stock Android, many custom ROM's (and possibly OEM versions?) have a setting to display the "number" count of a notification overlayed on the status bar icon. Add support for this.

column3: Outgoing MMS preference
column4: Alternative implementation for #1374 Closes #769    Add outgoing MMS preference similar to the one for SMS   Change default preference to "ask before sending SMS/MMS"   Add "do not ask again" Checkbox to Fallback confirmation dialog   Bugfix: You were able to send SMS to non Textsecure users if you enable SMS Fallback but disable SMS to non Textsecure users

column3: Pass recipient references instead of their parceled objects
column4: Also move toward passing recipient ids as the longs they were born as instead of going back and forth from Strings.  This could also tangentially solve most of the issues with recipients not updating properly since they were cloned and marshalled into a Parcel. And, most importantly, this is a net :small_red_triangle_down: diff.  Fixes #2233, as recipient objects including their photos are no longer put into a parcel.

column3: Fix issue 2100: explain size limit for video attachments.
column4: Also fixed for audio attachments.  // FREEBIE

column3: All SMS messages to/from a contact shown as one conversation
column4: All SMS messages to/from a contact are shown as one conversation.  The user should be able to split these into multiple conversations.

column3: timestamp incorrect
column4: All SMS messages show 12/31/1969 as the sent time for me

column3: Enabled audio and video drafts
column4: All slide types do have an "image", therefore we need to switch the check order. Otherwise `addAttachmentImage` is called and throws `ConversationActivity_sorry_there_was_an_error_setting_your_attachment` as the draftType is marked as IMAGE though there is none. In that case the audio or video draft gets deleted.

column3: Enabled audio and video drafts
column4: All slide types do have an "image", changing the check order enables audio and video drafts.

column3: Add setting to hide avatars
column4: All of the avatars are the grey default guy for me, so I don't want it taking up space. I understand that adding settings = bad though, so if you don't want the feature that's fine. It's just something I wanted and a chance for me to start getting familiar with the code.  If you're interested in merging, I need to add a couple of things: 1. A listener to refresh the view when the setting is changed. Not sure how to do that at the moment, but I can work on that. 2. The avatar is shown in multiple places (e.g. when you start a new message and enter a number), so it should probably be hidden everywhere when the setting is enabled. 3. There should probably be a new way to pull up that contact window or something. It's not really something I use, but there might be people who want to hide the avatar but do want that ability.

column3: Contactlist order is weird
column4: All my contacts that start with a small character are sorted to the very end of the list.

column3: Bad encrypted messages with latest v3 master
column4: After upgrading my VM I was able to send messages, but didn't receive for a few minutes.  After those few minutes all messages were received, but as bad encrypted. (Even delivery receipts were shown as bad encrypted messages?!)  Had to manually end the session to make it work.  Self texting is not working. I was able to end the secure session, but then all new key messages are shown as corrupt.  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/edbb008e29162aec10de _destination ending on xxx34 are self texting_ As the log is quite long I guess the v3 build starts at about line 500

column3: Autoclose Secure Sessions after Uninstall
column4: After uninstalling TextSecure on one phone, the other phone still sends encrypted messages to it, which results in the phone receiving encrypted messages only. I'm not sure if there is a way of notifying key-exchanged partners about the uninstall but maybe this is of interest to the developers.

column3: Show same timestamp in overview like in messages
column4: After this commit: "Display send date for incoming messages" 7ceaf59bccbbf2bddba80dc17d4c9fdb01a3d95f  There are two different timestamps used. In the overview the "received date" is shown, as in the conversation thread, like the changelog already says, the "send date" is shown.  The different views should use the same values.

column3: add + to blank avatar to clarify that you can add to contacts
column4: After setting up a couple of people with TextSecure, we were all stumped that TextSecure did not have a way to add a new phone number to a Contact.  We tried everything we can think of and no luck.  So I decided to file a bug report, and found #822 then explored a bit more, and found that you can add an unknown number as a contact by clicking the blank avatar icon.  This was not intuitive but I think it can be greatly improved by a simple fix: add a + to the blank avatar icon if clicking it will trigger the "add to contacts" sequence.

column3: Can't send/receive messages (SMS/MMS/PUSH) aka xprivacy problems
column4: After recent TextSecure updates I'm unable to send SMS. Logs: http://hastebin.com/zoqipateno

column3: encrypted backup shows only undecryptable messages after import
column4: After my TS was stuck with incoming invisible messages, which stopped me from sendin and receiving anything (will open another bug for this), i exported  an encrypted backup, then wiped the ts data from the android apps settings, when opening ts i entered a new (the same as before) password and imported the backup.  All looked perfect at the first glance... just all my messages were unable to decrypt, plus those lost messages were in the right senders bin, but marked as not belonging to any conversation...  Is there a way to restore this backup with all the messages decrypted?  The crap is, that also a plaintext backup doesnt restore. I think there exists a closed bug that might fit about some unicode issues.  I would be quite happy, if i could get my data back!  Ts is latest from play store on a samsung i9070 on JB 4.1.2.  I hope @moxie0 can do some magic for me :-P

column3: use delivery receipts to show message received time for outgoing messages
column4: After long pressing on a message and selecting the info button, the message details are shown. This includes the sent and received times for incoming messages. For outgoing messages, in contrast, only one Sent/Received time is displayed, probably containing sent time.  Now that delivery receipts are implemented, it would be possible to display the received time for outgoing messages (by taking the sent time from the receipt). Or to make it more precise, let the receipt message piggybag the real received time.  This would make the user interface more consistent.  When this is rejected for some reasons, I suggest renaming the "Sent/Received" label for outgoing messages to "Sent" because this is what it really is about.

column3: MMS failure to send and receive recently
column4: After failing to send: http://hastebin.com/ifeletijik  After failing to download: http://hastebin.com/ivipoyakex  I tried with both group messages and picture messages. Neither seem to work either outgoing or incoming. Wifi status doesn't appear to affect this problem.   Samsung Galaxy S4, ATT with Android 4.4.2. I know of a few other cases of the same issue. An HTC One X and some kind of LG. I can get debug logs from them too or more detailed descriptions of their phone if needed.   Edit, confirmed on: Samsung Galaxy S4 ATT, Android 4.4.2 LG-E980, ATT, Android 4.4.2

column3: Images missing after import of encrypted backup
column4: After exporting an encrypted backup and importing it into TS on another phone, all sent and received images are gone. Though, TS data size has grown by the size of the backup.

column3: emojicons
column4: After all that freaking work, I discover a library exists already for the iOS emoji pack. Apache 2.0 license (https://github.com/rockerhieu/emojicon/blob/master/LICENSE).  At the very least, a start. Also removed preference to set smiley to enter key (will always be enter key) since there's now a persistent emoji toggle.

column3: After "Bad encrypted message", receiving my own messages echoed back at me
column4: After about a week of successful encrypted communications with a particular contact, I started receiving garbled messages. We both ended the secure session, _deleted the conversation_, and restarted it, at which point I got a "Bad encrypted message" error.  After ending this second (and apparently unsuccessful) secure session, we are communicating unencrypted and I am using plain sms (not push) messages.  When I send a message to said contact, I am (after a delay) receiving **my own message** echoed back as if the contact had sent it to me -- complete with a notification alert.  This has happened twice now. The first time my own message was echoed back 6 minutes after I sent it. The second time, 25 minutes afterward.  Here's my debug log: http://hastebin.com/nuhewuwunu

column3: Push receive issue after clearing Play Services Data. Other GCM dependent apps recover
column4: After a problem with localisation issues with google play, I followed some instructions by google to clear data on Google Play related services .   After that point I stopped receiving push notifications from textsecure. I could still send however!   I didn't make the connection for a bit, because other GCM reliant services continued to notify me. After uninstalling and reinstalling the app, everything worked as expected (with a new key).  [0] http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/42347/how-do-i-change-the-google-play-country

column3: no way to differ between authenticated / unauthenticated contacts
column4: AFAICS, textsecure uses some Kex based on DH which is effectively anonymous.  When I add a new contact, it immediately sells me the conversation as being secure, even when no fingerprint exchange or something like that has happened.  This basically makes the whole app and idea of encryption useless as anyone could MitM and I wouldn't notice, which is made even worse by the fact that I cannot even mark such contacts which I've manually verified to be verified (as it's e.g. known from OTR).  Actually I'd prefer an option that I can reject any contacts which I haven't verified.

column3: Notifications miss a category for Android 5.0 "Silent mode"
column4: Adding the MESSAGE category to notifications would allow TextSecure's notification as messages and even show up in silent mode if the user configured it to do so (settings -> sounds & notifications -> interuptions).  Details are in the closed PR #2155. To implement it, the support library has to be upgraded to v21 first.

column3: Added file locations to Import & Export functions
column4: Added the exact file locations and directories for the import and export functions. Saves first time users from uncertainty and searching as well as better transparency for all users of these functions. Adjusted the grammar and word order between import and export plaintext to be consistent between each other.

column3: Send TextSecure install link
column4: Added feature which is described in issue #1722. Added a menu entry "Send TextSecure link" which add a message and the google play to the message text box, so that the user can manipulate the message before sending.

column3: Fixed import/export theme bug
column4: Added DynamicTheme function to import/export to fix bug which displayed white theme in the import/export window when black theme was applied elsewhere. Should fix issue #1976

column3: Add preference to disable outgoing MMS
column4: Add a preference for completely disabling outgoing MMS. Separate control for SMS and MMS asking before sending. Set "ask before sending" as default. Rename "Allow outgoing SMS/MMS" to make clear that this option also effects MMS. Edit: Added "Do not ask again" checkbox to fallback confirmation dialog.  This commit should protect new users from accidentally sending expensive MMS.  Should close #769  ![outgoingsmsmms](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6969594/2713595/4c1dac06-c4e9-11e3-8203-a0eb51c15d7e.png)   I also thought about introducing a separate activity for MMS like the one for outgoing SMS but I think it is better to have those options at the same place. Maybe it would be good to rename all methods that effect both SMS and MMS to something like "isSmsMmsFallbackEnabled" but I did not want to make too many changes on the existing code.

column3: Don't rely on SMS delivery reports
column4: According to @liliakai (we spoke in the Freenode channel), TextSecure uses SMS delivery reports rather than issuing them itself. This allows a malicious service provider (or, depending on exactly how secure SMS is, anyone that happens to be nearby the recipient) to withhold|drop a message that was sent via SMS while issuing a successful delivery report, potentially resulting in [heated debates](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/1692#issuecomment-55861645) over messages that never actually arrived. To prevent this, TextSecure should issue its own (signed) delivery reports.

column3: [Feature request] Internal textsecure address book
column4: Ability to delete the SIM or android address book and the textsecure app still be able to show the name of whom I'm texting.  I'd love to be able to add a contact from textsecure and choose if I want it to be added to textsecure only as a nickname (for simple identification) or as a full contact in my address book.  There are a lot of people I might contact once or twice and don't really want to fill up my address book with.. let's say the guy who bought my car  The contact data to be held behind my passphrase in the textsecure database.

column3: Feature request: ability to change background image
column4: Ability to change background image would be nice to have.

column3: request: export transcript
column4: A way to export message threads would be fantastic. Timestamps and all, maybe even configurable formatting if someone would want to spend the time on it.

column3: Add privacy mode for notifications
column4: A very simple change that allows the user to hide the sender and message body from notifications.  This should also implement the first part mentioned in #308

column3: Single line message with number cannot be selected
column4: A message that consists of a single line with a phone number cannot be selected in a conversation. Each time I try to select the message the selection is interpreted as a click on the number so it jumps to the phone application.

column3: Message received multiple times
column4: A Message i sent to one of my contacts on the 6th of October gets resend every now and then. My contact keeps receiving "Bad encrypted Message" from this date and time.  Don't know if the logs are helpful here, but just in case: http://hastebin.com/otokudowol http://hastebin.com/ocevirusuw

column3: Enable vibration for In-thread notifications
column4: A friend of mine found a bug in [MessageNotifier.java](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/339193af12fc81946eda4baba1877e5eace80262/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/notifications/MessageNotifier.java#L242):  If the options "In-thread notifications" and "Vibrate" are activated the phone vibrates and rings just fine unless you are in the thread that has a new message. In that case only the ringtone is played, but the phone doesn't vibrate.

column3: Secure session isn't ended when Bob stops using TS
column4: A friend of mine could never get TS secure to work on their Huawai Android 4.3 system. I had exchanged some messages with them. After they uninstalled TS on their phone, my TS kept thinking they were using TS and kept sending all messages as encrypted.  I.e. they always got garbled text instead of the message.  I had to select 'End Secure Session' to stop this. The latter should happen automatic somehow.

column3: Messages not directly delivered when recipient has TextSecure but data connection disabled
column4: A friend has TextSecure but deactivates the data connection oftentimes during the day. Since I can’t tell when it’s active or not on their side (and I’m too lazy / I forget), I always send via data. This results in the messages not being delivered until said friend activates the data connection again (even though they have normal cell connection, so a text would go through).  I’m pretty sure this is a known problem but I couldn’t find an existing issue for it. Also not sure if it’s possible to solve or an underlying architectural problem.  I was thinking something like: If the push message isn’t delivered in 10 minutes, automatically re-send it via text and delete the push message from the queue. If that’s possible.

column3: [DONT MERGE] Make Transport Selection Persistent (Follows #2289)
column4: A follow-on from #2289, allowing for transport selection to be persistent.  However there's some weird race condition behaviour going on with retrieving the thread from the `ThreadDatabase` to get the transport, and I haven't been able to narrow it down. I've left in some print statements.  **WARNING:** If you run this, i makes changes to DB.

column3: Receiving vcards with images crashes Textsecure and makes it unusable.
column4: A contact of mine sent me a vcard that contained an image via MMS. Textsecure downloaded it and displayed the whole ASCII encoded image as text which slowed down the app to the point where it crashed.  Textsecure was not usable until i managed to delete the MMS (on the 5th try it did not crash).  This could be used as some kind of DOS attack i think. Please include some kind of safeguard.

column3: [Proposal for a registration improvement] When registering a tablet w/o SMS functions and using temporarily a second SMS enabled device: allow to manually enter the six-digit code during step 2
column4: _With reference to #1397 and after  a discussion with @generalmanager I like to propose this small UX change during the registration step 2 (when the silent sms is used to register the device's number)._ - Current situation:  During Step 2, the registration currently waits for 2 minutes to receive the (first) registration SMS. This registration obviously fails in the case that the device (e.g. a tablet without SMS/MMS functions) is unable to receive SMS. If the user has a different device e.g. a smartphone with their SIM card and SMS/MMS enabled, they receive the first code on this device.  After the timeout the first code is not valid any longer. The user can manually trigger the TS server to send a second six-digit-code via the Code-by-Voice-call function, and then enter the second code to finish the registration on their tablet. - My suggestion (TOFU-compliant):  In oder to comply with the trust-on-first-use (TOFU) principle and to avoid the abvove mentioned second registration cycle by voice (in the case of a tablet without SMS/MMS function) I suggest a **code change to allow the entering of the six-digit-code already during the first cycle**.   I mean this:  - already during registration step 2 - while the device waits for 2 minutes to receive the first verification code in a silent SMS - users should be _able_ to enter the (first) code manually in case they are in possession of it because they received it on their other, SMS/MMS-enabled phone device.  In my view this appears to be possible, and does not break the workflow, or introduces security threats. - Advantages 1. Less registration codes need to be sent, lowering the number of "registration failures during step 2" (when the device cannot receive SMS, but the SMS was sent to another device of the user) 2. much easier and quicker registration for tablet users, because the timeout does not matter any more: user cann immediately enter the code in the first cycle (TOFU)

column3: in landscape mode the send button does not indicate encryption
column4: _observed behavior_: When flipping the phone while composing a TextSecure message such that landscape mode gets activated, the send button does not indicate whether the message will be secured. (I.e. a gray button with the text 'Send' is displayed.)  When not typing (no keyboard displayed), everything is fine.   _expected behavior:_ A colored send button with a padlock indicating whether the message will be encrypted is displayed while typing. (Just as when not in landscape mode.)  _possible solutions:_ Can TextSecure modify the Android landscape keyboard? If yes, then the send button should be adapted. If not, maybe collapse the keyboard instead of sending when in landscape mode? That way, the TextSecure send button would be displayed (and would have to be pressed to actually send the message). While not ideal, this should at least avoid accidentally sending unencrypted messages.

column3: Vodafone: CallYa Toppings not redeemable
column4: [![CallYa Toppings](http://toppings.vodafone.de/img/topping-fb.jpg)](http://toppings.vodafone.de/)  Hi there TextSecure developers, @moxie0 and all you funky freaks of the GitHub community, let me first say that I still love TextSecure and keep using it until encrypted SMS are vanishing.  Now to the Issue several friends of mine and I do have:  For the ones that do not use [CallYa Toppings](http://toppings.vodafone.de/), here is a short explanation: CallYa Toppings is a bonus program for **prepaid** users, which is offered by Vodafone when recharging the prepaid card. Selectable toppings: Free minutes, free SMS or free surf-flats. The longer a prepaid user is using the same prepaid card from Vodafone, the more Toppings this user will get.  The usual redeeming process is the following: 1. When recharging the card, Vodafone sends an SMS from number `22990` to show available Toppings. 2. (through sending the word `AUSWAHL` to `22990` a user can change the available Topping) 3. The Prepaid user has to claim the selected Topping with sending the word `TOPPING` to `22990`. 4. Another SMS with a verification of successful claim is being sent to the user from number `22919`.  **The Issue:** When sending `TOPPING` to `22990`, my friends and I just get an SMS from number `22919` that the booking code is "wrong" and that we shall check it and try again. I've been in a huge fight with the Vodafone customer service, called them at least 10 times, have ruined their shops over here in Germany, wrote multiple heavy complaints to them and was really upset - until my girlfriend noticed that this Issue appeared since we've been using TextSecure. To verify this, I've used the standard SMS application - and there it works flawlessly. Through the standard SMS app, Vodafone recognizes the selection and grants it.  **Questions:** Does TextSecure add special characters to each SMS or modify normal SMS even though sending them unencrypted through the network? Or does Vodafone recognize that I'm using TextSecure and does not want to grant access to the Toppings for users where they can't spy on their SMS?  If there are things to test, data to collect or anything else to resolve this, please let me know.

column3: Per contact settings storage
column4: @moxie0 It seems that a per contact user setting storage may be a good idea for the future, as feature implementations such as per contact notification sounds continue to be implemented. Rather than see this fragmented across many different type specific databases it would seem creating a generic db for this task may be desirable. Would you agree?  I have made some modifications that would require this type of storage as well for implementing a MRU (most recently used) transit type for messages instead of automatically defaulting to Push. But before creating yet another database in the factory I wanted get your opinion on the matter.

column3: sms
Key exchange via QR Code
column4: 2 users without network coverage should be able to exchange keys via OCR  Easy way: First user shares new symmetric key via QR Code Second user picks up symmetric key for QR Code Then users can use the shared key to encrypt future messages  More secure way: First user share public key via QR Code Second user picks up public key and uses it encrypt a shared symmetric key Second user generates QR Code with encrypted symmetric key First user scans the QR Code to complete the key exchange

column3: MMS image mixed at recipient, sent by third person (not TextSecure user)
column4: 1. Person A sent encrypted MMS image to Person B. 2. Person B received it and deleted MMS with correct A's image. 3. Person C, who was not involved in communication between Person A and Person B and is not using TextSecure, sent unencrypted MMS to Person B the following day. When Person B opened it an image of Person A, deleted previous day, appeared in a thumbmail of MMS from Person C. 4. When Person B opened this image in other application, correct picture of Person C appeared.  A bug again?

column3: contact numbers visible in task manager
column4: 1. Open textsecure 2. Press "+" to create a new conversation. 3. Tap home key to do some other activity.  4. Long-press home key. 5. Notice contact list with phone numbers showing.    Probably not the end of the world but typically the app shows a blank screen for security purposes and this current behavior didn't fit what I thought was the current paradigm. My feelings won't be hurt if this gets closed our anything. Just hoping to help ferret out the bugs. Long live Textsecure!

column3: Some (minor) group UI issues
column4: 1) wrong ActionBar title: - open an existing group - select update group - ActionBar correct title: "Update Group: _some groupname_" - leave the activity by locking the screen, adding a member or adding an avatar - when you return to the group settings the action bar title now is: "New Group"  2) The default group avatar is not circle cropped, in the settings activity. Edit: fixed many commits ago Edit 2: unfixed lately  3) Leaving the group settings with the check mark - without effectively changing something (name, members, avatar) - leads to a group update broadcast. This is distracting for the receivers when nothing has changed.  4) ~~Group conversation recipients dialog allows tapping a contact to highlight it shortly. is there any reason for that? Planned features maybe?~~ fixed  5) An avatar can not be changed back to default

column3: group and contact list fixes
column4: 1) Updating a group without changing the avatar will keep that    avatar  2) Prohibit adding non-push users to an existing push group  3) Add Android contacts to the same database. Takes a small amount    more time and memory, but allows queries to not be a hack, and    enables us to dedupe numbers in JB and higher devices.  Memory testing with my decently large contacts list only showed the SQL database taking up about 150k memory, so not much of an increase. Tested on GB as well, and the fallback to the non-normalized number appears to work just fine.

column3: Attachment crash (Reproducible)
column4: 1) Take a screenshot of your screen in android 2) Open TextSecure and select any contact. 3) Add attachment -> Picture -> Select the above screenshot 4) Hit back -> Notice "saved draft" 5) Select the same contact. 6) Crash.  The draft message is deleted and doesn't cause a crash loop.

column3: Implement delivery receipts.
column4: 1) Support a "receipt" push message type.  2) Identify messages by timestamp.  3) Introduce a JobManager to handle the queue for network    dependent jobs.

column3: Fixes for outgoing SMS/MMS direct and fallback behavior.
column4: 1) Correct MMS fallback settings.  2) Prevent SMS/MMS messages from leaking out under certain    circumstances when they shouldn't.

column3: replace unlocalized 'at' in message details date
column4: ...with a dash  Making this a string resource has the potential for crashes. Leaving it out completely is a little confusing. The dash is the perfect solution - until a better date formatter is used.

column3: Changes filtered conversation thread database query to account for group...
column4: ...s  Fixes #1954  I go into discussion on this fix (and an alternative) in some depth in the issues ticket:  https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/issues/1954  I've tested this fix on Motorola Atrix 2 running 4.0.4, verified first that searching doesn't show groups, and then that after this fix they show up in a search.   The crux of this is bug is that the thread db search uses an equals operator to query and individual recipientIds are a substring in the case of a group recipientId, for which equals does not match.

column3: Wrong message details for the case that user denied SMS fallback usage
column4: - version 2.0.6  These wrong message details are currently shown in the special case that a PUSH failed and the SMS send failed or was user denied:  ``` Transport: SMS Sent/Received:   ``` #### How to reproduce - deactive WiFi/Internet data network connection - have TS settings like that:   - "Allow outgoing SMS to TS users" (yes)   - "Ask before sending SMS" (yes)   - "Non-TextSecure users (yes) - try to send a message to one of your known TS users - notice that this message cannot be sent with  "PUSH" - notice the small infobox "Tip for SMS fallback" below the message - click "Tip for SMS fallback" - deny the confirm question "Fallback to SMS?" - notice the wrong message details (long-click onto the message) as shown above  A correct message detail text should be _something_ like my proposal  ``` Transport: The message could not be sent for the following reasons: PUSH failed at  . User denied SMS fallback at   or SMS transmission failed. ```

column3: Extracted group strings for translation + minor tweak for outgoing update
column4: - translations were not possible for group emphasis - outgoing updates where shown as "... joined the group. Title is now ..." rather than "Group updated.". Translators should mind that there can be one or many recipients that have joined.  (I'm working on that (my) evil commit/merge/push issue)

column3: Extracted group strings for translation + minor fix for outgoing update
column4: - translations were not possible for group emphasis - outgoing updates were shown as "... joined the group. Title is now ..." rather than "Group updated". Translators should mind that there can be one or many recipients that have joined!

column3: New encrypted export
column4: - switch to xstream for serialization and deserialization - use our own custom file format for encrypted backups  file format:  ``` 4 byte header length header (serialized EncryptedBackupHeader protobuf) encrypted xml contents with messages and identity key ```  importing flow: User types in password of backup, decrypts and inserts messages into db and replaces identity key. Removes all existing session state data. If user is TS registered, they will be unregistered and then prompted with registration once again.

column3: translatable msg details: status format strings (not yet timestamp format string which will be done in a separate commit)
column4: - strings for the message details allow i10n/i18n - transport method strings ("PUSH", "MMS", "SMS") - transport status ("pending") - #562 partial fix: additional new lines in message details to improve readabilty - ~~localization of the timestamp string~~  [UPDATED: removed the localization for the timestamp]

column3: Added L10n for notification and on first unlock activity
column4: - RoutingActivity now uses DynamicLanguage. This is needed to set the locale for the first unlock activity which uses the system locale up to now.  - by adding DynamicLanguage to RoutingActivity and by adding refreshNotification - that is called when the locale gets changed - the notification is always shown in the chosen language  discussion is welcome

column3: media preview fixes
column4: - Load Bitmaps asynchronously instead of lag on the main thread for sometimes more than a second, oops. - Never load bitmaps that exceed the device's supported max texture width/height. This stops crashes when previewing images that are received or sent which exceed these device constants. - Show an error message in place of the image instead of a Toast, giving them chance to hit save before going back.

column3: limit displayed message length to 1024 characters.
column4: - limit displayed message length to 1024 characters. - added a "messageTooLongIndicator" that can be clicked to display the   full content of a truncated message  this should concern issues #2252 #2226 and  #2271 (and possibly more)  even though it does not resolve the problem of corruped messages, corrupted messages won't crash textsecure any more and it is possible to delete them  this also removes a possible DOS on a user's history with another user by sending a very long message that will crash on display and thus prevent scrolling back in history  logcat for the case of a too big message crashing TS:  ``` 01-04 14:18:57.523  14631-14642/org.thoughtcrime.securesms I/art﹕ [ 01-04 14:18:58.045 14631:14642 I/art      ]     Wrote stack traces to '/data/anr/traces.txt' 01-04 14:19:00.477  14631-14631/org.thoughtcrime.securesms A/libc﹕ new[] failed to allocate 296136 bytes 01-04 14:19:00.477  14631-14631/org.thoughtcrime.securesms A/libc﹕ Fatal signal 6 (SIGABRT), code -6 in tid 14631 (crime.securesms) ```  (content of /data/anr/traces.txt did not seem too interesting to me but if requested, I can provide it)

column4: - enter existing conversation - delete all messages - ~~right~~(at least it sounds similar) write a new one  - exit conversation   --> not in conversation list

column3: stringifying messages in Trimmer.java
column4: - enabling l10n/i18n of "Delete old messages..." messages  @moxie: I found that it was previously not possible to translate these "trimming" messages, here's my patch which enables this.

column3: improve some content descriptions
column4: - Contact photos didn't have a description - Send button didn't state the type of message that will be sent if clicked - Conversations just said "TextSecure" instead of the saying what the opened conversation is

column3: fixes #1407, sharing contact from the Contacts app
column4: - closes #1407 - TextSecure is listed when you share a contact via Contacts app - lets you choose a phone number, if there are multiple - copies just the phone number into a new message - new message is empty, if there is no phone number

column3: Clear attachments on reselection
column4: - as we only show the FIRST attachment per message, we also should only send one attachment   (not sure about sending, but code looks as if all attachments gets sent) - changing for example a video to an image or an audio was also not working, as the first attachment persists - avoid sending wrong attachments. reproduce like this:  Add text: "He mom thats me on holiday" Add attachment: "Me_on_Holly.jpg" _OMG, wrong attachment. Better change..._ (ignoring the delete button) Add attachment: "Me_on_holiday.jpg" _puh, that was close!_ send 😳_OMG²_ 😲   ---  I would not implement a "Do you want to change the attachment" button, to keep the UX. Also **I** never felt that more than one attachment is going out at once.  Works with drafts. Tested KK, but should also work on GB...

column3: Various bug fixes
column4: - Allow user to unset group avatar by long-clicking - Fix issues with GroupCreateActivity's title being set incorrectly - Downgrade some of the `Log.w`'s to more reasonable levels - Redo and optimize some of the group message update handling - Fix conversation list not updating after contacts getting updated

column3: crypto changes for exports
column4: - allow DecryptingPartInputStream to start reading from a specified offset in a file (to support headers, etc.) - allow EncryptingPartOutputStream to write in appending mode to a file instead of overwriting - "enhance" the getters and setters in IdentityKeyUtil and MasterSecretUtil to deal with getting MasterSecret objects from places other than SharedPreferences

column3: Updated license headers and copyright notices
column4: - Added missing headers - Updated dates 2013 to 2013-2014 - Updated "2011 Whisper Systems" to 2011-2012 - Changed Copyright from Moxie to Whisper Systems  Fixes #1570

column3: Version number added to preferences
column4: - a fair and minimalistic approach (minimal number of changes) to only add the version number to the existing preferences screen. No new "About application" activity.

column3: robolectric testing
column4: **UPDATE:** instead of moving our entire source (would be hell for merges and PRs I'd imagine), I modified the robolectric plugin to allow custom sourceSet specification, reliant on https://github.com/WhisperSystems/maven/pull/5. We can still go back to moving the source to match what Android expects by default if we'd prefer this and using the stock Robolectric plugin instead, but this is much more unobtrusive.  So this was a major pain in the ass because of Android's tools team not wanting to make life easy for testers. Unfortunately the robolectric plugin doesn't appear to support specifying test directories outside of the default android locations, so I moved our source folders to match what Android recommends project layouts look like.  This PR is up for commentary on if this is a good idea or not, it may be too painful to justify but this seems to really be the only way to have tests that are TravisCI-friendly and don't require us to have a device plugged in.   The other option is I can submit a PR to the robolectric plugin and we can wait for that to get pulled upstream (and roll our own for the time being if we want this in quickly).

column3: SMS not sent from a person that has data connection to the other that does not have data
column4: **Scenario**: - Both A & B have previously established secure connection using TextSecure, and were able to communicate (they both would see blue messages with lock sign) - Person A has data turned on - Person B does not have any data connection, but has regular phone signal  **Issue**: When A sends a message to B, A sees a blue message with lock sign on, but B never receives that message.  B **only** gets the messages sent by A when B turns data connection **on**.  However, when B sends a message to A, both A & B sees a lock sign next to the message.  **Requesting Solution**: Please make the TextSecure fall back on the SMS connection so B receives text messages from A even when B doesn't have any data connection (secure would be great, but even if the message arrives unsecure, still better).  Thanks a bunch.

column3: fix old code breaking build
column4: (oops)

column3: Search Message Text
column4: 'Search' option should also search the message content.

column3: Fix user-facing helping term 'insecure' to 'unsecured'
column4: 'Insecure' implies an uncertainty of intention or confidence. Unsecured is more specifically addressing the protocol which wraps the message delivered. This struck me immediately while feeling particularly vulnerable and texting someone with whom I experienced real-life drama, and I'm guessing this applies to many 'personal' text messages. Related to #1337 but the term 'unsecured' was never brought up.

column3: Option to disable trailing whitespaces
column4: ##### Problem:  TextSecure apparently uses trailing whitespaces in text messages. This makes it impossible to use with certain telco-services which rely on exact SMS-based short codes/activation codes. ##### Requested solution:  Please provide a way to disable trailing spaces (even at the expense of secure data messaging). In addition to that you could perhaps consider disabling it (as a sane default) for numbers with up to a few (e.g., 4) digits. ##### Related to:  Issue #304

column3: move log submission to new library
column4: ### outline - SubmitLogFragment can be included in any project to report device logs to a hastebin-compatible endpoint as specified by the activity. Activity must implement the proper interface methods to handle success/failure/cancel cases. - Basic data scrubber to remove potentially sensitive info by default. ### todo - maven repo and maybe separate git repo? should talk about plan for modularizing code. - more configuration options as needed, good for now i think. - work out how translations will work with subprojects

column3: New APN database
column4: ## apntool - Imports Google-provided apns xml file (found in Android and Hangouts app) - Creates a gzipped easily-queried, legacy-friendly SQLite database - `./gradlew -q updateApnDatabase` to re-run and copy over the new asset ## ApnDatabase - Use SQLiteAssetHelper to gunzip from assets and version control the database   - DB version is set to Google's xml file version for easily tracking when we need to update - Lookup MMSC info with the following priorities:   1. Try to get relevant MCC+MNC from multiple places in order of probability of it being correct   2. If MCC+MNC was available, also try to get APN name via the MMS `NetworkInfo`'s `extraInfo` string.   3. If no matching MMSCs were found including APN name, try without the APN (old behavior)
